Reviews.Title: “3rd time and still as good”
Reviews.Author: sulby
Reviews.Content: If any body is worried about staying here now its been taken over, don't be. This was our 3rd time staying at this hotel, previous two times it was a fairfield hotel. Staff were all very helpful. Room had been decorated, asked for one of the top floor was given on. Very quite. Room was very clean. Breakfast was good too. waffle making machines now and they had biscuits and gravy each morning. Toast, muffins, doughnuts etc. Love this hotel and so pleased it hasn't been spoilted. Would difinitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Blah hotel in decent location”
Reviews.Author: christinagnj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after planning a last minute trip to Orlando and our 'usual place' was unavailable. There is nothing seriously wrong with this hotel, but everything about it is just blah. The hallways feel very hot and musty. Our room was clean enough but something about it still felt a little icky. Nothing was really nice in the hotel - just outdated looking and blah. The bed was very comfortable and clean. There is ample free parking. Good location near International Drive, though it's VERY difficult to get in and out of Canada Ave. onto Sand Lake at certain times of day. We visited in March and had loads of teenagers in the hotel. One night around 10 pm we heard dozens of teens frolicking in the pool and it woke both of our kids up. Great!!! Breakfast was good enough but nothing spectacular. For the price I can't really complain, but I've stayed at other places in the same price range and they were much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “I have finally found THE place to stay in Orlando!!!!”
Reviews.Author: akwareus24
Reviews.Content: This is without a doubt the best place we have ever stayed in Orlando. It is perfectly located, just minutes from everything. The staff is exceedingly professional, courteous and helpful. We stayed in Orlando for the weekend to celebrate my guy's birthday. We checked in on a Friday night and out on Sunday. The rooms, lobby, elevators and corridors were clean and well kept. The beds were the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on in a hotel!! That was a refreshing change from the last time we were in Orlando and stayed at the Best Western Orlando Gateway. (Don't do it!!!) The breakfast was great and just what we needed to get our day started. Hard boiled eggs, 3 kinda of mini muffins, bagles, waffles, fresh fruit, sausage gravy & biscuits, sausage, juices and coffee. The pool was soooo refreshing after a day of being around town. On our first night there was a water problem with the room above us, not something that was in their control. Francisco at the front desk had us packed up, in another room and unpacked before I could wipe the sleep from my eyes. He was beyond helpful!! This will be the place we stay from now on when we are in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice when it was Fairfield staying again this year great for location and quietness and free breakfasts are a bonus. Just hoping Quality hotels put safes in rooms instead of security boxes at front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Well run hotel, very good value!”
Reviews.Author: elleHampshire
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 14 days starting 26th Feb. We booked it whilst it was a Marriot hotel and it changed ownership before our arrival. I was a little worried about this but need not have been. We Stayed in a Disney hotel last year and were very pleased with that but for half the price the Quality Inn and Suites proved such value for money. My only fault would be the noisy air conditioning. We couldn't sleep with it on and it was a little too warm with it turned off. Other than that we were totally pleased with our stay. The hotel is not posh but everything is in good working order, clean and tidy and the staff are friendly and do an excellent job. Being on Canada Drive is a plus as it's very quiet for sleeping and only a 5 min walk to International Drive over a grassed area along side the hotel. Use the I-Ride Trolley to get everywhere. No need for a car as a 2 week ticket only cost 17 dollars and you can use it for your whole stay as many times as you like! The hotel has a shuttle to Universal Studios at 8.10 am and 2 return journeys that change times each month...ours were 7.00pm and 8.25pm. If you want to go at different times you can get the I- Ride to Wet & Wild, cross the road and walk over the bridge and you are at the Bus and Taxi rank. This walk takes 10-15 mins on a big path on a flat road, it's easy. The I- Ride starts at 8.00am and finishes at 10.30pm and goes to the Premium outlets, north and south. You can also get to Seaworld and Aquatica plus so many shops and places to eat. The driver will tell you which stop to get off if you want to catch a link bus to Disney World, I think it was stop 29. So no need to pay car hire costs, insurance, petrol and parking fees...it's a brilliant service and the wait is never more than 20 mins. Sometimes you may have to stand. Back to the hotel now!!!!! Our room was quite plain but comfortable and well equipped. It was all in perfect working order and cleaned every day to a good standard. Flat screen TV, Coffee maker, Ironing board and Iron, Toiletries plus plenty of room and 2 lovely big beds that were really nice to sleep on. The breakfast was well organized and plentiful. There were cereals, juices, mini doughnuts and muffins, bread, bagels, cream cheese, jams, cold boiled eggs, biscuits and sausage gravy, yogurts, bananas, apples, oranges and make your own waffles and syrup. There was also a microwave oven and 2 toasters. Tea, Coffee and Hot Chocolate were available all day in the breakfast room. Safety deposit boxes were free of charge in the reception. 2 computers were also free of charge by the reception area. There was also a laundry room which we did not use. The pool and garden area were always very clean and had a nicely heated pool and a very warm hot tub. Enough sun beds for everyone and clean towels by the gate. It was nice and relaxed by the pool as hardly anyone used it and you could nip in and get a Coffee as and when you wanted one. A few trees and plants around the hotel and pool but not many. The staff were always polite and cheerful and ready to help with any questions, couldn't fault them. If on a budget or not, this hotel is a great choice. If you want to spend double then go to the Port Orleans as we did last year. We got what we paid for at both hotels and would recommend. We saw a leaflet at the hotel saying that it was going to soon become a Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: ecarley
Reviews.Content: You can definitely tell this is a former Fairfield- very nice grounds, pool, breakfast area, etc. It is a great value for the Quality Inn price! Being off just off I-Drive was nice: very close to everything, but without the traffic and noise. Quick run straight up Universal Blvd to the park. Here's a hint for Universal though: If you want to get in the gate first thing, don't use the shuttle service at the hotel. On the day we were checking out, we saw guests loading the shuttles at 9am, when the park was opening. Spend the $15 for parking and get there on time.

Reviews.Title: “Average but clean and inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: MNHoneymooner
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night hotel stay as part of a package with Universal Studios (we went to Island of Adventure). The price was great, it was one of the cheaper hotel options, and the reviews I had read here on TA were great. This hotel is pretty basic, but it is clean, the staff was friendly, it was in a convenient location, and breakfast was included. The free breakfast included make-your-own waffles, biscuits & gravy, bagels, fruit, yogurt, cereal/milk, coffee and juice. We would grab some food to go (you can bring snacks/food into Universal and Magic Kingdom) and eat on the way to the parks. It made for a good start to the day. We bought bottled water at one of the many nearby liquor stores and refilled those at the parks, too. The pool looked nice but we didn't have time to use it. There was a musty smell to our room/hallway, but the a/c helped eliminate that. There is a free shuttle to Universal but with our package we were able to get in an hour early than general park hours and the shuttle was much later than that. So we drove instead, no big deal. This is a great hotel choice if you are on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “nice place for a quick get away”
Reviews.Author: tomiebb
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and i stayed there for 2 nights we choose it because of the proximity to island of adventure/ universal studios the price and the good reviews from our travel agent. the staff was very nice and efficient. we were able to get an upgrade to a king suite. breakfast was a bit mediocre but it was enough to get the day started. wish the room had those super thick curtains because on their was a lot of light coming in early in the morning and the best thing about hotels are those very thick curtains that you have no idea what time it is outside. overall we enjoyed the hotel and the room.

Reviews.Title: “AS GOOD AS EVER”
Reviews.Author: Shirlshubby
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel, the first since it was taken over by the Quality Inn chain. Rooms were very clean and the staff friendly and helpful. IMO the complementary breakfast is now better than when this was a Fairfield Inn, with cereals, fruit, waffles, breads and pastries all available. Will use this hotel again when we next go to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - musty smell and dodgy sofabed let score down”
Reviews.Author: Hampshire4
Reviews.Content: We (family of 4) arrived in Orlando at about 6pm - collected our car from Alamo and headed off. Could not find hotel. I-Drive has a lot of roads/hotels leading onto it and it is so easy to drive past the one you need. Anyway, finally arrived at hotel to a good welcome. Given room key and off we went - King Suite, room 307, 3rd floor, view towards Pirates Dinner. First thing we noticed was the musty smell in the lan1ding, then the musty smell in the room. Next, we checked the sofa bed - not at all good and not useful to sleep on (matress too thin and ripped). Youngest child slept on cusions off sofabed on bedroom floor and eldest shared bed with us. Not ideal, but as the hotel was only somewhere to sleep rather than be entertained, it did. Two TVs in suite but only one used. Breakfast - lots of choice - make your own waffles (my fav), yoghurts, scones (biscuits if you are American), sausage gravy (again - for the Americans), different breads to toast in toasters, cold boiled eggs, mini cakes, two different types of cereal each day, porridge and lots of fruit. Also, milk and juice to drink. Tea/coffeee/hot chocolate available 24/7. Pool good size and each time we used it, we were the only people there so it felt like a private pool! Short cut through grass area gets you to I-Drive. Loads of places to eat - Ponderosa is really good value, just make sure you are hungry - also Chilis, Perkins, McD, BK, Chuck E Cheese (the kids begged us to go there, not my choice), Dennys, Wild Jacks etc. Staff in each eatery very polite - UK take note. I-Ride trolly goes up and down I-Drive, $1.25 for adults and kids under 12 free per paying adult. We went to outlet stores using the I-Ride to make the journey a bit more fun for the kids. Walmart few mins away - loads of Disney stuff for sale which is so much cheaper than Disney and Disney outlet shops. Disney/Universal/Seaworld all within 20 mins driving time. Won't go into too much detail, but kids keep asking when we can go back - says it all really. All in all, if they were to do up the hotel and lose the musty smell we would definitely go back. If the staff read this - Manny hope all goes well with your new baby - and thank you all for being so nice.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: jsmalls67
Reviews.Content: I went here with my 2 boys. We stayed for 5 days in a King Size Suite which had a separate living room area with its own TV and pull out bed. My older boy was able to have a little area to himself. It was a great value and very conveniently located to Universal Studios and Sea World. Free parking and free breakfast (although basic) added to the value. When we arrived, the hotel was just being converted to a Quality Inn and Suites from Fairfiled Inn and Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Good value off international drive... musty smells...”
Reviews.Author: Gord_Mtl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just one block off of International drive. It's less than a 5 minute walk to International drive if you go through the field across the street and through the strip mall. International drive is where you will find all the restaurants and touristy souvenir shops. I give this hotel a 4/5 mainly because of the price. It was priced quite a bit lower than other hotels right on the drive. The rooms are a good size and there is plenty of free parking available. The hotel offers a free continental breakfast in the morning and also has free wifi. The breakfast is pretty basic but enough to get you going in the morning. There are plenty of fast food/casual type of restaurants nearby to the hotel. If you go along International Drive towards the direction of the convention center you'll find much better restaurants and if you are up for it you can just walk from the hotel. My one complaint about the hotel is that there is awful musty smell in the corridors and in the rooms. I was there at the end of January and I'm guessing at that time of year the air conditioning in the building isn't turned on all the time causing this awful smell in the building. The smell in the room got better once the air conditioning in the room got turned on. I didn't end up going to the parcs on this trip so I can't really comment on the shuttle services etc...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for 5 nights”
Reviews.Author: Salibha
Reviews.Content: Great location near Universal/Seaworld, walking distance to International Drive. Lot of restaurants including McD/Chillis nearby. The hotel is very clean and the cleaning staff change towels and arrange bed/room every day. Wi-Fi was working good and the morning complimentary breakfast was also great - it included waffles/doughnuts/bagels/biscuit-gravy/coffee/juices/hard-boiled eggs/toast. The waiting staff ensured that food was hot and always there on the serving table. Great hotel for long stays. I got the hotel for a good deal for 50$ a night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, all around.”
Reviews.Author: DiversNH
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Disney and/or Universal Studios, stay here! The price is excellent, an the hotel is wonderful. Decent breakfast, nice pool, great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great value to stay food ok....”
Reviews.Author: Filiair418
Reviews.Content: Me and wife stayed before at the fairfiel inn chain before and it was to par for the brand...the only negative was the breakfast. Eggs more wet than scrambled....coffee way to hot and diluted. On the plus side great staff and ressourcefull. Will use this hotel again in future trip to Orlando

Reviews.Title: “Excellent would defiantly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Linda G
Reviews.Content: Me my husband and 3 children stayed at the Fairfield inn for 3 weeks from 27th sept to the 18 th oct 2011 and we absolutely loved it the staff were all very friendly and very helpful they couldn't do enough for you the rooms were very clean and the cleaners always did a fantastic job the maintenance man was out several times through out the day checking the pool area was clean and today and filtered the pool every night while guests were asleep.I would defiantly recommend this hotel to anyone I will defiantly stay there again when I book it is situated just off international drive near the pirate show if you haven't been to international drive area before it is a short walk till you get onto international drive where all places to eat are fantastic place!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: Luciana O
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Universal Vacations, it has actually been sold by Marriott and is called Quality Inn now. You could see that they were doing some renovations and clean up. We stayed there for 3 nights, and felt the hotel was alright. The rooms were big, we had 2 beds but they weren't that big and you would sink in the middle. Service was OK too, we did not spend a lot of time in the hotel, but staff was very nice and helpful. The breakfast was great, they even had a waffle machine which we loved! As part of a package this was a great deal, at a very good price. But if booked separately would look for another options as well.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Place”
Reviews.Author: Mich67
Reviews.Content: This hotel takes my number one slot of the 6 we stayed in during our trip (4 in the US and 2 in the UK). Immaculately clean and comfortable, free wifi, fabulous bathroom, great staff, the most friendly we encountered by far. Pool, spa, gym, coin laundry room which was a great touch and helped make sure that for around $10 dollars in totla including powder, 2 wash loads and 2 drier loads that we went home without a heap of dirty washing. Fab complimentary breakfast, tea and coffee and drinks on tap all day and night in the lobby, ice machines on most floors and vending machines too. Great choice of TV channels if you fancy a night in if you have little kids or have had a long day in the parks. It cost us $25 in the Amtrak shuttle from Orlando station and in a taxi on the way back it cost us $36 so if you are travelling by Amtrak take the guy's card when he drops you off and arrange for him to take you back. Free shuttle to parks in the mornings leaves at 8.50am and takes about 20 mins as it picks up elsewhere on the way. Tickets for parks and attractions are available from Dave at the Best Western next door. He says he gives you best prices but we did find tickets cheaper on line, however he does give you the actual tickets so you can go right through when you arrive rather than waiting in will call queues or for assitance with a voucher. Taxi back from Universal parks and City Walk costs around $5. Taxi to Sea World cost us around $19 There are so many places to eat within sight of the hotel and great room service provided by a local grill restaraunt. There is a Walgreens on the same lot, a Burger King, Steak House/Bar, Chinese restaraunt and McDonalds across the street. Felt very safe and welcome in this hotel and the staff here should be used to show other hotels and establishments how good customer service is done. They were outstanding. I booked this last minute and got a great deal but would have happily paid more and will be back here in the summer for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Online reservations and check-in are two different rooms.”
Reviews.Author: fififarley
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation as I always to, online, when I book with Marriott. I am an elite points member and use Marriott almost everywhere I travel. Well, I booked my room which said it had a mini kitchen...there was no mention of a room with just a bed, no artwork, a mini fridge thrown in the corner and a smelly room. But that's what I was given when I checked in. I cannot believe, for someone staying 5 nights and paying for their stay that ANYONE would be given this hell hole of a room. NOT ONE PICTURE was on the wall. It reminded me of a bad horror movie room. I was so tired from diving and not feeling well (there to meet other people that shared my same disease) that I almost cried. So I had to go to the front desk and the kid (maybe 20 years old) said that's the room I booked. I had to laugh. I got on my phone, pulled up my reservation, showed the description of the room to him and asked if he could get me the manager. He signed, rolled his eyes and then got the manager. The manager didn't argue one minute. He knew they were wrong. I was then given the correct room, but it was the furthest from the elevator and I had mentioned in my reservation that due to being sick I needed something near the elevator. LOL, I guess they got me after all, huh? Needless to say I will NEVER stay at this hotel again. It's just sad that people can't read a reservation nor do they care to exert customer service. My reservation was made 3 months in advance, too. So there was no last minute fitting me in. I arrived at 3pm and not once was I rude or hostile. I was too tired and defeated to be anything but listless. The room I received was what I had reserved. It was not clean compared to the many other Marriott properties I have stayed in, but it wasn't horrible. Hopefully staff has changed and it's more pleasant now. There are over 100 hotels in that immediate area, so Marriott best shape up or they will lose more and more customers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, Great location.”
Reviews.Author: sazkebab
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 8 nights. The room was big, clean and well equipped. The free breakfast was great with good choice, although always busy and sometimes hard to find a table....don't loose sight on the word FREE. The pool was also a great bonus. This hotel was fantastic value for money all round. This hotel has a fantastic location just off International drive. We had a car for our time but walked everywhere on International drive so is in a great location with or without a car. So much to do, places to eat all within walking distance. Would recommend to couples and families looking for a clean hotel in the area......this place was so cheap I cannot think of anything negative to add. Would recommend and return here on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and clean amenities with extremely pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: Cheng Cheng T
Reviews.Content: We were very satisfied with our 3-day stay in this hotel which we found to give good value for money and offered comfortable lodgings with well-kept and clean amenities. The staff were friendly and gave us a free upgrade to a bigger room when they saw that we were a party of 4 (3 adults and 1 child) to get us more space. It is a comfortable walk to the park (15 minutes) for those who do not drive and definitely much quieter compared to the theme hotels (which are more expensive and filled with the overflow of crowds after the parks close). There are also affordable restaurants near the hotel (ask the reception) and a pharmacy/supermarket just next to it (Walgreens). Self-service free breakfast is also hearty. I would go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel with extremely small rooms”
Reviews.Author: FrqTrp
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during my leisure visit to Orlando when I was visiting Seaworld, Universal and Disney. This hotel is close to Seaworld but not so close that you can walk. But they have shuttle services to Seaworld at decent frequency(I guess, approx every 1 hour). However, their shuttle service to Universal is just once a day. :( The Room that I got was extremely small. I was there with my family and with such small room, I was disappointed. Being a Marriott Gold member, I was expecting an upgrade and a better room but I really got a bad room and I think all rooms in that hotel are like this. They offer free breakfast which is not too god but but not bad looking at the price of the hotel. Though, the price of this hotel is average, Marriott has placed this in category 4, that means, 20000 points if we pay by points which is too high for any Fairfield. (Marriott, do something about this, you are favoring non-members and penalizing members). They have a very small swimming pool which is basically not a swimming pool but a huge water tub good to relax. I was there in winters but I am sure kids will love that place in summers.

Reviews.Title: “Fairfield has been rebranded as Quality Inn”
Reviews.Author: Snowbird888
Reviews.Content: This is not a Fairfield anymore, and has been renamed to Quality Inn. The change seems to be too new, that not all signs are properly changed yet. Maybe because of the change of ownership, the rate we pay is almost half of what we would pay to a Marriott Hotel. The facilities, cleanliness, breakfast varieties and staffing are at a satisfactory level to me. The only complaint we have is the front desk staff, Louise, at our check-in was less than friendly and did never maintain eye contact when talking to you. On the other hand, the guy Fransico who did our check out was much more professional.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible overall”
Reviews.Author: mewosery
Reviews.Content: Booked this with the Seaworld package, got the buy 2 get 1 free offer. Did not enjoy our stay with the exception of the dining staff, who were friendly and very helpful. To start, when we checked in Saturday night, there were 3 other guests waiting to check-in, plus the family checking in, totaling 4 before I joined the line with ONE staff checking people in. Shortly after that 2 additional guests arrived as well. So this takes us to 7 check-ins pending. No help seemed to be available, even when the ONE staff called (3 times)â€¦tick tock tick tock, 15 minutes later before 2 additional employees arrived to help; I lost count on how many people was waiting to check-in. Time for check in was 1 hour. The rooms were mediocre, yes, it is a â€˜inn/suiteâ€™ type of hotel, but it was classified as a category 4 on the Marriott site, note the other inn/suite across the way is category 5. Towels were thinner than thin, almost see thru, bring your own. Breakfast, was the standard affair, the cooked food would be better if it was not overcooked. I found it funny that they would run out off certain foods, as though they didnâ€™t stock up enough for guests, especially for a theme park linked hotel. The staff in the dining area was extremely courteous and helpful. Housekeeping staff was rude and inefficient. We had no bath towels one day and then no face towels and shampoo the next, what a mess. We came back â€˜earlyâ€™ one day around 4PM and our rooms were not turned over yet. Housekeeping was down the hall and came running over to say that they would be there shortly, we declined as our little one was asleep and didnâ€™t want to be disturbed. We asked for towels and when given the towels, our housekeeping staff just stood there saying that they were the one who cleaned our rooms yesterday and how hot it was outside and how hard they are working, and then proceeded to stand there for a few more minutes, as if expecting a tip for giving us towels (note, we tipped the day before and generally tip every other day and on the day of check-out). I did not like this at all; never in all my travels, have I had this experience. Other upside was that it was near Seaworld and the offer of the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic budget option”
Reviews.Author: IronbarkACD
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel over a year ago, as part of a Virgin Holiday package, and were really looking forward to our hols. Unfortunately, just before our stay, it was sold to the Quality Inn, which worried me, and at that stage I noticed it's rating had dropped from 3.5 when booked, to 2.5. When we arrived, the hotel really presented an abandoned image, signage removed, empty carpark, and skeleton staff. This turned out to be a positive, as the location is very quiet, and there was never any trouble parking. We were kindly upgraded to a suite upon check-in, which gave us more room for our 11 night stay. The halls had a fairly musty smell, but our room smelled fine, it was clean, but quite dated. We had a very noisy air-con unit, and our window could be opened a small amount too. We had a king sized bed, large wardrobe, and large LCD TV in the sleeping area, and a desk, sofa, another LCD and a sound system in the sitting area. The bathroom had a shower and loo, plenty of hot water, and a separate sink is outside, opposite which was a fridge, coffee machine and microwave. The inclusive breakfast consisted of baked goods, donuts, bagels, bread, etc.. and you can make your own waffles. There is juice, milk, tea and coffee, a couple of types of cereal, yoghurt, and after a few days, apples, bananas and oranges. Lots of stodge, but the hotel is a short walk from Dennys, MacD's, and so on, if you fancy a change. There is a small shop which sells basics and snacks, an information area, pool overlooking a 'lake', a couple of computers that are free to use, and a laundry room, with 2 washers and 4 dryers. The hotel also has good free wifi. For an evening meal, Fishbones is at one end of the block and TGI's at the other, and you're just off International Drive. It's also close to Wet and Wild, Universal Studios, and several malls, such as the Premium Outlet and Florida Mall's. We paid well over Â£100 a night through Virgin, which wasn't worth it, as we could have booked the Waldorf Astoria for the same price had we booked independently. However, at the hotels rate, which, I just checked, is US$69, it represents good value.

Reviews.Title: “really dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: T S
Reviews.Content: I, my wife and daughter checked in Christmas eve (today), the computer system at check in was not "functioning" and the young man at the front desk was trying his best to help us. King Suite with ADA bathroom was misidentified on the computer resulting in us physically moving rooms 3 times to finally getting a "suite" but this still did not have ADA bathroom resulting in me crawling on all 4's to get to the toilet. When my daughter opened the sofa bed the linen were soiled, simply old sheets folded away without any cleaning. Long strands of hair and other gory details. When we asked for replacement, there were none available. The front desk gentleman was nice enough to let us go to another room and get clean blankets. The staff really tried to help - kudos to them. But the hotel management is really poor. I had booked this place as a Marriott, they changed to a Quality Inn and no one really informed us until we arrived. Granted this was Christmas Eve. But, this is Orlando and everyone expects guests to arrive during the winter break. The hotel is neither clean nor does it have the "standards" of other Marriott group of hotels. A major disappointment for a trip that we had planned for many many months in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel, shame it is now a Quality Inn”
Reviews.Author: LeighBlossom
Reviews.Content: Quiet location off International Drive. If you take the short cut across the small field and across the small bridge you will be on I Drive in minutes. The breakfast is basic but ok to get you your way. The room was adequate in size and clean. The fixtures and fittings are getting tired and could do with modernisation. The complimentary bus to Universal leaves the hotel at 8.10am and gets you to the park for 8.30am and there was always plenty of room on the bus. Good idea to get a 7 day lynx bus pass from the tourist information centre on I Drive to get you to Seaworld, Disney and the shopping outlets. Plenty of eating places within walking distance golden coral, ponderosa, perkins Tony Romas to mention a few.

Reviews.Title: “No bar so nothing in the evening unless you go out!”
Reviews.Author: Basing325
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located for international Drive and the water park is within easy walking distance. There are no amenities at the hotel other than a very small shop selling drinks and ice cream. If you want a drink in the evening you have to go out and there are few bars in the vicinity. Surprising in this day and age the bars allow smoking (restaurants don't) which limits where you can go for a drink, a chat and some atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Now they tell me the hotel name changed...”
Reviews.Author: hawntraveler
Reviews.Content: There's nothing like driving around trying to find your hotel -- The Fairfield Inn Orlando International Drive -- only to find out that the name of the hotel changed. I was on a cruise ship the week prior to arriving Orlando and did not receive notification that the hotel had changed it's name. I drove right by the hotel when I got into town. The second time around, I noticed a small, unlit Fairfield Inn sign on the front wall and figured that must be my hotel. The clerk who assisted me was being trained. The senior agent who was helping him was checking in another guest at the same time. The senior agent advised the junior agent to assign me a ground floor room. I immediately responded that I did not want to be on the ground floor and would like something higher. The senior agent said that would be fine. When the trainee handed me the key, he pointed down the hall and told me that was where I could find room 107. I immediately asked, "Isn't that on the ground floor?" "Yes," he replied. "I just told you I wanted to be above the ground floor." "Oh," he responded. "I'll see if I can move you." Eventually, I was moved to the fourth floor. All seemed well until I noticed small black insects jumping around in my white bath tub. I called downstairs and asked the clerk if the hotel was "pet friendly." "No," he replied. "Well, I think there are fleas in my bathtub." "I'll try to get someone up there to take a look," was the response. Within 20 minutes there was a knock on the door. After taking a look at the tub, the clerk said, "Well, I'm from Arizona and can't really tell you what those things are. I think you should move rooms." Another 20 minutes later, I received keys to a room down the hall. I was escorted inside just to make sure there were no fleas in the bathtub. Luckily, there were none. Then I went to turn on the air conditioner -- only to find out that the unit made a grinding and groaning noise for 30 seconds every five minutes. I immediately shut off the air conditioner and opened the window. I called downstairs and told the clerk, "Look, it's late -- but I want you to know that the air conditioner is broken." "Okay," was his response. "Will you send someone up to check on it -- maybe tomorrow." "Sure." "Are you sure? Are you righting this down," "Sure I am." The next morning I stopped a maintenance guy in the hallway and said, "Excuse me, do you know about my broken air conditioner?" "No." "No notes to check on my broken unit?" "No." I decided to let it go and see if anyone would get to my room by the end of day. (Oh, I did have to tell the housekeeper to put a box of tissue in my room.) I spend the day at Universal Studios and came back later that night. I turned on the air conditioner and to my surprise -- it worked. And no fleas in the tub. And, yes, there's a banner covering the old hotel sign out on the main driveway now. Oh sure -- now they tell me the hotel name has changed...

Reviews.Title: “Trip with my mom”
Reviews.Author: Dots039
Reviews.Content: My mom and I headed to Orlando after my dad died for some fun. The hotel was great the staff was great at giving me shortcuts to get to places and suggestions on what days to head to Universal and Disney. We had a blast

Reviews.Title: “Not a Marriott!!!”
Reviews.Author: cbheslin
Reviews.Content: Came here and Marriott sold to Quality Inn. Thanks for the heads up Marriott!!!!! Good hotel I guess. Just not a Marriott

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Vinay0725
Reviews.Content: Pros: Free Breakfast, Courteous staff, approx 6 miles from Disney and 3 miles from Seaworld Cons: Unclean Pool

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: nette1311
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from this hotel and I would highly recommened it to anyone who wants a good clean hotel with complementary breakfast and nice clean rooms with great facilities.Our room was spacious and cleaned everyday there is on site laundry facilities shop pool starbucks and bar, The reception staff especially Stephanie and Adam were so helpful and friendly nothing was to much trouble for them and the advice about the area was invaluable. Stephanie even located a missing suitcase at Orlando airport for our party that Vigin ground staff couldnt or wouldnt do,thankyou once again Steph. A the public area both inside and outside the hotel were spotless clean at all times and the breakfast staff kept the two seven yr olds in our party entertained every morning. The hotel is in a great location and central for all parks shops and resturants. Please try Del Monicos Resturant for a steak as it is reasonably priced and the food and service are excellant also try Dennys for breakfast as u will never see a large choice of breakfast anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, we will be going back!”
Reviews.Author: Skandark
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our two week stay here during October. The hotel was clean and tidy, the breakfast I thought was quite varied and saved us alot on eating out which meant more spending money :) We had a standard double room but this was still a large size compared to other hotels we'd stayed in. Nice friendly staff as well, we will def go back next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: mod88 Posted by a Virgin Holidays traveler
Reviews.Content: I think some people on other reviews have expected the ritz for the price! It isn't the ritz! However it is a great value hotel just off international drive! You get a good continental breakfast, nice way to have a healthy start to the day! The service is good and there is a good option of only changing linen etc when you ask for it! Location is just off the centre of international drive and close enough to either walk to something to eat on a night or get to I-Trolley. All in all this is a great base for Orlando! If ya want to enjoy Orlando you will only use your hotel to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Fab location and fab staff :D”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell1986
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from a 2 week stay at this fab hotel. The location was excellent, near to all the parks and local shops and restaurants. The staff were very friendly and helpful (especially Louis) and the rooms were a really good size and very clean. The free breakfast was great as there was alot to choose from including toast, bagels, waffles, muffins, ceareals and a variety of drinks. There was also other great facilities such as a games room, pool and laundry room. I really enjoyed my time here and i would recommend it to family or friends visiting orlando in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and close”
Reviews.Author: wolvesongs
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for the 3 days we stayed. It was within a few miles of both universal and sea world. It doesn't say on it's website - but this hotel does offer shuttle service (one pick up in am/ one drop off in p.m.) for Universal studios. The breakfast was what you'd expect - waffles, muffins, bread, cereal etc. The staff was friendly, the rooms clean. The pool was fairly big as was the hot tub and both were very clean. The pool was heated. It was a perfectly nice place to stay for our ventures to Universal and Sea world. Also - the hotel desk will give you a discount card you can use at universal if you ask for it. It gives you 15% of merchandise and I think a food discount as well.

Reviews.Title: “great price and location”
Reviews.Author: winnie2752
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 weeks from 3rd Oct. Had a great welcome as we checked in and was given a lot of info about area and shuttle buses etc. Parking was always easy and never busy. Hotel was compact in easy to find your way around. Had no problems at all wit room very clean spacious and comfy beds! Would definatly stay again for location and price alone!

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlfieinDevon
Reviews.Content: We found the Fairfield to be everything we needed it to be. It was very clean and the rooms were fairly spacious with the usual 2 double beds. Our aircon was pretty noisy but I think it was an old unit and some of the other rooms had newer ones which may have been quieter. The free breakfast in the morning was OK - toast, bagels, waffles, danish pastries, apples, bananas & oranges, cereal, tea, coffee etc. It's in a good location just off I-Drive which means it is very quiet. The staff on reception were very helpful too. It's a shame it doesn't have a hotel bar though as it would've been nice to be able to get back and have a drink in the evenings. This is a minor complaint however. The pool and spa were good although we didn't use them enough! It's not a 5* hotel though so don't go expecting it to be like one, it is however a very good basic base for exploring Orlando and the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Terrileigh10
Reviews.Content: I have to say this hotel was fabulous! The people working there are extremely helpful and always happy. Our rooms were cleaned every day, new sheet and new towels, although they did seem to clean them around midday so be careful if you are coming back in the afternoon you may have to wait a bit. The breakfast was great, cereal, muffins, pastries, toast, fruit and make your own waffles, no real hot selections but just enough to get you on your way in the morning! The location is fabulous because you're just a few minutes from Internation Drive but not on it, so the nights are very peaceful! The shuttle to Universal was fabulous! We used it in the morning, pick-up was 8:10a and parks open at 9:00 the pick-up at night was just after 6:00p but we usually left earlier. The pool area was really nice just to sit and relax, never really swam but the water was always very warm. I noticed people complained that the hotel smelled damp, and it does a little, but so does almost every store and restaurant you go into in Orlando. It's really just the humidity that causes it and once you're used to it you hardly notice it all!! I thought the beds were extremely comfortable, and I have a problem with my back, so that is always an issue!!! Overall, this place was amazing, the price is incredible and the service and amenities were amazing! I would absolutely come back here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Could we have been any happier? No!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Virgin Holidays traveler
Reviews.Content: The Fairfield lived up to all of our expectations and exceeded them by far. The hotel itself was always clean, and the staff friendly and helpful at all times. The breakfast was a nice touch, especially the waffles! Our room, a suite, was excellent, and included a fridge and a microwave. We didn't use the latter, but the fridge was most helpful, allowing us to take cheap, cold drinks wherever we went. The hotel location is its most valuable treasure. Less than five minutes to Universal, roughly ten to Seaworld & Discovery Cove, and 15 to the edge of the Disney estate, with a plethora of restaurants and attractions nearby as well (you could throw a stone out of the window and hit Wet & Wild for example). And despite all of that, a peaceful refuge from the hustle and bustle of Orlando, where we enjoyed very peaceful and comfortable sleeps. There were also free shuttles to certain attractions, but we had a car so cannot elaborate on those. Some of Florida's best malls are within a short drive as well, and these were nice to visit in the afternoons, after a morning in the parks, or when it rained (which was seldom). So, could we have been any happier? No, frankly. The hotel was perfect for us, and had everything we needed. Yes it's not a Disney hotel, and doesn't look like it cost a billion dollars to build. But none of that matters as you spend very little time there, and it is excellent as a base for exploring the riches of Orlando. Could you do better? Yeah, I'm sure you could. But you'll pay a lot more for it. This hotel ticks all the boxes, and ties them all up with a pretty little bow. Excellent service throughout, zero complaints from two happy and satisfied customers! :D

Reviews.Title: “Depends on Cost”
Reviews.Author: Jackman1
Reviews.Content: We stayed using Marriott Reward Points so it was free, if you are not a member sign up. I would say this hotel is a good value at $125 or less a night. Good location, 15 minutes from Disney, 10 from Universal and 5 from Sea World. Minutes from the best area of International Drive near the Convention Center with stuff to see and do and 100 restaurants!!. Nice pool area for a dip, FREE breakfast which is fast and convenient. Rooms are nothing fancy but clean and comfortable. If you are coming for the parks you will spend little time in the room other than to sleep so this may be the perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: dolores22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks on holiday in Orlando and it was everything you could need in a hotel. It was a great location, there are loads of places to eat on International Drive and it was a 5-minute drive to Universal Studios, about 20 to Disney. The hotel itself provided very good and friendly service and everything was spotlessly clean. Breakfast, which was complimentary, did the job to keep us going and there were a variety of things to choose from. It became a bit boring after two weeks but it was free and filling. I try to be quite health-consious and there were low-fat yoghurts, fruit and bran flakes, but that was about it for healthy food. There were complimentary hot drinks 24 hours a day, which was great! We tried the pool out once, which was nice and clean but way too hot to cool off so we didn't go in again. We upgraded to a suite, which I would highly recommend. The room we had was spacious, we had a fridge which was invaluable (and a microwave, although we didn't use this), a HUGE extremely comfortable bed and a living area. The only thing with our room was the noise coming from everybody's air conditioning units but, saying that, we both slept very well so it wasn't a problem, just a bit of a constant drone. The rooms were spotless and well-cleaned each day. Overall, I would very highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Orlando, it made a great base for our holiday. It is not a 5-star luxury hotel but you can see that from the price and photos. However, it was everything you would need for a holiday base and we were so happy with our room.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: tugga11
Reviews.Content: This Fairfield is good hotel for a great vacation in Orlando. The rooms are comfortable, supereb facilities, great service . Free Breakfast. The location of hotel is near to Sea world ( 3 miles) , Universal parks ( 3 miles ) . Numerous restauants nearby . Grocery and walgreens nearby. Excellent staff. Pool and internet available. Drawback - No fridge and Microwave in room.

Reviews.Title: “friendly and quiet”
Reviews.Author: martin c
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite and it was very spacious. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful, they will answer any question. We asked about shopping and they were able to give us all the local malls with locations and money off vouchers. The hotel is set back from international drive, therefore quiet and is only a short walk away from all the gift shops and eateries, though you may have to walk a little further to find a a more sophisticated restaurant. Near by are chinese buffets, an indian, all the burger joints and TGI fridays. They have a great free complimentary breakfast, which can get busy but by the time you have made your own fresh waffles and got yourself a coffee there was always a table spare, in or outside. They also have complimentary safety deposit boxes. There is also a free shuttle to universal studios. For the price we paid it was truly great value for money. It was very clean and we could not fault it. For a 3 star hotel it was a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Libertyke
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel while staying in Florida, and we were very happy with it. We had a very nice welcome at the reception, we knew everything we had to know when going to our room. The elevator was sometimes slow, but nothing to bad. The only thing I had problems with was the airconditioning. In the hallways, it was either freezing, or hot, but nothing in between. Rooms were very nice, we had a lot of space, and the beds were very comfortable. We slept in the hotel for six nights, and I wish we could have stayed longer. Breakfast was included in this hotel, which was very nice. You could make your own waffles, there were muffins, toast, yoghurt, eggs, ... You could have a real decent breakfast before visiting any of the theme parks in Orlando. If I would go back to Orlando, and needed a hotel in the proximity of the most theme parks, then I would certainly chose this hotel. Very friendly staff too. And you could take coffee and tea to go next to the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - always our first choice”
Reviews.Author: ukannie9
Reviews.Content: Some travellers often won't stay in this area of International Drive because it can be a little run-down, but you won't find anything run-down at the Fairfield Inn at Canada Drive. We first chose it because it was handy for Universal Studios, and it was so good we have stayed there ever since. The staff are friendly and nothing is too much trouble for them. The complimentary breakfast is good, and the standard of cleanliness is excellent. We also appreciate the beautifully clean pool and hot tub. First class value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lousy mattress”
Reviews.Author: HappyAuntie
Reviews.Content: We typically have great experiences with Fairfield Inns, so we were confident this would be a fine choice for our recent long weekend visit to Universal Studios. Overall, it was. Excellent location, yummy waffles at breakfast, free shuttle to and from Universal, and special perks as a Universal partner hotel like early admission and restaurant discounts. It suited our needs just fine. The hotel was clean and well-staffed. The breakfast bar was always fully-stocked (though they really need to add water to the breakfast beverage choices - just cold water for drinking). Our room was clean, well-lit, quiet and (mostly) comfortable. My only real complaint was about our mattress. It was hard as a rock, bouncy as a trampoline, and I could feel every single spring in it. Most nights I woke up every hour or so as I couldn't get or stay comfortable. A poor night's sleep makes for a very loooooong day on your feet in a theme park. The only night I slept well was our last night there, when I was so exhausted that I could have fallen asleep on a bed of hot lava. The free shuttle is nice, but be aware that it is not continuous - there is one pick-up time in the morning, and one return time in the evening. Moreover, the morning pick-up time does not get you to Islands of Adventure in time for the early admission in the morning, which was one big reason we chose this hotel. During our stay, early admission to Islands of Adventure started at 8 am, but the shuttle pick-up at the hotel wasn't until 8:10 am, meaning you don't arrive at Universal until about 8:30 and you miss out on valuable time during that early admission period. We took a cab at about 7:45 to make sure we arrived at Islands of Adventure in time to take advantage of early admission. Tip: The front desk of the hotel will call a [private cab to take you to Universal, and the ride will cost you $10 one way. But a Mears cab you call yourself will get you there for about $7.50 if you want to save a few bucks. Yes, I would stay here again. Fairfield Inn is a good chain. But they REALLY need to replace the mattresses. (At least the mattresses in our room.)

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, would definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: Pip H
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a king suite. It was big and kept very clean.The free breakfast was nice with quite a few things to choose from. Pool area was also kept clean. I would definately stay here again. Very good value for money. Staff were also very helpful with giving directions etc.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous holiday and a fabulous hotel .”
Reviews.Author: njspks
Reviews.Content: What can I say,funtastic ,the kids loved the pool hours til 11pm.The staff are very friendly and very welcoming,the room was superb we added a fridge for 5 bucks a day which was fine.The breakfast was adequate on a couple of occasions we went out for a american buffet style for a change but for no other reasons.we loved this hotel and wud def return asap if we could afford to .It's location is super too just off the busy I'drive.LOVE IT LOVE IT LOVE IT .

Reviews.Title: “Not so good now”
Reviews.Author: diddydonks
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Fairfield Inn and Suites 3 times now. Return as it is a great little hotel with good staff and of course the breakfast included and 24/7 coffee/tea/chocolate. Was disappointed that the bacon and egg sandwich was not on offer. Also the coffee/tea/chocolate was not 24/7. When we first arrived it was - then on our last day a notice was put up to say that it was only available at breakfast 7-10 and evenings 5-8. Also we had to ask for pool towels at reception, apparently because guests keep stealing them!!!! Think the recession is hitting everything now. Noticed that International Drive is a lot quieter than it used to be with many shops empty.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice if your on a budget”
Reviews.Author: LincolnClan
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 2 week holiday staying in the Fairfield Inn on Canada Av. We stayed in the same hotel 2 years ago in which time the hotel has changed very little and if I'm being honest the hotel is starting to look like it needs freshening up. Having said this I would still strongly recommend it as when all said and done its a budget hotel and fills all the reqirements you could need from a holiday in Orlando. It is also worth getting a King suite as you get a fridge, lots more space a huge king size bed and 2 T.Vs so no fighting with the kids on what you want to watch (that is if you have any spare time and can find anything worth watching on American T.V!!) The following are the main hotel pros and cons, Pros, Free Breakfast (Will save you loads of money and time). Fridge in King suites (Again if you buy bread and filling from Walgreens will save big $$$). Huge king size bed. Location (only a two minute walk from I-drive and very quiet unlike all the hotels on I-drive which are next to the interstate). Great staff who are always on had to help. Nice pool and hot tub which never seemed busy. Free computer room. Cons, Looking a bit tired. Only 1 free shuttle bus going to Universal. Free drinks that were 24 hrs are now only available at selected times, Computers in computer room are very slow. Breakfast choice has been cutback. Prices in Orlando seem to of gone up a lot and you could end up spending serious money on food so be prepared, Disney is charging $8 - $12 per person for snacks. We packed ourselves up each day. All parks except Seaworld and Aquatica will let you take food in. We used Lynx buses to get round this time and didn't buy I-Ride tickets (Lynx go everywhere the I-Ride does and more beside so another way to save) Getting to Disney on Lynx worked ok but you must get up early to make the most of the day. Get the number 8 or 42 to Seaworld then the 50 to the Transfer centre next to Magic Kingdom you are the able to use Disneys free transport to any Disney park. We found it took at best one and a half hours from I-Drive to Disney parks depending on how well the transfers worked out. Food on I-drive is still good value Ci-Ci's pizza is very cheap ($5.99 Buffet) and there are discount coupons all over for 2 for 1. Chilli's do a 2 main meals and a starter for $20 and the food is very good. I can also recommend Golden Coral ($11.99 Buffet) and Sweet Tomatoes ($10.99 buffet) for value and the food is nice. Outback is the best we found but ribs for 4 will cost around Â£100. We flew with Virgin Atlantic on their new Airbus A330-300 from Manchester the entertainment systems are very good (so much better than on the old 747s) Food is a bit better but still plenty of room to improve. To sum up if your going to Orlando and want to be right in the middle of things but want to keep costs down pick the Fairfield Inn but don't expect the Hilton. If anyone wants to ask me any questions feel free.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a good price”
Reviews.Author: DFWdealTraveler
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I couldn't complain about his hotel, for the price, awesome staff and free breakfast it was a great stay. The rooms are very clean and you can catch a free shuttle in the morning to the Universal theme parks. The downfall is that it picks up one time in the morning and picks you up one time in the evening from the parks. The 24 hours complimentary coffee, hot chocolate and tea is a great touch to this hotel. There is a pool, hot tub, gym and free business center. The breakfast includes, bagels, toast, cereals, muffins, yogurt, waffles, fruits, juice and milk. I have no idea where the breakfast sandwiches were. Francisco the front desk agent was very helpful and assisted us in locating a great restaurant called "Fish Bones." Do try the scallops there because they were very rich in flavor.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for part of our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: cranes2011
Reviews.Content: Reading some of the reviews on here we were a bit worried. However our experience was very different to what we were expecting. The staff were really welcoming and helpful, they posted our postcards for us, upgraded us and were really lovely and approachable. The room was not 5* but it was an excellent 3*. The sheets and bedding were very clean and changed daily, as were our towels. The bed was huge and really comfy (we are really fussy when it comes to beds) and we slept soundly. We were on the 5th floor and the air conditioning was great, we had an iron, ironing board, they have a laundry room which was great, and the swimming pool was lovely. We stayed here a few nights before our cruise and then we stayed here for another 3 nights after our cruise, they gave us the same room when we arrived back which was really, really nice for us. The breakfast was basic but plenty of choice (we did miss having marmalade & Jam for our toast), a lovely touch having coffee available 24 hours a day, complimentary. We would happily stay here again, it was a shame that on our last day we asked if we could stay until 3pm, due to our flight not being until 6pm. They stated that they would let us have our room until 1pm, but then if we stayed at the hotel, around the pool etc with our luggage behind the desk, they would charge us $50 for staying in the hotel between 1pm - 3pm. So we left at 1pm and spent a few extra hours at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “excellent trip”
Reviews.Author: H37
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel although could probably do with a "lick of paint", this did not matter as being in Florida minimal time was spent in the room. We had breakfast included which was adequate but catered for the american palate. There is a laundry which was great, meaning no dirty clothes brought home(it is charged for, but at a reasonable cost). Room cleaned every day. hotel quiet although situated right next to a freeway. Food court on site serving the usual pizza's, burgers, ice cream etc. There is also a games rooms for the kids and the pool area is fine. There is ample car parking spaces also. Nice location easy access for all attractions, we had a shuttle bus included with our holiday cost, but did not use this as we also hired a car for the duration. The bus was on a ring and book basis the night before. Amazing holiday and a good hotel no complaints

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: luckyamerica36
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and friendly and in a nice quiet location.Our room was on the second floor facing the car park.When entering the room there was a strong smell of damp which we noticed on our clothes too when taking them out of the drawers.Not a major issue,just strange!The rooms and bathroom are kept very clean however as is the rest of the property.So sad to see how International Dve has lost it's buzz with many shops,restaurants and attractions closed down.The parks are still great fun as is Downtown Disney.I would stay at this hotel again but unfortunately it won't be for a few years as Orlando seems to have lost some of it's magic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday Base”
Reviews.Author: nsmith50
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 15 days on our first USA holiday, and we were not disappointed with our hotel choice. The rooms were clean, aircon very effective although noisy, but soon got used to it. Breakfast is more than adequate and it saves you time ( I reckon about 1 hour a day if you had to go out for breakfast ) and also a fair amount of money which can be better used for other purposes. Location is ideal, just off I-Drive and very peaceful, but within easy reach of all routes to the Parks, attractions and restaurants,etc. We had a car which we used daily and even ventured out to Clearwater via Tampa.Some amazing views over the longest bridge I have ever seen connecting Tampa to Clearwater.At Clearwater the beaches were so white and the sunset was totally amazing, well worth the trip. You can get printed directions to anywhere from the friendly staff at reception, and also research your holiday trips on the FREE Internet, which also has a printer connected. A tip we got from the Virgin rep was to buy a 24 bottle case of water at Walmart which saves you a fortune over the holiday period. Compared to the hotel where Virgin hold the welcome meeting, the Fairfield is much quieter and personal and I have no problem in recommending this hotel and would go back there again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good Price, Staff not friendly”
Reviews.Author: Nabilah
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairfield on Canada Ave for 2 weeks in September 2011. Pros: 1. Price is affordable to anyone on a budget 2. Continental breakfast runs from 6:30-10 am - with muffins, cereal, bagels, pastries, HOT waffles, yogurt, apples, bananas, oranges, and fruit juice. All items were kept restocked fully up until 9:55!! 3. Free wifi- sometims very slow, MOST times worked fine. 4. Close enough to I-drive. ( 200 yards) 5. Free shuttle to Universal studios 6. free parking 7. Clean rooms Cons: 1. I stayed for 2 weeks, and barely got smiles from ANY staff member. one exception was Laura C. I actually caught another member of staff watching me suspiciously until i was out the door. This made me feel unwelcomed.( even after 2 weeks!!) 2. Shuttle runs to the parks ONCE for the day. So, no very flexible if you have small kids in tow 3. The pillows were very old and lumpy. 4. Our view was of a dirty old parking lot. Needless to say we kept the curtains closed when we were in he apartment. 5. The breakfast area is NOT monitored properly. Because of the cheap prices at this hotel, it can attract people with no manners.. There was some confusion at the waffle area on a few mornings, when people who were NOT in line would cut in front of those waiting to use the waffle machine. When the lady behind the breakfast stand was informed, she shrugged it off and said there was nothing that she could do. All in all- would I book again? I probably will try another hotel where the staff would be more welcoming. Although the staff at this hotel did the basics to keep thins running smoothly, the lack of smile and warmth will not encourage me to return. However, if you re someone who really doesnt mind the lack of warmth, this hotel may be just the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and ideally placed”
Reviews.Author: Venturer7
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weeks and we were more than happy with our stay. From the moment we arrived the member of staff on shift (Francisco(sorry if I've spelt your name incorrectly!)) was very helpful and made us very welcome. We sorted out our safe box, which are kept behind the hotel reception, and settled into our room. We booked a suite and it came with a seating area, table and office style chair, a large bed a couple of flat screen TV's in the bed and seating area, a microwave, fridge and air conditioning (slightly noisy but very effective). There was also a mini sound system in the room. Everything was clean and tidy and, although slightly worn, still comfortable. There were only a handful of hangers on arrival so a quick word with the maid the following day saw another10 arrive which was plenty. There was a iron and ironing board in the room and the hair dryer was good according to the wife (not much need for it in my case). The breakfast area during our stay was always clean and tidy with staff constantly cleaning the serving areas. The choices were good for us as we are not really fried/cooked breakfast lovers so serial, toast, pastries, yoghurt, bagels, fruit and self cook waffles were ample for us. These came with jams, peanut butter, honey and syrup as required. We always got what we wanted every day and there was always a place to sit either inside or outside. There is also a selection of juices available. We tried the orange, cranberry and apple and all were good. There is also a selection of coffee, tea and hot chocolate available 24x7 which is on a self service basis. This was great for a coffee sat outside after an evening out. The pool area is adequate for a short swim and cooling off. On our visit in September the pool was not crowded and there was plenty of room. Similarly the hot tub was also available. Towels are available from the pool area to use. The gym is really only cardio only and is a little limited for anyone wanting to do any weight training (no weights). The location of the hotel was ideal as there were many restaurants within a walk, i-Ride (more later) or taxi fare away. Our favourite was The Olive Garden which is a good quality Italian chain restaurant. We went to the one on International Drive but there are several around. We also dined at Kobe which is a Japanese Teppanyaki restaurant where the show from the chefs is equal to the food quality. Other restaurants in close proximity are TGI Fridays, Chilli's, Cici's (a bit fast food for me but the rest of our party liked it) and the typical giants are all there such as Mac's, Burger King, Denny's etc... I-Ride proved to be a bit of a struggle. The service was irregular and when they did arrive they were normally full with no chance to get a seat. Several times we abandoned the bus stop and nominated a driver for the car or got a taxi. Next time I would not bother and either go for the taxi or the local Lynx bus service which is scheduled and regular. With regard to the parks the hotel was easily accessible to the Universal theme parks as a bus runs to Universal and Island of Adventures on a daily basis. We had a car so didn't use this service. We spoke to some others in the hotel without a car and they had some difficulty in getting to the Disney side of things. We didn't try this so cannot really verify this. Wet and Wild is a walk away and we had a great time there! Overall we had a great time in Orlando. We did lots of things not normally available to us in the UK such as airboat rides, shooting a .45 calible gun, swimming with dolphins and rays, walking through swamps ( big spiders...!)...the list goes on and on. We can highly recommend this hotel if you want a good quality base to get out there and do things. It is not a luxury hotel but a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal base”
Reviews.Author: TinyDancer26
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 weeks with husband in March 2011. An ideal base for International Drive but situated just off it so traffic noise not heard. Ideal for Wet n Wild which we walked to, best nearest restaurants were Perkins and TGI Fridays, we stayed in a suite to take advantage of the microwave so we could heat water for a quick coffee whilst getting ready in the morning and the fridge too, two big TVs a sofa area, perfectly respectable clean and tidy base for exploring all of Orlando, plenty of car parking, laundry room a godsend, air con a bit clunky but worked fine, free breakfast was just right, we only used the pool one day but that was fine, staff were very helpful and friendly, I would label it as an inexpensive good base.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: This Hotel had very clean rooms and lounge areas. The staff always said hello each time you entered. The pool area was a great place to just sit and relax with palm trees, a bar, relaxing music, and night breezes. This was a convention trip, but I had my wife with me for the great stay at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay for Universal Parks”
Reviews.Author: LightBurnsBlue
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor to the Disney and Universal Theme Parks. I usually stay at the Marriott properties closer to Disney in the Lake Buena Vista area. I found an excellent point-saver value at the Fairfield Inn off I-Drive so I decided to take a chance given the Marriott Points value. My first choice of the Marriott Brands for a vacation stay is always the Residence Inn or Spring Hill Suites due to the good hot breakfast. I was not overjoyed at staying at the Fairfield due to the more continental style breakfast as opposed to the hot breakfast. However, I was reading great reviews of the breakfast at the I-Drive location (egg sandwiches and such.). The check-in process was smooth--they identified me as a Platinum member. Front desk staff was always friendly. I did think it was odd that the male front-desk employee frequently had a group of 4-5 ladies (seemed like his cousins or something) standing by the front desk eating ice cream and chatting with him every night. I liked that the hotel had the WSJ out every morning in the lobby. The pool/hot tub area was nice. Nothing fancy (better pool at the Marriott Suites location) but fine. The pool water was WAY too hot--it was like jumping into a bath tub. Not refreshing. The room was great. We had a king suite. The bed was comfortable. We liked the layout--a sitting area plus a bedroom area. It was nice having a fridge and microwave for dinner leftovers. The one thing we did not like about the room was that it felt humid/damp unless we had the AC running 24/7. The hotel was very close to the Universal parks and not as far as we thought from the Disney parks. We took I-4 to the Disney parks and were there in about 15 min. Not bad. There are also some very good restaurants on Sand Lake that are near by. We highly recommend the Orlando Ale House as well for cheap food and drinks that are very delicious. Also, the Chilis (within walking distance) has happy hour all day every day so we had drinks and apps for next to nothing. The main downside to this hotel was the Breakfast, as I had feared. The great egg sandwiches I had heard about on Trip Advisor were no where to be found. If you love carbs for breakfast, the Fairfield Inn breakfast can't be beat. Bagels, Toast, Cereals, Waffles, Danish, Donuts, Fruit. However, my husband and I like to eat protien for breakfast and the best we could do is to put peanut butter on our fruit or waffle and eat a low-fat yogurt. We ended up paying for breakfast several mornings because we don't think carb-loading is a healthy way to start the day. At least the Fairfield Inn in the Marriott Village had hard-boiled eggs--that would be a welcome addition to the breakfast at the I-Drive location. Overall, I prefer the Lake Buena Vista area to the I-Drive area so I do not think I would be staying at the hotel again. However, for the points we paid, we had a great stay and if you are looking for a hotel in the Universal Area you will enjoy staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, inexpensive lodging”
Reviews.Author: ks-bike-rider
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Fairfield Inn. It is located just a block off I-Drive, so you don't get all the traffic noise and confusion. The staff was very helpful and always trying to make sure you had everything you needed for a great stay. Restaurants are a block or so away, depending on your tastes. Their suites are regular rooms with a refrigerator, microwave and couch. There is a dividing wall and second TV in the sleeping part of the room. They even seem to have their own personal taxi company. Ricardo and/or Henry were always at the front door waiting to run you around town at reasonable rates (for Orlando). It is a good place for families, but probably not as good for business travelers, since there is no way to get away from all the excited kids waiting to be swept off to an amusement park, or just returning from one. Jugglers that specialize in sharp objects and flaming items should also probably avoid this location because of all the traffic buzzing around at knee-level.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but fantastic hotel, great base for exploring Orlando”
Reviews.Author: DJN1980
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this holiday for 3 weeks over the summer, it is ideally located as a base for exploring all the theme parks and also for further afield, we travelled to Kennedy and the space coast and across to tampa. It is located just off international and in walking distance of a handful of nice restaurants such as TGI's, fishbones, other restaurants are located further down International drive within 5-10 mins drive/taxi, very convenient. It takes 20mins to get to Disneyworld, 10mins to Seaworld and 5 mins to Universal. The hotel was very well kept, very clean and tidy, the pool was immaculately kept and there were always plenty of sun loungers and clean towels were provided. A free breakfast is provided and is more than adequate, there were plenty of options from cereals, yogurts, pastries, toast and bagels and although i expected to get bored of it whilst staying there for 3 weeks we only ended up eating out about 5 times. you also get free tea, coffee and hot chocolate 24hrs really good when you get back from a long day at the theme parks. The room was basic but clean and tidy with 2 double beds and a flatscreen tv. The staff were very helpful, even letting me use their computer to print out my Kennedy tickets when the business center printer was out of order, the staff were always keen to help and cheerful and polite on entering the hotel. overall a fantastic hotel, especially considering the price, not full of luxuries, but for budget hotel a fantastic base for exploring Orlando. Would recommend this hotel and definitely stay her again

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, will be back”
Reviews.Author: linbaj
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and nice room as well as service. Very close to Universal and 15 min from just about everything else, including Disney. Will stay again (though only if going as couple.) The coffee is pretty terrible though :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: TravelinPinky
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a convention my husband had to go to and it is great. The only thing we didn't like was the bed and the pillows. Weren't very comfortable, but we managed. The place is very clean, modern and updated. The wi fi was great. The free breakfast is great - a total value given there is everything from waffles, to eggs, to yogurt, to cereal, to toast - all included in your stay! We didn't have our son, but this was a great place for families which I'll keep in mind. There were a few options around us too - TGIFridays in the parking lot and Wendy's and KFC across the street. CVS in the parking lot too - so you are never really stranded without food, snacks, or necessities. The IRide trolley was great too - there was a stop for it right in front of TGIFridays and we took it daily to the convention center. Very cheap and convenient. Overall, this is a great hotel for business or pleasure with great amenities - pool, workout room and free breakfast are all excellent - at a great price. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay and very clean”
Reviews.Author: traveller2801
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two weeks at the end of July with my family. I had booked through Virgin and we were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were large, the beds are clean and comfortable and the TV's was modern with a good selection of channels.The bathrooms wes dated and painted abit of a strange dull pink colour and there was no fridge in the standard rooms but it wasn't the end of the world. The free breakfast was good and gave you a good selction , cereals, fruit , bagels and pastries. There was also free coffee throughout the day and night. The laundry facilities were very good. it was cheap and very clean! The pool was on the small size but fine if you just want to use it for a few hours a day and there were always clean towels provided. The staff were also polite and friendly there is an A.T.M in the lobby which is very handy (there is a charge of $3 per transaction). The hotel is just off International Drive, close to Universal and nearby restaurants whch is convenient. The Sizzler Indian resturant is just round the corner and the food is good. One disppointment is the cost of the hotel's shuttle bus to Disney as it is very expensive at $18.00 per person per day!! We just took the car instead and paid the $15.00 per day parking fee.. We will be going back to Orlando next year and I would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Basic. Clean. Breakfast was very good.”
Reviews.Author: SRQ_ova
Reviews.Content: We are FL residents and live 2 hours away from Orlando. Usually we go to Universal for a day (thanks to the awesome deal we got for Universal FL resident annual passes) and drive back home same night. My daughter and I wanted to spend a couple of days in Orlando for her birthday. In the past we stayed at LQ near the convention center, but it has gotten quite old and the rooms weren't clean enough to our liking. After reading the reviews for this hotel, I decided to give it a try. The location is very convenient to Universal and Seaworld. It is very close. It is a Universal partner hotel, so you can get a card from the front desk for 15% discount on merchandise and food at certain locations at Universal. There are number of restaurants near the hotel. We ended up in a handicap accessible room. The room was clean. Very basic, the beds were comfortable. HBO was offered, which was awesome as I am a True Blood fan. The bathroom was clean. Shampoo and conditioner by Pantene. The breakfast was quite good. There were 3 stations for making waffles. A microwave to make your oatmeal, which was offered in 3 flavors. There were toasters for your bagels, etc. There was yogurt of multiple flavors by Yoplait, juices, milk, fruit, pastries. I think it is an excellent continental breakfast for a hotel. Overall, we were satisfied with the hotel. Basic, clean and service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcome stay”
Reviews.Author: Neilrachel
Reviews.Content: Just need to say one of the best and friendliest hotels in the area . All of the staff were brill & the hotel is very clean,anything you needed they would help . See you next year.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, clean no-frills hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: nta284
