Reviews.Content: I am very picky when it comes to hotel and this one just can't be beat based on the value, location, and the excellent job that housekeeping, maintenance, and everyone else working there has done. We stayed in the suite for five nights and four days. The front desk let us check in early which was wonderful. We were able to get in, unpack and get the day started. The shuttle to the Universal Parks were very convenient and there are tons of cabs available if you would like to leave the park early. The hotel is in a wonderful location and within walking distance of a Perkins, TGIFridays, Panda Express, Burger King, and many others. The free breakfast in the morning was good but was VERY carb. based (bread, bagels, waffles, muffins, etc.) which got really old fast. I would have like to see them have yogart and maybe fruit salad but considering it was free, I can't complain! Overall, I would recommend this park to someone who wants to spend all of their time at the Universal Parks and wants to save money and get a great quality hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base”
Reviews.Author: Posh71_11
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be really clean with excellent facilities. Children loved the swimming pool & games room. Breakfast was fine, plenty of choice. The hotel was in a great location as restaurants and shops within easy walking distance. Staff extremely helpful and greeted us each & every time we came back in! Really did not want to leave, atmosphere is friendly & laid back - a real home from home.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, No Frills Hotel”
Reviews.Author: QBee10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in August with my husband and child. We had a standard room. Location is really good. Close to all the theme parks and attractions. Around the corner from I Drive and a ton of restaurants. The outside of the hotel was in good condition, but the inside left a lot to be desired. You can tell its an older hotel. The air conditioner works really well which is a huge bonus. But I have to say they do a fairly decent job of cleaning your ROOM clean. Other parts of the hotel, I'm not so sure. Here are the negatives... -The SMELL! When you first enter your room there is a really strong, disgusting, musty smell. I am sure its because of the humidity. But I suspect they dont really air out the rooms too well. -The towels in the bathroom are embarassingly thin and old feeling. -They do not give new small shampoo and conditioners after you use them. -The furniture in the hotels are REALLY old and dingy. I really didnt wanna sit on the chairs and the beds kinda scared me. -We only went down for breakfast one day. The selections are extremely limited. The only thing that was hot was the one waffle maker. I dont even think they had a toaster for bread. -There were bags of trash left in the hallway all day. Overall it was a medicore hotel. You basically get what you pay for. But do not expect any sort of luxury experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Please read my honest review.”
Reviews.Author: RICKYRICH
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from the Fairfield inn and here is my honest review. Firstly the good points:- 1. Very very clean. 2. Nice size rooms( we had a suite) 3. Nice and friendly staff 4. Nice free breakfast 5. Close to I drive. Now the bad points. 1. Our room was damp so this made our clothes damp. 2.pool was far too warm(not refreshing when you have had a day at the parks) and the spa was just Too hot to go in it. 3. Sun beds were very poor and not comfortable. 4.No bar to chill at in the evening. If you want a luxury hotel do not stay here. This is a cheap and cheerful budget hotel it is in no way luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service & We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Oscar T
Reviews.Content: Very nice property, close to places that we wanted to visit like Universal, great price and to top it all.... Great service! Willing to help, resolve and making you feel at home. Great check-in by Javier and his follow-up the rest of the days there. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay there-- Nothing good to say”
Reviews.Author: R S
Reviews.Content: Old property, ill maintained, poor service-- customer care is sub-par. The property manager claims they have the best rate in the area, and feel that people will stay regardless. I stayed with my reward points, and yet would not recommend it. When asked for service to get extra luggage rack, they did provide one, and when asked for a small refrigerator- they imposed a rental fee. Breakfast quality was a joke, and breakfast plates were even smaller, as if they wanted people to simply sniff the food. "Small plates do not reduce waste". Front desk response-- this is all that Marriott provided them. Lie-- I am a Marriott member and have traveled many places in FL alone. The hotel is perhaps thriving on foreigners who may not have tried other properties. A few blocks away on the International drive is the Residence Inn (Convention Ctr.)-- better in service, and overall value-- though that place was not new either. At least the breakfast, pool areas, and staff were much friendlier even in the high season (we stayed there a week earlier). Rooms had lousy sloppy beds which could easily give you muscle aches, if you do not get them from some of the wild rides in the park in Disney or Universal. Spare a few extra dollars of look further away, then letting these guys cash on the locations-- Hundreds of places are around the vicinity-- do a bit of Homework. And for my English/British friends, even if you are used to smaller spaces, you could do much better staying elsewhere than this property in Orlando area. There has to a reason why I spent time writing this long review.. Think about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good time”
Reviews.Author: MCC1969
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were wonderful. The room was comfortable for our family of three. The only problem was with the plumbing. You can hear the water continuously run. We decided not to get a new room, because it was not worth the trouble. The breakfast was excellent and our daughter had a great time in the arcade.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: ferrari2197
Reviews.Content: The Fairfield inn Orlando is nothing to write home about. Just a plain old average hotel. I was expecting a little more because it was my first time at a Marriott hotel, but nothing great. The hotel management was very bad. Check it was OK but breakfast was a DISASTER. Kids and foreign tourists do not know what a line is and just scatter all over the place. The breakfast was below average for a continental breakfast. Muffins, bagels, cereal. But smart for people going to Universal. The rooms were the same old hotel rooms but I have to say the bed was pretty good. If you want to get a cheap hotel for Universal go here but for anything else avoid, there are many more other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “THIS WAS A VERY VERY CLEAN GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: cheryl61
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the reviews from trip advisor. It was a partner hotel with AAA. It was a great value. This hotel was extremely clean, one of the cleanest hotels we've ever stayed in! The king suite was a really nice room. There were 2 tv's, a divider wall between the king bed and the sofa bed/area, microwave, and frig. The bed and pillows are very comfortable. Our adult daughter said the sofa bed was not the best, but a sofabed is never very comfortable for an adult. The towels and sheets are very soft and smell good. Not all hotels have soft towels. The water pressure is excellent in the shower. The pool was medium sized and not very crowded. Next to the pool was a covered area with table & chairs. The spa was a little too hot, but felt really good after a long day walking in the amusement parks. The breakfast seating area is one of the largest we've seen in a hotel. The breakfast is very simple, but good. Muffins, bagels, donuts, cereal, yogurt, fruit, etc. Nothing hot, but sufficient enough and good enough for us. The milk doesn't arrive until later in the morning, so no cereal if you go early. This was the only thing we found wrong with this hotel. I wish all hotels would take pride and clean up their facilities as well as this one. We've stayed in a lot of so called "clean hotels", but this one was exceptional. The staff is very very friendly and helpful. We were so very pleased with our stay here. You couldn't have asked for better service or quality for an "average priced" hotel. We will seek out more fairfield inns and see if they are all like this. I hope so. They'll have a customer forever!

Reviews.Title: “Management & Staff At Fairfield Inn & Suites on International Drive”
Reviews.Author: JohnStella50
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had reservations for 5 days. When we arrived at the hotel the desk clerks at the front desk gave us a warm reception when checking us in. Right from the start we knew our stay at this hotel and our vacation would be pleasant. During our stay we would ask the desk clerks for directions to the theme parks, restaruants, shopping centers etc.,they were there to oblige us. Every evening the deck clerk would bake fresh cookies for the guest, and fresh coffiee. Each morming we had an outstanding breakfast with good service. Our room and all surroundings at this hotel were exceptionly clean and beautifully decorated. We will be returning to the Fairfield Inn & Suites on International Dr. in Orlando Fl., where they made us feel at home. We would like to thank the Management and Staff of this hotel for making our stay pleasant and enjoyable. Sincerely. John & Stella Emmert

Reviews.Title: “A Place to Sleep”
Reviews.Author: RVTravelingWife
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times before and the hotel is consistently the same. Not the nicest Fairfield I've visited, but it served its purpose by providing a generally clean place to sleep. The staff is always friendly. Hotel lobby smells like a hair or nail salon (not really sure why)...but other than that, I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff and good value”
Reviews.Author: Thejones1066
Reviews.Content: This was by far the cheapest of the four hotels we stayed in during our trip to the US. While it was less" luxurious" it was still comfortable, quiet and clean . The staff were very nice and helpful too.The breakfast was great and there wAS free tea and coffee available 24 hours a day in the restaurant area. Pool towels were also available and there were laundry washing facilities available at a very cheap price. Parking was free.The hotel is well situated for visiting Univeral studios . A great basic hotel with everything you need . I don't think we'd have stayed any longer though as 3 days was enough for us to visit Orlando, but that has nothing to do with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Well run and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: run4evergeorge
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff. Our room was ready when we arrived before eleven a,m.so we had the whole day at Universal. Room was modern and spacious and we really enjoyed the oversized swimming pool. Though this hotel is older, it was very well run. We also were able to catch a free bus to the park and save on the steep parking fee at the park.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kerrymartin71
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful and friendly. They made some great recommendations and saved us money too! The room was pleasant and well maintained. Breakfast was amazing with so many choices it took twice as long to eat it. The hotel is close to all the major attractions and near enough to many different restaurants and entertainment venues. Would definitely recommend and visit again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!! Great hotel ignore bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: cheye1
Reviews.Content: We had a king suite with a sofa bed and the room was wonderful. I traveled with my kids and husband so it was perfect. There is everything in the hotel that you need (arcade, breakfast, 24/7 coffee and tea, pool, jacuzzi and gym just to name a few)The smell of the hotel lobby, corridors and rooms was awesome and a very friendly and helpful staff. And the breakfast was great, variety to choose from. I was a little hesitate on booking because you have some negative reviews but I really don't understand why......ignore them. I am very picky and perticular at what hotel my family and I stay at and this one was great at least our room, it was upgraded. The hotel is tucked away in the center of the hustle and bustle of International Drive you can walk where you want to go however, the hotel is so tucked away that you don't hear all of the traffic and chaos (which is a good thing, when your sleeping at night).

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms and great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Terriinthewoods
Reviews.Content: Family vacation to Discovery Cove, Seaworld, Aquatica, And Universal. Positives: Suite was very nice, very big, comfortable beds with cozy linens, nice TVs, large bathroom, clean shower. Great location. Breakfast was "continental" but they had some sort of eggs every morning, cereal bar, waffle maker, etc. Very filling! Negatives: bus service not like Disney! Is a Seaworld hotel but sometimes there were hours between buses to the park (and sometimes there were too many people waiting to fit on the bus) and they stopped taking you over to the park at dinnertime, so one night we had to take the IRide trolley. Concierge hours are weird, stop at 3:00 pm so you couldn't set up any plans in the evening. Concierge is also over in Springfield which wasn't made clear at check in. Also were kind enough to hold our luggage until check in so we could go to the park, but didn't tell us about the hotel's quick queue, so we missed out on that for an entire day. Pool area could have used a little extra attention for clean up, but it was nice that they had food and a bar. Also, TGI Fridays delivers!

Reviews.Title: “helpful friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: jody_lee1
Reviews.Content: stayed here with my boyfriend and my parents for a 2 week holiday in march. it was easy to find and great location for international drive down a quieter road but easy walking distance to the attarctions. breakfast was ok a bit repetitive but choice of cereals, cakes, toasts, bagels, fruit(which was either apples or bananas) and yoghurts. pool area was clean and tidy with plenty of clean towels to use. The shop was well stocked with snacks etc and the reception staff were very friendly and helpful. There is also free unlimited tea/coffee and hot chocolate that you can help yourself to throughout the day. Our room was a good size, nice shower and was cleaned everyday. we found it a good location for all the parks, outlets and restaurants as we had a car, but there is a free shuttle bus everyday from the hotel to universal studios which we also used and was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place”
Reviews.Author: marysyana260
Reviews.Content: We returned from orlando a week ago. What a fantastic time i had spent with my family!!!.The hotel is fantabulous. All the services provided by hotel's staff are extremely good.

Reviews.Title: “Eww.”
Reviews.Author: SayWhatSarah
Reviews.Content: Staff: They were extremely wonderful! They were helpful and very nice. They were the only reason I couldn't give the overall rating one star. Hotel Location: Great! It is right in the hustle and bustle of everything. You don't have to go far to get to Disney World, Universal Studios, Sea World, restaurants, shopping, etc. I felt very safe there too since there were people everywhere at all times. Hotel Appearance Outside: Well kept and nice. Hotel Appearance Inside: When we walked into the hotel it felt muggy and it smelled musty. When we got off of the elevator onto the top floor and walked into the hallway, I wanted to immediately turn around and leave. But it was late and we didn't have anywhere else to stay. The carpet was sticky and older looking. The lighting was dark and I felt like I was in a bad movie. Room: *Sigh* Where do I begin? It was musty, dingy, and dark. The linens were so-so. The bathroom was awful. The walls in the bathroom were painted this awful dark yellow/orange and it was so muggy in there that it was moisture was running everywhere. We didn't want to walk barefoot in the room either. The water also had an awful taste/smell. Also, looking under the bed was a mistake. Ew. I am not sure why my experience was so different to everyone elses? Maybe we just "lucked-out" and got an older room. In retrospect, I should have seen if we could have a different room, but like I said it was late. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: SamnMatt
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 5pm and was checked in in about 5 minutes. We have asked for a high floor room but got ground floor but tbh it didnt matter, the room was very spacious and clean with 2 queen size beds, chest of drawers and an office type table. The wash area was spacious too and the bathroom looked nice. The air con is a little noisey but after a couple of days you really dont notice it. Housekeeping were wonderful, friendly and did a fantastic job. Infact the whole of the team at the hotel were spot on, if we needed help on directions they helped, booking cabs and also ringing Seaworld when we needed to know what time things where on. The pool area is big and is hardly ever busy so you will always get a sun lounger and the whole area got the sun pretty much all day, the hot tub/jacuzzi was also fantastic for chilling out after being at the parks. Breakfast is ample although we didnt eat it ourselves. About 4 days before we were due to leave they started to upgrade all the tvs in the Hotel from the old style to new 32' flat screens which i thought was great! Its situated off I drive but literally 3 - 5 mins walk and your on I drive. Pirate dinner adventure is at the bottom of the road also TGI fridays but with I drive so close you would be spoilt for choice. I would reccommend this hotel to everyone you wont be dissapointed. They also have a list of delivery companys for you so if you dont feel like going out you can grab a take away :)

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for business stay”
Reviews.Author: HappytoGo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights while on business. Hotel was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. Good location. Pool was okay, didn't eat the free breakfast but there seemed to be a lot of options. Nice that they had coffee available all day and free internet. For the price this hotel can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: scoobydoo22
Reviews.Content: Just arrived Back and have got to say this is one of the best hotels i have stayed in,not that its super modern and trendy its the fact that everything is spotless clean, the rooms are well equiped and everything is so relaxed the staff will do almost anything for you. We left on the 13th of July and they have just replaced all the old tube style tvs to flat screens in every room. The pool area rarley gets busy and after a day at the parks we got an ice bucket some beers and wine and chilled out by the pool this hotel has no bar which i thought was a good thing and the didnt mind you bringing in your own. Breakfast is good and just enough before you go out for your day. Location is good also, you can walk to universal it took about 20 mins or free bus leaves at 08.00 which is ideal if you want to be first on the rides,a taxi from universal cost between $6 to $8. And within walking distance are tgi, chillies,miller ale house etc The hotel also offers free wifi perfect for iphone ,ipads etc Overall we did'nt have one complaint over our two weeks and would definitely return to this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great service and at a very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: neno1203
Reviews.Content: I normally don't bother writing reviews even though I should always do it. I'm a Marriott member for a long time and do numerous of trips to florida, and even though I've been in Marriott never to this location. I booked a room at the Canada location because where I normally go was sold out. As soon as I checked it a the guest service rep in the name of Francisco was more than helpful providing ne with the best of service with a big smile on his face. When I came down in the afternoon to make plans for dinner was very helpful in providing me information to nearby restaurants with a couple of discounts cards. Only negative thing or should say a recommendation is a lil upgrade on the fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel & staff...”
Reviews.Author: Whowouldathunkit
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel, my family planned a last minute trip to Sea World because we had to use our frequent flyer miles before they expired. The hotel staff was amazing when we arrived in the evening, they informed us of everything going on during our stay, they were amazing with the children and our hotel room/suite was perfect. We were able to access the park early and skip park lines with a pass included with our hotel stay. I will only stay here during my next visit to Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “"Exceeded all reviews and expectations"”
Reviews.Author: Emma_McClintock
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two weeks and booked through Virgin Holidays. On arrival we were checked in promptly and quickly arrived in our room. We had a king suite which was accompanied with a fridge, coffee machine and sitting area. Room was of a good size and bed very comfy. Quiet and peaceful considering a busy vacation time in Orlando. Breakfast was served from 5-10 am every morning with plenty of selection. The breakfast area is big and can seat around 60 per time but I suggest getting there early if you dont want to be over crowded! Cereals, fruits, pastries, egg and bacon roll, yoghurt, fruit juices and many more. Enough to get you going for the day as well as save you money on eating out for breakfast. Hotel does a free shuttle to Universal/Islands of Adventure. The pick up times are 6:50 am and 8:00 am and then there are 3 pick up times for return (they are quite late at night though). Just wait in the foyer for the big yellow shuttle bus and jump on. If you dont want to wait till 19:00 for the first pick up back to your hotel you can walk from the shuttle rank accross the bridge (crossing I4) and pick up the I-ride ( red line south) to stop 14 for quickness. We got a 14 unlimited ticket for the I-RIDE for $17 each which was very handy. It takes you to Sea World, Acquatica, Wet n Wild and both the Prime and premium outlets. From this hotel you are best to take the red line north and south to get up and down i-drive. No virgin rep in this hotel you have to walk to quality inn (5 mins) if you need to see the rep. Pool area was clean and very relaxing. Pool was nice and warm !! Overall a very nice hotel to stay in, so don't take too seriously any negative reviews...most people are simply nit picking. For this type of holiday it is great !! Enjoy :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobotRockOhYeah
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Orlando as a family for the second time but staying at this hotel for the first time. Our first impressions didn't change. The staff were very polite, friendly and helpful. Everywhere was spotless. The pool is a good size and the jacuzzi is spot on after you've just got back from the parks after a long day and your body is aching! The arcade is good for children/young teens but presuming you've got park tickets they shouldn't be spending too much time in there. The breakfast is very good, there's plenty of choice, hot or cold. There's a small shop in the lobby that sells cold drinks and snacks and other small things. The rooms are just like they look on the brochure. Outstanding hotel, can't flaw it!

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel, ideal location for universal and sea world”
Reviews.Author: DuvetLeeds
Reviews.Content: Great basic hotel, comfortable and clean. A good place to rest after a hard day in the parks. Ideal location for universal studios and sea world. Free shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal I Drive Base”
Reviews.Author: rosie0806
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 10th to 24th May in a suite. The room was of a good size. We didn't really use the living area much as we only upgraded for the guaranteed fridge! The bed was very comfortable and very big. There was plenty of drawer and wardrobe space. We had a day where it was too cold in the room so we turned the a/c off and just had the fan on. This was a bad idea as the room and some of our clothes felt damp. So my recommendation would be to always have the a/c on! Also, we found there wasn't anywhere to dry wet clothes, but I suppose that could be because we're used to having a balcony! We found the breakfast more than adequate. We were originally planning to eat out for breakfast a few times but we only ended up doing so once! There was cereals, breads and bagels, buffins, yoghurts and microwavable sandwiches. Really very good for a free breakfast. Front desk staff were all great, always smiling and easy to get on with. The pool area was nice, we went down 3 times and it was never busy. We had previously stayed closer to Universal and we thought that this location was better. The hotel also provides free wi-fi. We found this to be so helpful as we booked tables at Disney restaurants and a safari at Busch Gardens I would recommend this place to a friend but it wouldn't be my first choice if I went back. This is no reflection on the hotel, it's just that I would want to try a different location.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel and can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Wendworld
Reviews.Content: I have to say this is the most cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in. Staff are very friendly and can't do enough for you. After a long day at the parks it was so nice to be able to relax and get a good nights sleep in a suprisingly very quiet location. It is a two minute walk over to International drive, very well located and the beds are the very, very comfortable. Free continental breakfast was adaquate, plenty of fruit, bagels, bread bacon and egg muffins, a selection of pastries,assorted cereals and as much as you like. Tea and coffee etc free 24 hrs. Laundry room was spot on, pool was always clean and plenty of room for sunbathing. There was always fresh towels for when you have finished and have found this hotel to be the best value for money. My son says I should mention the awesome shower too

Reviews.Title: “Our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: ha3cwi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon, can't really fault it... Fab location on I Drive, and the breakfast was more than substantial... plenty to chose from and tea/coffee 24hrs a day.. There wasn't a bar or restaurant here, however the location made up for it as you were really close to I HOP, Panda buffet and loads of grill's to chose from. The hotel offered free shuttles to Universal Studio's, but you have to make your own way to Disney parks. The staff were very friendly from booking and once they recognised you, they never forgot you and always went out of their way to make conversation. The rooms were really good, showers were fab and plasma TV was great (especially when we watched the royal wedding at 6am). When we needed, the hotel booked taxi's which were always on time and a good rate. We found a place called 'Miller's Ale House' ( I Ride stop red south 23) which a MUST to visit. The food was amazing and you could buy 5 bottle bucket of bud, millers or coor's for $7.95... as you can imagine paying $6 per drink in the parks this was amazing value. Would defo go back, very much a 'Marriott' hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Sugarpuffs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel with our 2 year old in March for 2 weeks. We did a lot of research on Tripadvisor before selecting this hotel. The hotel was highly recommended. We were very pleased with our choice. The hotel was in a quiet position close to International Drive and the I-trolley. Our suite room was spacious and the bed comfortable. The complimentary breakfast was very handy even if the choice was limited. Great value for money overall as it included free wifi in the room and free printing in the computer lounge. Self service laundry facilities were cheap and very useful. The staff were great. In particular Stephanie and Manuel on Reception were very friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. We shall miss them! I would strongly recommend hiring a car if you stay at this hotel especially if you are staying with young children. The local area is not suitable for pedestrians! I would also advise venturing outside of International Drive as the area is a little disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: POLITA
Reviews.Content: ItÂ´s a clean hotel ideal for family trips. Breakfast is a plus but is not superb. Market and restaurants very near the hotel. Free parking. Comofortable and clean beds, thereÂ´s a sofabed in the for two teens. Highly recommended when travelling to Orlando taking in consideration that all part of the day we stayed at the parks area.

Reviews.Title: “Fab family value accomodation”
Reviews.Author: snwall
Reviews.Content: We first visited this property in Dec 2009 and returned again on 26th dec 2010, the suites are very spacious if you are travelling with a young family and as the main bedroom is seperated from the sofa bed giving parents added privacy.The rooms are very clean and comfortable and all the hotel staff are very helpful in catering to your needs. The free use of the internet just off reception will please most families with teenagers who like to keep up to date on facebook etc.The free breakfast is a great bonus and adds to the value of this hotel saving you more money for the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the theme parks!”
Reviews.Author: DuffyFarbon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel, slightly dubious about what we would find as it was so reasonably priced. The hotel is situated a stones throw from International Drive and it is a 'proper' five minutes walk away! Upon arrival, we were greeted with a smile and checked in quickly and efficiently. The room was spacious, very clean and tidy, and the room overlooked the pool and in the distance we could see Hogwarts at Universal (yes, it was that close!) The room was made up every day, and it was a great idea them leaving you the choice for fresh towels and sheets. The TV had ample channels free of charge and there were tea and coffee making facilities in the room. Breakfast is self service, with plenty of choice, fruit, pastries, cereals, juice, coffee, muffins, toast, yoghurts etc. The tea and coffee is self served from large canister pump flasks and is available 24 hours a day. One day our door handle broke from the inside of the room, we reported it to reception and it was rectified by the time we came back from our shopping trip. This hotel is ideally located if you have hired a car and want to do the theme parks and shopping. If you are a honeymooner or looking for a relaxing luxurious holiday with table service at breakfast then this is not the hotel for you. The hotel is situated far enough back from international drive that you do not hear any traffic or noise, yet close enough to walk to it. The staff were extremely friendly, helpful and polite. There was a free shuttle to Universal (recommend taking it) and the parking at the hotel as free as well. We drove to Walt Disney World and it was a 15 minute drive away, and Florida Mall was 20 minutes drive. There were I-Hop stops nearby, but we never made use of these as we had a car. We would definitely stay again, friendly staff, clean rooms, free parking!

Reviews.Title: “Whats with the sarcastic comments? - This place was great!!!”
Reviews.Author: 4Welshies
Reviews.Content: Great location just off' 'I' Drive and it was nice and quiet - ideal for families.A very clean and comfortable hotel with friendly and helpfull staff.I would definately stay here again and recommend it to anyone.The pool was nice and warm and there were plenty of clean towels for everyone.No Bar - but theres a seven /eleven just round the corner if you want a cheap drink for the room or poolside in the evening.(Free shuttle service to Universal and a short walk to the 'I'Trolley stops if you are not driving get a 14 day pass for the 'I' Trolley - great value for money) The free continental style breakfast was really good so make the most of it to start off your day! Loved our stay here and can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel. Only one problem!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMole
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a two week holiday recently. Super budget hotel in a quieter road just off I drive. Staff extremely friendly with a nice free breakfast, I would advise getting down early for breakfast as it gets very busy. My only issue is the amount of chavvy families and their kids running amok! For example the hotel provide free internet access with a guide saying no childen unless supervised and specifically no computer games. What do you find every morning- kids on the computer playing computer games preventing everyone else from using it for its intended purpose. A good hotel but if you want to avoid the above then think twice!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL BUT BETTER ON I DRIVE”
Reviews.Author: madpartyboy
Reviews.Content: first of all we would probaly stop here again if the price was right last year we stopped at homewood suites so fairfield was always going too be in the shadows ok the check in was ok although when we got too the room there was no rollaway bed which was pre requested upon going out for a meal on return still no bed so another trip to reception which then arrived within minutes also requested a small fridge which was brought promptly(limited availabilty on fridge though) the room was adequate hairdryer,tv,clean towels airconditioning was spot on not too noisy either the free breakfast was ok bit repetitive though after 14 days. but you can say that about all the hotels on i drive the staff were always friendly and polite and if needed would provide directions or advise the housekeeping did a fantastic job every day without fail,the only downside too this hotel is that if you are non drivers the 10 minute walk or so to international drive can be a bit tiresome every morning the road is very quiet no masses of traffic if you are considering this hotel it does deserve its top 20 rating on trip advisor but check out my review from last year on homewood suites we only had to pick this hotel as homewood suites would not sleep 5 in one room so we had too opt for fairfield i would stop her next year without any hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Thieves amongst staff. Beware”
Reviews.Author: user555
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of weeks ago and when returning from a night away in another hotel on the coast, i found that money had be stolen from my room from a member of their staff. This was not left lying around on the side but was in an envelope that was within two zipped up wallets which was in turn within a drawer inself. so someone had been rifling through my belongings looking for something to steal. Looking at what money i had there i believe they had done this twice over a 3 day period. Informed the management you could not care less about the situation, simply saying its not happened in over a year. So its clear that im not the first and will not be the last. Having been away the night it happened we were returning from getting married the night before over at cocoa beach. This really did put a damper on our whole honeymoon. Was told i would have to report it to the police and file a case if i wanted it taken futher but due to the amount that was stolen i was told that the police would just laugh it off. This is the sort of attitude that you are dealing with at this hotel. Informed virgin holidays who did try and move us to another hotel but was told that all other hotels in the area were booked up. Otherwise we would have been out of there a.s.a.p. I would never stay here again. The worst experience i have had with a hotel and shocking service when dealing with a theiving problem within their staff!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, comforting"”
Reviews.Author: Jen_4_10
Reviews.Content: "Wherever you go, there you are." I travel frequently. I always know that my Marriot is going to be comfortable. Sometimes one wants atmosphere and sometimes one simply wants a predictable place to sleep after a long work day. One wants to know that everything will work, and that there will be hot water and good water pressure in the shower. There will be cornflakes, fresh coffee, orange juice and bagels for breakfast. There will be nice people at the desk because all you want to do is check in and sleep . The beds will be comfortable. The pillows will be many and fluffy, and there will be loads of clean, soft towels. I've stayed at the International Drive FI several times, and this last time I brought my partner and young daughter along (who wanted to go to Universa). It was as pleasant and convienient as ever. Check- in is always a breeeze. We all slept well and will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: Forkhandels1
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a little gem and not looking for five star its a great base for universal and top end of international drive

Reviews.Title: “Fairly Good”
Reviews.Author: Jamie231085
Reviews.Content: We arrived here on 24th April-3rd May with Virgin Atlantic. At first we were fairly disappointed particularly with the location as the previous hotels we passed seemed far more central and generally looked nicer. When we checked in they took my card details for 'incidentals' and having checked out 4 days ago they have still not taken the hold off my card- so beware of that. We were disappointed with our room purely because of where it was located on the ground floor overlooking a concrete car park. As a result we suffered a bit of noise but not too much. The Air conditioning in the room is superb-if a little noisy and could hinder a good nights sleep! The beds were extremely comfortable and the rooms were kept clean most days. The cleaners did come round rather late (As late as 3-4pm) which was a pain when you wanted to go back to your room after visiting a park etc. The hotel run a courtesy shuttle to Universal which is rather rigid in its times. You can choose to go at 06:30 or approx 8AM and it does not return to pick you up until Half 6 at night. We were fairly fortunaqte to experience fairly fast queue times which meant paying for a taxi to get back- it was not over expensive and saved hanging around for 3 hours or so. The reception were helpful and polite at all times- their convenience store could have done with revising but fine if you wanted a 'soda' or a bottle of water. One major disappointment i felt was the small swimming pool. It was never very busy but in peak times you would struggle to get in!! It was not very deep either but i am just nit picking here. One thing the Hotel could benefit from is a small bar- it would be great to return after an evening out to a bar- because of the location i felt a little cut off at times. I'm sure there is better value to be found but on the whole it was a fairly pleasant stay and i would consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “Third stay and still great”
Reviews.Author: Englishlakedistrict
Reviews.Content: We picked this 5 years ago based on Tripadvisor reviews, location and cost. Once again we were very happy with everything. We had a King suite for 6 nights, as part of a 3 week tour, at a great rate (thank you) - which provided our 13 year old with a sofa bed and TV around the corner from us. The fridge was handy too. Breakfasts here we find are always busy (it is popular after all) ...but we never failed to get a seat within a minute or two. The pool was never busy when we went and was a nice temperature. We were able to walk to leave the car and walk to Chilli's restaurant nearby a couple of nights (there's a TGI Friday too), but drove onto International Drive most of the time. This hotel is a short drive to Aquatica, Seaworld and Universal Studios. (If you are only interested in doing the Disney parks I would stay nearer Kissimee.) Definately will be revisiting.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel,first class staff, better then the 2* rating”
Reviews.Author: mwh63
Reviews.Content: Just got back home ,and missing the hotel and staff already, nothing was to much trouble from day 1 to day 16. The reception staff (Stephaine, Manuel, and Francisco ) were great, will be booking this hotel anytime i'm in orlando.Rooms very clean tidy and ,showers great, had a pool view ground floor room which was very handy as the temps where near record highs for april. A free breakfast was served daily from 6.30- 10.00am, fruit,cereal,toast,danish pastry,juices,and coffee and tea all day.This amazing jewel in the crown hotel is just off I-Drive (about a 5 min walk once you find the short cuts )8-10 mins if you follow the road. Ideal for many restaurant .and only a very short drive to Universal Studio, in all a lovely hotel ,great staff and perfect place to enjoy Orlando and I-Drive "ohh and the parks" .

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Loves_Snorkeling
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before & after our cruise from Cape Caneveral. Hotel is located on a quiet side street paralel to International Drive. The service was excellent. They have a free continental breakfast & free wifi. They offer a free shuttle to Universal Studios but we did not use it. I like going /leaving when I want so we used the rental car The bed was very comfortable. Negatives; The lobby could be updated & there was a slight musty smell when getting off the elevators. We did not use the pool area because of lack of shadded areas. All in all I would stay here again for the price & location.

Reviews.Title: “I fully recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: limasboy
Reviews.Content: Positive aspects: 1) Location,very close to major activities 2) Cleanability 3) Good value for your money 4) Free internet 5) Free parking slots 6) Free breakfast (continental) 7) Friendly staff 8) Nice rooms with small kitchen and clean bathroom 9) Nice swimming pool Negative aspects: 1) There is no safe in room,only in the front desk,but it is free of charge 2) The breakfast could be a little bit better

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: JGM418
Reviews.Content: For a 2 * rating, this hotel was outstanding! We were able to check in a couple hours early without problem. Room was bigger than we expected - loved that the sink area was outside the bathroom. Refrigerator and coffee maker in the room. Breakfast area was large and there were many different choices - everything was good but they did run out of juice one day which was a problem. The coffee was excellent and availale 24/7. The pool area was large and clean with many chairs. Everyone working at the reception desk was helpful and friendly. Computers available to use - only problem were 2 unsupervised children jamming the printer and bugging people asking how much longer they were going to be. So many restaurants and activities within walking distance too. The free shuttle to Universal only leaves and returns twice a day at set times, but the taxi fares are very inexpensive. Cannot say enough good things about this place!

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Hikerman2007
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights while visiting two of the local parks. Convenient location. It's about a 10 minute drive to Sea World and five minutes to Universal Studios. Also a one block walk to International Drive and numerous eating establishments. The hotel was clean and well kept. I had a first floor room that was a bit musty smelling, but that went away for the must part when I cranked up the air conditioner. Free parking. Overall, a decent place to stay and I would not hesitate to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Sure why this place rates so high!”
Reviews.Author: will37862
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort through the Universal Studios website. It was part of a package where we recieved park tickets and a room. We picked this resort after reading all the positive reviews. After staying there I cant see how this place received such good reviews! 1. The biggest issue was our room. When we first went in it had a strong chemical smell and felt very damp. Thought it was because they just cleaned. But the smell and the dampness never went away! The room smelled weird the whole stay. And before anyone says all hotel rooms in florida feel damp and musty we moved to another resort after this one and didn't have that issue at all. We have made several trips to Florida over the last 10 years and this was a first. The 3rd floor hallway even smelled. It was very off putting. 2.The laundry room was a mess. HOT! No air in there left the room too hot. Out of the 4 dryers only 2 worked properly and the hot water didn't work on the washing machines. 3. The breakfast was so so. I have seen better and I have seen worse. 4. Didn't use the pool or pool area. 5. The hotel is nice and close to Universal Studios. Close to lots of dining also. All that being said the funky smell and mustiness of this resort would keep me from staying here again. The room was clean and bed comfortable but that smell yuck!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: altronics
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott Platinum members and have stayed at a lot of Marriott's. This hotel was very good for the price. My only critique would be that the decor was dated. Other than that the staff was great, the "free" breakfast was good as free breakfast's go. I saw some complaints about the breakfast but I thought you could get a healthy breakfast and leave full. I also saw someone post about the curtains that they only have shear see through curtains. This is not true and these people must not travel much! Also didn't have a problem with a smell must have been the level we were on which was the top level. Also, for location to Universal and SeaWorld we thought it was great they do have a shuttle but it only runs twice a day so we decided to drive and pay for parking - paid the upgrade to get even closer to the entrance and thought it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: CouplefromBristol
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks in March and had a lovely stay. The location was great for us as it is just off of the busy International Drive so nice and quiet, but also just around the corner from a few restaurants and bars (things like Cici's pizza - our favourite, and also TGIs, Chilis etc). The hotel provides a very useful free shuttle bus which goes to and from the Universal parks a couple of times a day. We used this service once even though we had a car as it was very convenient and saved on parking fees. Some of the main things we liked about the hotel itself were: very helpful and friendly reception staff, use of safe at reception for no additional cost, free internet use, great buffet breakfast (things like cereals, toast, oats, pastries, fruit, bagels, yoghurt, fruit juice), free tea/coffee 24 hours a day (just off the lobby area), very clean and comfortable room, good location, really handy laundry area with washers/driers for a small cost. We had a fantasic stay and would definitely go there again. We actually stayed in a more expensive hotel on i-Drive 8 years ago but much preferred this particular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - good location for Universal”
Reviews.Author: rgarick
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 nights at this Marriot property using points. We were pleasantly surprised at the great service, breakfast choices, cleaniness of room, and ease traveling to Universal. Although an older hotel, it is still clean and the front desk services were excellent. We would recommend it for travelers heading to Universal Studios....they even have free shuttle service to the parks and you will save the $15.00 per day parking charges.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: evedana
Reviews.Content: Clean, good location, nice breakfast. Kids loved pool a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Ilovefood914
Reviews.Content: The customer service And location was fantastic! The rooms were great for the price. A good stay for anyone including families. Good discounts for seaworld but make sure you have them explain everything. They left out the fact that we had to print out a coupon for quick cue. Don't hesitate to bring up issues or concerns they are more then willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Mainers
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night, on our way to airport, and were very pleased with the value. We paid just under $100, with AAA discount, and had a king with sofabed. We asked for a quiet room, and, altho it overlooked the parking lot, it was extremely quiet. The positives: The bed was very comfy and was double sheeted. There were plenty of pillows and towels, room was well lighted and bright, clean linens in the closet for the sofabed, 2 tvs, a radio/cd player with remote control, bathroom with the sink and counter space outside the bath/toilet area and free Wall St Journals and USA Todays in lobby. The room was clean and spacious. Pool area looked nice, altho we did not use. Breakfast was adequate - yogurt, bagels, cereal,oatmeal, juice. Did provide jelly, cream cheese and peanut butter for bagels/toast. The minor negatives: fan in bathroom could use a good cleaning, the furniture wasn't bad but could be updated, only shampoo and conditioner provided (no body cream or other amenities), ac/heat did not allow you to set temp on wall thermostat but was old system with controls on unit near window, no liners in waste baskets - maybe an oversight since baskets were clean ( couldn't help thinking of dirty diapers that could have been tossed in there), coffee maker is type that makes a single (paper) cup, only 2 paper cups are provided, no other utensils or dishware, so if you make anything in microwave (which is very small) or put yogurt in frig you need to bring your own (they do have plastic spoons in the gift shop downstairs). Overall, the room and service were better than expected. Especially liked having the double sheets and free WSJ - haven't found that in many hotels in this price range. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Older Style Place With Great Service”
Reviews.Author: pogoaddict4life
Reviews.Content: I travel to the Orlando area alot. With several trips to the International Drive area 4 times in March alone and this hotel was a good experience. The moment I walked in the door I was greeted with a smile by the front desk clerk who seemed to actually be glad she was at work. She was very helpful, gave me some good tips on the area and thanked me for choosing their hotel and made note of my elite Gold member status. She thanked me for being loyal to Marriott and gave me a room upgrade without me having to ask. I will say that the rooms here are older. Older furniture, older tube style t.v.. The carpet was worn and a chair in the room had stains on it. How ever, the room was clean just older. The bed was very comfortable and room spacious with a microwave and fridge. As well as a couch, work desk and chair. And I was able to use wireless internet. I didn't use the pool and didn't have a chance for breakfast the next morning, but from what I saw of the breakfast area they had some basic items they offered free like cereal, bread items, fruit, juice etc and kept the area clean. Check out was a breeze and I was again greeted by a smiling, friendly face to check out. The staff here cares about their guest. The hotel needs to be updated in the rooms with new furniture, tvs, etc.. but all in all it's a good hotel, in a good location for a good price. I would consider staying here again and if they remodel then I will stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: amy_manchester_uk
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you are on a budget and looking for somewhere in a fantastic location near to the parks! The hotel itself is just behind I-Drive off a quiet (but safe) road - Canada Avenue. The I-Ride trolley stop is a 2min walk away and there are plently of great restaurants a few minutes walk away too. Try Cici's for very cheap, great value pizza and also Chilli's for again great value mexican/american cuisine. Both of these places are literally a 4minute walk from the hotel and would be ideal for families on a budget. The hotel was clean, the staff were helpful and the facilities were great. There is a compuer room, laundrette, pool, jacuzzi, games room and mini shop all within the hotel. Breakfast was also brilliant, with a selcetion of hot drinks, fruit juices, bagels, bread, cereals, porridge, pastries, fruit and yoghurt it was an ideal way to fill up before heading out to the parks. We tried Sizzlers one morning as a change but becasue of the queues and expense we were very happy to be have the option of a free breakfast in our own hotel. I would definatley recommend this hotel - it does not have the 'wow' factor but you certainly dont pay for that. The hotel is most suited to families or young couples on a budget who want somewhere comfortable in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Leorion
Reviews.Content: For the first time in my traveler life, I'm going to write a 100% good review about an hotel. I've had such a great experience in this hotel and it would only be fair to give a little bit back to them. We stayed in Florida for 12 days and slept in 2 other hotels beside this one, in DisneyWorld and in Miami. The other hotels were a lot more expensive and the one in Miami was supposed to be "luxurious". We chose the Fairfield Inn because it was our last day and we had to go "low budget" to end our trip. It was our best decision ! It may have been the best hotel of all ! The rooms were big, nicely decorated, with a big bathroom and confortable beds. The breakfast was good, the accomodations were nice, and most of all, the staff was great ! They answered all our questions, told us how to go to Universal Studios or the Airport and how long it would take. But mostly, they've been really great with my forgotten camera. I left this expensive camera in my room and only realized it when we were at the airport, 90 minutes prior boarding. I called them immediatly, so upset about it, and they've managed to calm me down and they tried their best to send me a cab with my camera. When they realized they couldn't do that, they told me they would send it right away back to my home in France, by FedEx. I've received my package quickly and they had taken a great care of it ! My camera was bubblewrapped, put in a box which was also bubblewrapped, and there were a lot of "Fragile" stickers everywhere on the box. I don't take such a good care of my camera myself ! Their kindness and generosity was a very good surprise for a hotel, I'm amazed. I've used a lot of superlatives, but they definitely deserve it. I would recommand this hotel to everybody. Do not hesitate and choose this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Excellet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cas_2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks on our honeymoon, brilliant holiday and excellent hotel. Staff very friendly and helpful and the room service was first class. We hada suite room which was very spacious and the beds were huge and very comfortable. The hotel is a good base for exploring all the parks, free shuttle bus to Universal Studios which was very prompt. Wet and wild is just a few stops away on the i-ride. Sea World and Aquatica are excellent parks also and easy to get to by just jumping on the i-ride south side. We will definitely be back in Florida and back in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, comfortable and affordable! Can't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: MegB2003
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 4 night stay and we are extremely pleased. Check in was quick and easy and the complimentary bottles of water were a treat. We arrived later in the day but the front desk was able to tell us which of the many restaurants within walking distance was still open. Breakfast was always busy, but well stocked. We had no problem with the nice selection of danish, muffins, bagels, cereals and breakfast sandwiches and I can see how it might be repetitive if you're staying for an extended period of time but heck, it's free! The free Wifi was quick and easy to use. I much preferred it to the computers in the business center which were very slow, but did have a printer which was super helpful when checking in online and printing boarding passes. The shuttle ran to Universal 4 times a day. It would have been nice if they had more times available, but it's free so hard to complain. We had the king suite which was fantastic with the microwave and fridge available. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were clean. I did notice a musty smell right when we came off the elevator and in our dresser drawers, but not in our room itself. We had a terrific stay and wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel based on their helpful staff, comfortable rooms and affordable prices.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC HOTEL DO NOT HESITATE IN BOOKING”
Reviews.Author: ANDREA19011969
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 week stay at this hotel, from the moment we arrived we felt so at home and the staff are the friendliest ever, they cannot do enough for you. We did not want to leave and we will definately be going back. All staff will do anything for you, the free continental breakfast was great, we did go out and have an american fried breakfast at IHOP one morning but that was enough the breakfast at the Fairfield Inn was much healthier with cereal,toast, yogurt, fresh fruit bagels, pastries and even bacon cheese and egg rolls if you want them, Rooms spotless and cleaned every day, pool heated and open until 11 o' clock every night it was 88 degrees when we were there so some nights we were in the pool at 10 o clock it was like a bath. The hotel is in a perfect location just off International Drive so is nice and quiet. I have never written a review about a hotel before because they were all ok, but felt I had to write a review about this one because before I went I read the reviews of the Fairfield Inn and had mixed feelings what hotel was going to be like but we were absolutely delighted. Didnt want to go back to rainy Wales. CANT WAIT TO GO BACK. THANK YOU FAIRFIELD INN.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Redfibee
Reviews.Content: I could not fault this hotel, which is a rarity for me. Ok, it's not the most luxurious in town, but it is very comfortable. The staff are as friendly and helpful as you could wish for. The rooms were spacious and were kept very clean. The free breakfast was more than adequate. The children liked the games room. I liked the free internet acess. It's not on I Drive itself, and it has rooms that open to an internal corridor, both of which made us feel that the children were safer. Within walking distance of good places to eat with children - Golden Coral, TGI's, Asian Buffet and IHOP were the ones we used.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel close to Universal and Disney”
Reviews.Author: LuvSWA
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel as launching point for trip to Universal Islands of Adventure to visit Harry Potter theme park. Very happy with our choice -- clean and quiet, breakfast included, outdoor pool and hot tub, friendly and helpful staff. Also close to Disney, and good midway point for drives to both gulf and ocean. While room is not a true suite (the "bedroom" is not completely separate from the rest of the room), it was fine for us (parents and teens).

Reviews.Title: “What a fab hotel - excellent staff and service - great breakfast too!”
Reviews.Author: tinks2773
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home from our two week holiday where we stayed at the Fairfield inn on canada avenue - I have to say it was a lovely two week stay! The staff are so helpful and friendly and give directions to places - where to get best bus to various places, where to buy birthday cakes from - my daughter was 11 whilst we were away and they let me buy decorations and the General Manager put them up in the lobby so she would see them on coming down for breakfast - she was thrilled!! How many hotels would do that! The rooms were cleaned every day and fresh towels if you want them, also no need to bring pool towels as they supplied around the pool and then put in basket when finished!!! The breakfast was great and served from 6.30am til 10.30!!!! so plenty of time! coffee, tea, hot chocolate served all day and night as the equipment is there for you to use in the breakfast area! rooms also have a coffee machine in anyway! As well as an iron- ironing board and hairdryer!! so don't need to take much travel equipment! Use of safe deposit boxes FREE!! yes free in reception!!! Ok rooms are just two queen size beds, drawers and hanging space for clothes but they are clean and comfortable!!!! Good channels on the television too so if you do spend a bit of time in room its fine!!! Pool is outdoor and heated with a hot tub which is heated to 104degrees so lovely!! you can use it day and night!!! plenty of sunbeds too and sun is on the area all day til about teatime! Staff have to be the best - cannot do enough for you either - laura - stephanie on reception! great people!! Ricky around the pool and lobby who changes the water so hot drinks available all day not a problem!! nothing is too much trouble - just ask! Computer area - free internet for 15 mins sessions and printer for printing out check in details etc for airport!!! Taxi service in hotel and well trusted - M.A.R.S. Henry and staff lovely and on time if you book them to pick you up from somewhere!! Well what else can I say - except you won't be disappointed unless you're expecting 5 star which is isn't but value for money and location for international drive is excellent!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Above average stay.. Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: cumer64
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a long weekend in Florida, had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The hotel was clean the staff was very friendly and helpful. Would have no reservations about staying in this hotel again. Had nine people in my party, we rented three rooms, everyone had a wonderful time, and enjoyed their stay at the hotel

Reviews.Title: “No problems. Comfy beds. Basic accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: graciediane
Reviews.Content: We were not disappointed. This is a fine, basic hotel located next to the Pirate's dinner adventure along Canada Drive. I got a fantastic discount deal through my employer that was almost free, so I wasn't going to complain about anything. But here's the truth: Good Breakfast spread. Comfy beds. Plenty of cable channels. Clean building. Fast Check-In. I called ahead for a crib and it was already in our room on the top floor. I've stayed at a lot of hotels in Orlando. This was just fine, but very basic. You won't get a fridge/microwave in your room for this price, but you'll sleep well and have a place to shower & change. I actually prefer the Quality Inn down the street because it's within walking distance to the World's Biggest McDonald's (my kids love that) and has a fridge/microwave in each room. I still can't complain about this hotel. It served my family very well for 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thomesb
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 week stay at this hotel this hotel is situated just off I drive in a quiet location on canada ave. The staff are great always very helpful and polite. The room was great 2 double beds and seperate bathroom and was cleaned daily. The hotel offers a shuttle to universal twice daily and one at 8am and another at 11am and return journeys twice daily. They offer a free continental breakfast in a morning and free tea, coffee and hot chocolate are available 24 hours a day. there is a gym room not much in it but enough for whilst away if thats what you want. there is also a games room and a small shop which is reasonabley priced. The only problem that we had whilst there was that the pool heating was broken for the first 2 weeks but once this was established we were offered the use of another hotels facilities down the road and once this was fixed the pool was lovely and warm and the hot tub was very hot. The hotel is within easy walking distance of international drive where you can get the i ride up and down international drive. There are plenty of places to eat within walking distance. The hotel offers free use of computers which is limited to 15 minutes but can be extended if no one else is waiting to use them. We had an excellent time and would definately return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “YUCK!! My first bad trip advisor recommended stay!!”
Reviews.Author: zaezae
Reviews.Content: I don't know how my experience was SO different, but here's an account of how we liked this property. I regularly travel for work and regularly choose Fairfield Inn & Suites properties so I was ecstatic to see this hotel rated so high on trip advisor. I was travelling with my 3 yr old, hubby and 2 sets of grandparents to Orlando for a family vacation. The rate was O.k. at $94.00 per night. Keep in mind this is the major off season for Orlando, so consider that as well. When we arrived to the hotel at around midnight there was someone out front talking on a cell phone. We entered the lobby and there was not a desk attendant. Three people were waiting to make purchases from the 'marketplace' and we needed to check in. Turned out, the guy outside on the phone was the attendant. He was not in any type of uniform, didn't have a name tag or any way to distinguish he was an employee. He kept us waiting while he finished his phone conversation outside and then we waited while he helped all the guests wanting to buy food, THEN he helped us. We weren't able to get rooms on the same floor which was a dissapointment, but that's o.k. I was given room 420 and told there was a crib. My son is 3.5 and very tall. No way did I want or need a crib. He told me that I reserved it (I assured him I didn't) but I did request a fridge. He said he would ask housekeeping to replace the crib with a fridge (which never happened). When we got to the room, my bad feelings were intensified. The room was dank and smelled musty at best. The air condition was running but it didn't seem to do much to cool the room or remove the humidity. The furnishings are so outdated it's laughable and there is NO counter space to speak of. Our room was SO small that with the crib in the room, there was ZERO floor space. This might have been o.k. if we were travelling with an infant, but we didn't even want or need the crib. I made the mistake of sitting in the chair in the room also. It was coated with at least an inch thick of dust and dirt and it smelled awful. Stale smoke more than lingered in the air even though I was assured this was a non-smoking hotel. I called down to inquire about the condition of the room and I was told that all the rooms were the same, but I could get a different one if I wanted. Since it was after midnight and I needed to get my 3 year old to bed, I made a bad decision to stick with that room. I went down to buy a water and the desk attendent proceeded to tell me that he knows the hotel is old. He said that it had been in bankruptcy status until about 1 month ago, basically offerring that as an excuse for the poor state of the property. The bed & mattress were awful. The bedding was so old it was horrible. The bed itself was so terrible it should have been replaced long ago. We all rolled to the middle all night and didn't sleep a wink. It was so soft and lumpy it wasn't even fit for my toddler. The 'breakfast' also left much to be desired. I will compliment them on the hours though, they offer breakfast from 6:30-10am which is pretty generous. This is the only compliment you will find. The breakfast area is crowded making it impossible to walk between tables when they are occupied and it's also across from the 'game room' causign my son to be intrigued by that rather than want to eat. Although the choices to eat left much to be desired. The juice tasted very cheap and the other options were super limited. I would have rather eaten the junk they serve at McDonalds. We quickly decided to check out, even without having another room sequred before we left. The desk attendent encouraged us to try them again next year saying that hopefully they will have been updated by then. No thanks!

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: piupolino
Reviews.Content: Great location, average breakfast (everything is pre-cooked or packaged, nothing is fresh besides some fruits that needs 2-3 days to ripe). Rooms are OK but could be slightly bigger. If you are 4 make sure your go with kids otherwise teenager wonâ€™t fit in the double beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great !”
Reviews.Author: jimmyb01
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel is in a fantastic location. The free breakfast saves a lot of money as it is a mix of hot and cold breakfast items. The staff members are fantastic and the the public areas are calm and orderly There was a good vibe in this hotel because I think all guests seemed happy to be there. I will comw back.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent, clean, well located hotel. Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer87
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this clean, well presented hotel 17th-27th November 2010. Our standard room was big with 2 very comfortable beds. The view from our room at the back of the hotel was excellent. The pool was open at night and we even went in the outside Jacuzzi at 9pm. The breakfast was useful as it meant we could eat and go straight to the parks. We managed to eat healthy; bananas, Special K, toast and juice. You could access the tea and hot chocolate facilities throughout the day. The location was great for visiting the Universal Parks and Water Parks by car. Hiring a car also meant we could visit Busch Gardens and drive outside the tourist area for a Boggy Creek Ride. The hotel was a short walk to the worldâ€™s largest McDonalds, Popeye chicken, a Burger King and TGI Fridays. It is also in walking distance to the Pirate Show. We booked this hotel through Virgin and would recommend it to anyone staying in Orlando on a low to moderate budget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JKM15
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in Sep 09 and returned in Sep 10 as we were so impressed first time round and were not disappointed on our return trip. The hotel is ideally situated for walking distance to I-Drive, Wet n Wild and Universal (hotel do run a shuttle bus, times & frequency changed on return visit so not sure what it might be now). The rooms are big and very clean. The beds are comfortable. There is free parking and wi-fi available. It is a good location for driving to Disney, Malls, Outlets etc. We used the I-Drive bus a few times but it can get rather busy. Breakfast is ideal for starting your day and good enough selection. It can however get rather loud with kids and some adults forget there are other guests staying there too!! Pool area is alright and towels are provided however we have only used this once on our 2 stays as you feel like you need to be out doing stuff in Orlando and making the most of your time. If going in September Orlando do a "Magical DIning Plan" which is great value for money, lots of restaurants participate and is worth looking up online. The Point Orlando is good for food and City Walk is good for a night out. Hotel staff are very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location”
Reviews.Author: Michelle817
Reviews.Content: We booked a package thru Universal site for my daughter 15th bday celebration and got a great deal $$$. We stayed from Dec 9-15. The location is excellent, just minute (walking distance) from Intl Drive. We took advantage of the Trolley Service to get to Sea World, the hotel staff provided us a one day unlimited pass to ride on the trolley. Check in was pretty fast. We stayed on the third floor. I read some reviews here before our departure and a lot of people mention a musty smell which my husband notice right away in the hallways as the elavator door opened to get to our room. The room was cleaned, but I suggest the work on the decorations and update it with a modern TV. The complimentary breakfast was a plus, we didnt need to spend extra money on that but it was a limited supply of things: cereals, bagels, fruits, yogurt, juice, coffee, pastry. The hotel also offers free scheduled transportation to Universal Theme Parks which we also used. The staff was very helpful and kind, always willing to help. There is also a room with two computers which my girls (14 and 15 yrs)and I used a couple of times. The pool area was also cleaned and look nice, even though we didnt used it cause it was pretty cold (high 20s and low 30s) from us traveling from Puerto Rico. Defininately the hotel is a value if you are spending the days like us, out at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Good quiet location,v.friendly,helpful staff. Rooms cleaned daily. Good complimentary breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: truffles43
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good location, just off I drive. We had a great sleep every night as it was just far enough away from the action! The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Travelled with my Husband and 3 young children. The hotel was spotless, with rooms changed/cleaned daily. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was good. Not a lot of choice however it was more than adequate and saved us a huge amount of money over the course of the holiday! The hotel facilities are not amazing however they provided all that was required and lets face it who wants to spend lots of time in their hotel room in Orlando!! Nice pool, with easily accessable clean pool towels! The rooms werent massive but again for the money they were certainly satisfactory. To summarize, this hotel certainly provided everything required without the luxury/frills and gave excellent value for money. We had a great holiday and although I wouldnt necessarily choose this as my first option to stay at again, I also wouldnt be disappointed if it was the only thing available! Lets put it this way, I ve stayed at higher rated properties which have not delivered on facilities, staff, location etc. Maybe I wasnt expecting too much and therefore was pleasantly surprised!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price. Perfect for a visit to Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: gstravellerIndia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in November when I was visiting Universal Studios. The hotel is conveniently located close to Universal Studios and was just a short cab ride away. Since there were three of us travelling , we had asked for a rollaway bed which was not available. The room was otherwise fine, though the beds were rather small for two. While the hotel would not upgrade us to a room with a pull out bed normally, they did upgrade us later on based on my Marriott status. The second room was much bigger and had a nice workstation. We also had free high speed internet- though not wireless. It had a double pull out bed and plenty of extra blankets. Overall it was a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect place for a good price!!”
Reviews.Author: Esperanza_Turkey
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on TripAdvisor we decided to stay at this hotel. We made our reservation through Mariott's web page, and there was no problem at our check-inn. Our room was a King Bed Suite, with a microwave,and a small but useful refrigerator. The bed was comfortable after hours of walking in the parks and shopping malls. The coordinates was perfect, to reach Universal and Premium Outlets International drive(formerly Prime Outlets). Also a big Walmart was nearby(less than 10 minutes by car). TGI Firdays, Chili's, Mc Donalds, Popeyes and some other eateries around. The breakfast was good for me, but our friends didn't enjoy it much. (Bananas, apples, Cereals, milk, coffee, tea, some pastries, bagels, bread, grape and strawberry jam, and Philadelphia cheese, also some ham&cheese sandwiches) Never used the pool, but seemed quiet. We used the business center to print out our Disney's Magic Kingdom Christmas Party tickets, without a charge. There were vending machines on the floors, as well as a small shop at the front desk to buy soda and water etc. Which we found useful on our first day, No overcharge. The car park was big enough, never had a trouble finding a place to park near the door. Like I said, good value for the money we paid. Would definitely stay there if ever been to Orlando. (We spent only the first 5 nights here, when we visited Universal Parks, Seaworld, Premium Outlets, then we moved to a Disney hotel to be close to the Disney parks, it really was a good plan with young children.)(you can also read my review about Disney's Hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for budget travellers - you cannot beat the Fairfield”
Reviews.Author: iloveorlando
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in October 2010 - having had a pleasant stay in 2003. Not much had changed, (which was a good thing) and I would recommend this hotel if you want a central location - great for Universal visits; a clean and safe environment, a good freebie breakfast all at a great value price. We booked a double room, (for son and his friend) and a suite (for ourselves). The suite additions were a fridge, microwave, lounge area with tv and stereo. All facilities were good in the rooms, nice amenities and the coffee was most welcome. Housekeeping was excellent and actually, the best asset to this hotel is the staff. They are all very professional, friendly and helpful. This hotel is not 5 star luxury but offers a great base for families visiting Orlando, who are budget conscious. The buffet breakfast will set you up for the day. There is a pool and jacuzzi, small gym, games room for the kids, small shop, free internet and computer use and laundry service ($1 each for wash and dry and only 30 mins for each cycle!). This hotel is an excellent choice as it is central to the attactions. They run a shuttle to Universal, but not Disney. The car park is secure and there is never a problem finding a spot. Overall, you cannot beat the Fairfield. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jojopip
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the 2nd time & was just as impressed. Staff are amazingly helpful & friendly & we couldn't find fault in a single thing.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Happy friendly staff. Fantastic holiday...”
Reviews.Author: holidaysunited
Reviews.Content: just returned from a two week break at The Fairfield Hotel in Florida. This is a lovely little hotel, just off international Drive on Canada avenue. The staff are very welcoming and friendly and helped you in avery way they could.
