The hotel was all decorated for Halloween and my children took advantage of the lareg tub of sweets on the counter every day!! Breakfast is included at this hotel and is good because you get up early and would then have to go out and find somewhere to have breakfast. Cereals, toast, bagals, various pastries, hot bacon and cheese rolls and fresh fruit and yogurt. There is also tea coffee and hot chocolate available all day and night. The rooms are a good enough size with two double beds and are cleaned every day and linen and towels changed. Just across the road is TGI fridays and Chilis ( excellent place to eat with two for one on drinks all day and free refils for children. jump on the I trolley $1.25 and travel all the way up or down international Drive. to more excellent eating places like Olive Garden and Bahama Breeze and Tony Roma's. Also brilliant shopping at the outlets, one at one end of international drive and one at the other, with some great bargains to be had. This is a lovely little hotel with everyting you need, Friendly staff, games and computer room. Laundry room (saves on washing when you get home) and peaceful and quiet after a long hard day at the parks. Very recommended. Universal only 5 mins away in a taxi. my only slight complaint is that the courtesy bus runs at odd times, 7.30am (parks open at 9.00) and 11.30 and returning at 3.30 and 7.30.... but taxis easily available.. Hope to see you again soon. x

Reviews.Title: “Super-friendly staff, wish the hotel were a little closer to Universal”
Reviews.Author: TravelinKiki
Reviews.Content: During my stay of three nights, the staff was super friendly. They were more than happy to assist with my needs (calling cabs, holding luggage, answering questions, directions), and they always did so with a smile. Check-in was quick and painless. Our room was a generic room, but it was very clean. It did have a bit of an odor, but I attribute that to a lot of places that are in high humidity areas. My only complaint is that the hotel is a bit far from Universal and the shuttle service is extremely limited. There were two pick up times in the morning and two in the afternoon or evening. Otherwise, a cab costs $10 to get back to the hotel or there is a free 1.5 mile walk. I don't know if the shuttle runs more often in the summer, but it was very limited for my October visit. Overall, I would stay here again just because of the friendly service!

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: spunkygonecountry
Reviews.Content: Easy check-in arrived at 8am and gave us our room on 5th floor. Standard room, loud air-con, well insulated though. had view of Universal Studios. No problems with daily maid service. Breakfast as everyone mentioned is great and hits the spot. No bacon, eggs etc but didn't bother us. Daily free paper, no problem getting seat at breakfast. $7-$10 cab ride to Universal Studios. Short walk to TGI Fridays which we enjoyed one night. Disneyland - $25 cab ride. You can't beat the price for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: molly280
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights so we could visit Universal.The rooms are very clean and comfortable the staff were the friendliest we met in our 3 weeks stay in Florida.The only complaint we had was the airconditioning unit woke us up when it switched off,other than that we would recommend this hotel for short stays.Free breakfasts and all day free coffee were very much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price”
Reviews.Author: Lottenore
Reviews.Content: The Fairfield Inn & Suites at International Drive is in a great location, not far from Universal Studios. It offers a free shuttle to Universal, which only picks up from the hotel twice in the morning and then picks up at Universal once in the middle of the afternoon and then in the evening. It would be nice if the shuttle ran more frequently, but what's offered is definitely better than nothing. The hotel itself looks nice. The rooms are spacious. Breakfast is good and consists of an assortment of food, like pastries, cereal, fruit and yogurt. There's a pool and hot tub. The staff for the most part is very nice. Our big complaint was the musty smell on our floor (4th) and in our room as well. I didn't notice it too much in the hall after our first day there, but the smell lingered in our room the entire length of our stay. Another complaint is that the curtains on the windows are sheer and let in light at night. Our room happened to be opposite a large light in the parking lot behind the building. Also, there's an amusement park a few blocks over that is all lit up at night. This is a budget hotel and you definitely get what you pay for. I wouldn't say I would never stay here again, but next time I visit Orlando I might try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the Best”
Reviews.Author: subchat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night prior to our Cruise on the Monarch of the Seas and thereafter for 2 nights and it was probably the best hotel we have stayed in the USA. Situated off the International Drive with easy access to all the amusement parks it is a very peaceful and quiet location with all the fast food chains like Pizza Hut,TGIF,Sizzlers, Chillies etc. within easy walking distance. The pros were 1.Huge Comfortable Rooms, even by American Standards, with kitchenette with microwave and fridge 2. Soft Drinks and Ice Machine in the hallway 3. Tea/Coffee maker in the room. Apart from this tea and coffee were available throughout the day at lobby level 4.Friendly and helpful staff always smiling 5. Fabulous breakfast included in the price 6. Small shop of knick knacks and essentials in case you have forgotten something 7. Computer Room with free internet access 8. Convenient laundry Room on each alternative floor. Very handy if you have been travelling a lot There were absolutely no negatives that we could find. To sum up we had a fantastic time at the Hotel and will certainly recommend the same to all our friends. They also have a free shuttle to Universal though we did not use it

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: DDeluna
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great place to stay for my visit to Uninversal Studios. The breakfast offerings were what you would imagine - cereal, pastry, fruit, bagels, toast and Jimmy Dean Suasage sandwhiches. The pool was nice a big with chairs and towels available all day. Con - if you do stay here consider a rental car. I had originally planned to use the hotel shuttle to UNiversal but it only went twice a day and very inconvenient hours and th hotel isn't exactly on I' drive to get public transportation. A taxi is about $10 (I don't know if that was 1 way or RT) but parking at UNiversal is $15 and you can go in and out all day.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION FOR ORLANDO”
Reviews.Author: NEIL14
Reviews.Content: The Fairfield Inn was in a great location for all the theme parks. The staff were all very freindly and could not do enough to help us. We had a one bedroom suite which was very well equipped. The free breakfast consisted of fruit, cakes, bagels cereal, yoghurts and egg muffins. There was free coffee and tea 24 hours a day, there was also free wi-fi which we found very useful. There were many eating places within easy walking distance of the hotel. Overall we would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great base for a holiday”
Reviews.Author: erinleeGlasgow
Reviews.Content: free breakfast loads of choice. nice rooms ,never seen the kids either in the pool or arcade fitness room or computer room, nothing too much trouble for staff ordering pizzas to your room or giving directions or advice, all in all a great stay would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, Great Staff, Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: jayne1967
Reviews.Content: Returned today from a fortnights holiday. This is our third trip to International drive, and this was by far the best hotel, we have stayed in. The staff were excellent, so helpful and knowledgble...nothing was too much trouble. The hotel offers free shuttles to universal studios, which was very useful for non drivers. The hotel is set in a very quiet location, but within a couple of minutes walk from local restaurants etc. The hotel also offers a varied free breakfast, which really helps if you are on a budget. Would book this hotel again without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomeboy
Reviews.Content: hi to all who read this my wife kerri and i stayed at the fairfields for our 3 week trip to orlando and we found the hotel very clean and the staff was just fantastic very friendly and polite from the cleaners to the managers they could not do enough to make our stay enjoy able . the front desk staff was a credit to the hotel name and company. the room we had was a suit room 208 on the 2nd floor it was very clean and always smelt fresh the cleaners took good care to ensure we had no complaints. the room had two televisions a sofabed and an armchair and a table with two chairs and a coffee table and a cd player. the bedroom had a t.v a clock raido alarm and a super kingsize bed the kitchen area had a small fridge and a microwave oven. who could ask for more the bathroom was very nice and spotless clean with a bath and shower and of course a toilet.just down the hallway from our room you had a drinks machine and a ice machine so everything we needed was there the hotel also had a small shop a gamesroom to keep the kids happy a very nice pool and they even had a small gym. breakfast was layed on every morning with a huge choice of things to eat. free 24 hour tea coffee and hot chocolate was there if you wanted it and a computer room for checking your emails facebook etc what more would anybody need? we will be going back and staying there for our holiday next year. we have been to orlando before but we can put our hands on our hearts and say the other hotel we stayed at was no where need as good as this one

Reviews.Title: “Hassle Free Stay”
Reviews.Author: eep69
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights, Sept. 20/21. Family of 4 arrived @ 6pm,check-in took 5mins. Got a nice ground level room w/view of pool. Laundry room across the hall which made Mommy happy. Used shuttle for Universal which ran on exact time but does stop at 3 additional hotels along the way so factor a minimum of 30mins. to get to the park. Breakfast was basic,plentiful & free! Pool & Hot Tub very nice. Games room kept kids entertained for at least 30mins. Business centre was convenient except for the Tweens checking Facebook. Free WiFi available too. All in all no issues in our 2days and we'd return in the future if we were in the area.

Reviews.Title: “I just carnt believe what she said”
Reviews.Author: Chrismclean
Reviews.Content: I have just read a review from a young lady that said the place had a bad smell and was very poorly maintained.All i can say to that is it must have arrived when she did.As i have been there three times already and had no problems what so ever,and the staff and cleaners were just great at what they done.I and my family would also recommend this to anyone for a great holliday hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: JuliaandTony
Reviews.Content: My family, friends and I enjoyed two weeks at this hotel. Was a great base for all the parks. All the staff were very friendly and very helpful. Rooms were big enough for my family of five, one aged 14 and two at 12 years. Two big double beds and a rolloway bed, although more drawer space would have been better but it was not a problem. Air conditioner was a bit loud but again no probs.Rooms cleaned everyday and towels replaced if required. We had a fuse go in the hairdryer, we reported the fault and it was fixed the same day. You don't need to take beach towels as there are plenty of complimentary clean towels by the pool that you can use. My kids loved the games room. The complimentary breakfast was lovely, just what you need for a long day in the park. The endless supply of free Coffee, Tea and Hot Chocolate were fantastic. The pool was fine although we didn't spend much time there and it could have been colder. It was so hot and humid in July/August. Overall I would gladly recommend this hotel excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: Dead-metal
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks in this hotel and found it just a plain average hotel. Nothing was special about it at all. Yes you get free breakfast but it's not a great selection and many other hotels offer a far better free breakfast. The rooms are quite small and the bathroom sink is very cramped. The "kitchen" is a microwave and a small fridge. We spent one week in one room until the leaking air conditioning unit made the carpet so damp that we couldn't stand the smell any longer. The hotel's solution to the problem was to try to dry the carpet with a large and even noisier fan next to the bed. We asked to move rooms which we did. The room was clean. The swimming pool was small but in the sun but they did run out of towels quite often during the day. It was also accessible from the street so anyone could just walk in and use it which is a concern if you have children. The free wi-fi is a bit hit or miss, some areas have a much better signal than others. I wouldn't stay here again as there are far better hotels within the same price point.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: ProG77
Reviews.Content: This hotel cost us Â£150 for 6 nights stay through Virgin Holidays - for that price, I really cannot fault this hotel. Located just off I-Drive, very close to the Interstate 4 (had a hire during our stay) so excellent location for exploring Orlando and further afield. The hotel offers free parking, free breakfast (which did the job, although was a little repetitive and uninspiring with only 1 hot food item). A major plus point for offering complimentary newspapers in the lobby, tea/coffee machine in the breakfast room all day and night and FREE wi-fi internet connection in-room and around the hotel and 2 PC stations with printers in the business centre on the ground floor. Rooms were very clean and good size - A/C, although a bit noisy was easy to control. Could have done with an in-room safe but overall the hotel felt safe. The staff were pleasant and helpful whenever we came in to contact with them but there was no porter service which would have been very welcome with a pregnant wife! The pool was clean, well maintained and not busy. Also had plenty of sun loungers, complimentary towels, cold shower and a spa. There is no life guard at any time. Eating wise, there is no restaurant or room service in the hotel, but there was a small shop which sells basic snacks and drinks. There really is no need for a restaurant as you can get takeaway delivered from several well known food chains to your room. Also, within a 5 min walk, there is a TGI, Popeye's Chicken, Perkins and a fish restaurant and a McD's. Overall, pleased with our stay but might try a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, safe hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidaymaker655
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 weeks due to the volcanic ash disruption. The Virgin service was first class and the hotel offers all the facilities you would expect for a 3 star hotel. Complimentary Continental breakfast was included and there was always plenty of selection up to 9a.m.. The pool was a little small but considering you are out most of the day it is sufficient. You are located just of I-Drive and it is 5mins by car to the excellent array of restaurants. I would reccomend this hotel to families and couples visiting the theme parks

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel right in the centre of all the action!”
Reviews.Author: mojomonkey
Reviews.Content: I could not fault this hotel! We received a friendly greeting, and were given a great price. The rooms were immaculate, with tea and coffee and a big, comfy bed with lots of pillows! The hotel is just a couple of minutes walk from International Drive and is in the perfect location for exploring! The hotel itself is quiet, with a great pool to relax by... If you have the time! The breakfast was good, and the maid service was excellent, I really can't recommend this place highly enough, and will definitely be checking in again!.. BEST VALUE FOR MONEY IN ORLANDO!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location to Universal Studios!!!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaPanthersfan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Fairfield Inn on Canada Avenue. It was a great stay overall. About a 5 minute drive to Universal Studios and walking distance to International Drive. I loved not being right on International Drive because the traffic is always a nightmare and I always avoid it and go to CityWalk instead. That made it easy for us to leave the park to come back and shower then go back to CityWalk at night for dinner. The hotel was a good value. There was free coffee/tea in the lobby 24 hours a day and the free breakfast was decent. More choices would be nice though. It was sorta limited but it was nice to have something. The room was a great size with 2 comfortable double beds, a desk and chair, WiFi, and clean bathroom. The only things I didn't like were that there was no Fridge and the TV was one of the old style tube TVs. Over all, this hotel was a great value and the location was great. I would return if I could get a decent rate.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need updating.”
Reviews.Author: simflan
Reviews.Content: Situated on a quiet road just off International Drive,this hotel has a large lobby and breakfast room(the breakfast is free), and a lovely well kept pool with clean towels laid on for you. The room we had on the 4th floor was disappointing. Yes it was clean and the beds(although a lot smaller than other hotels)were comfy,but the decor left a lot to be desired. Who thought of painting a really small bathroom a shade of orange??? The seperate basin area was very small.There is no safe in the room(surely a must).You have to go down to reception and get one there(free)but it is hardly convienent nor private. The tv was the type with the back sticking out(all the other hotels had large lcd tv's).The A/C was loud and woke you up during the night. I wouldn't be against staying there again but there are more modern hotels for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to unwind after a day at the theme parks!”
Reviews.Author: Beeker72
Reviews.Content: We booked this holiday through Universal Studios and chose this hotel. We were so happy with our choice. We upgraded our room to a suite for 11$/day and we did not regret our decision. I highly recommend this option if you are traveling with kids. Excellent location and staff (restaurants nearby-walking distance). They made our stay extremely enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for The Disney Parks etc”
Reviews.Author: kellyhatty
Reviews.Content: We booked this through Virgin. Room was nice and big with fridge Breakfast was an added bonus and lovely TFI friday on the corner of the road - ideal for evening time This was a good base for our disney break! Pool was lovely and cold which you need in the heat ! Free coffee all day (plus tea - hot choc etc) No bar which is a shame Small amusement area for kids Towels provided for pool Great Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jenny_7801
Reviews.Content: The room are just what you see in the pic. The hotel is in a great location walking distance from int. Drive. Continetial Breakfast was ok. After the three day you get tired of the same thing. Very clean and lot of parking. Good service. The only issue was when I arrived they did not have my room available. The upgrade me to the suit that was not what I want to be opening and closing the sofa bed but the next day they move us to what we had reserved.

Reviews.Title: “Place is perfect for holiday and staff are amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: markpc2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairfield Inn & Suites from 30th June to 14th July 2010. We arrived mid afternoon and check-in was really quick and easy. Chris checked us in and was very helpful. Got our room request of top floor - room 536. Room was big and spacious, 2 good sized double beds, desk with phone and chair, plenty of drawers etc. Bathroom was good sized with shower over bath and toilet. Good space outside the bath with sink, big mirror, hairdyrer and room for cosmetics. First impressions were that the room was clean and perfect for us! Got to say I am not quite sure where a rollaway bed would go! We did not notice any smell at all that others having been referring to. The breakfast is great - milk, orange juice and usually one other (apple or cranberry), loads of cereals (all kelloggs!!), bagels, muffins, bread, toasters (2), fruit, yoghurts, microwave ham and egg sandwiches, pastries and cakes. Really busy during July but we got a table every morning bar one when we sat outside. The free Wifi in the room is a total bonus and it works well. If you don't have a laptop or Ipod with you, there are 2 PC's next to the lobby which give free internet access. If busy, they are limited to 15 mins and you just politely inform whoever is on this that this is the policy. The staff is what makes this hotel what it is. They are very helpful and go out of their way to help you. Chris and Laura on reception are first class and the housekeeping kept our room spotless all holiday! We asked for a fridge when we checked in and were put on a waiting list - we got it delivered to our room the next day!! We had a light bulb out in our room, told Laura, it was fixed within minutes - you can't ask for better than that! The hotel is on Canada Ave, literally mins from International Drive (cut across the grass and wee bridge next to the pub and you come out at Cici's pizza). The road is very quiet and away from the hussle of I-Drive. I don't recalling having to yield (give way) to any car when leaving the hotel. I agree strongly with the other reviewers about the junction of Sand Lake Road and Canada Ave - it is a nightmare!! The drivers are so rude and completely block the road even though they can see you are sitting waiting! Try going right out of the hotel and either go left and left again to go along I-Drive or go right and right and come along Universal Bld and turn left onto Sand Lake Road (both have lights which make it quicker). We hired a car for the 2 weeks and it was great. Go to universal after 6pm as parking is only $3. Recommended shops to go to include Premium Outlets at the top of I-Drive and the Florida Mall. The Mall at Millenia is a bit posh and Prime outlets are not as good as Premium. Restaurants I would recommend are Cici's pizza, ponderosa, olive garden and perkins. Overall, we loved staying here and it is the perfect place to stay - comfy beds, great rooms, fantastic staff and close to the parks! Will def stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “second time around”
Reviews.Author: NorthernIrelandGaz
Reviews.Content: just returned from my second stay at the fairfield in two years, and the fairfield still filled all my expectations, we stayed in a standard room with a roll away bed as there is 5 guests in my party, we requested a fridge and promptly recieved one (no charge). laura at reception is a credit to the hotel managment, she couldnt do enough for us. breakfast is more than ample( saves you at least 30 bucks a day to feed a family of 5). stayed at the hard rock hotel for 2 nights & 3 nights at marriott suites at clearwater during our 3 weeks vacation which are both better standard hotels but never felt out of place returning to the fairfield each time. one slight flaw is the hotel could do with upgrading carpet areas in hallways and bedrooms and upgrade tv's to flatscreens but the free wi-fi connection in all rooms is excellent , i would recommend you give it a go you wont be disappointed. in my last review in july 2008 i mentioned i would return for harry potter the ride just totally rocked . wonder what disney will come up with to compete with universal they really need to up their game we .hope to return to the fairfield in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleased with our stay!”
Reviews.Author: busykidmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairfield Inn from July 13-July 18, 2010 so our son could participate in a sporting event at the Disney/ESPN Wide World of Sports Complex. We spent all day July 12 reading reviews online before we finally settled on the Fairfield Inn at 1 AM July 13 (made reservations and we left for Orlando at 4AM) after reading all of the reviews here on Trip Advisor. We arrived at the hotel at around 4PM and when I inquired about AAA, I received a lower rate than was quoted online. We had a queen bed in a corner with pullout for our son in the living area. The room was very clean and roomy. We liked the fact that the sink area was outside the bathroom and the bathroom had a continuously running fan. The room had two big TVs, microwave and a refrigerator. We had to be at the Sports Complex early everyday, so the free breakfast from 6:30-10 every morning was a BIG plus for us. The breakfast selection was huge. The breakfast staff was constantly putting out food, wiping down the tables and answering questions for the guest. Had two big flat screen TVs to watch while you ate . I also like the fact that they had Purell hand sanitizer stations around the breakfast area for those who wanted to use them. My husband would say every morning that he didn't se how the hotel made any money with the breakfast that they "gave away" every day. When the staff would clean our room everyday (they did a fabulous job) they would leave 3 sets of towels, but we always needed an extra set because we wanted to refresh after having been out in the Florida heat all day, so I would inquire about extra towels before going up to our room and no sooner had we closed the door, house keeping would be knocking with the extra towels! The hotel was very clean, 100% smoke-free. Every morning when we got off the elevator for breakfast there was the USA Today AND The Wall Street Journal stacked for anybody who wanted to take them! A big plus for me since I don't travel with an internet phone or laptop. We stayed on the 2nd floor and never had any issues with noise overhead or anything. We never used the outdoor pool, but did walk by a couple of times and noticed that it looked kind of small. The area where the hotel is located is surrounded by restaurants and shops. The grounds were very well maintained and nicely landscaped. You would always see people out walking. Felt very comfortable in the neighborhood. The only complaint we had with our visit, was that it was often difficult to exit Canada Dr. onto Sand Lake because cars would block the exit and traffic was constantly backed up, but when we got out, we were on our way in no time. The staff was always extremely helpful, friendly and courteous. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty close to perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: TAndersonfam09
Reviews.Content: My husband, mother and our 4 year old daughter stayed from July 9-14, 2010. I booked through the Sea World website and we got a fabulous rate. It included length of stay passes to Sea World and Aquatica and our Marriott stay. The room was ample for the length of stay. We weren't there that much. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. The hotel provided a good breakfast with yogurt, breakfast sandwiches, fruit, danishes, cereal, oatmeal, bagels, muffins, juices and coffee from 6:30 am-10 am. There seemed to be sufficient space in the dining area and there were also tables by the pool that people used. They provided to internet computers for guest, The only issue is that kids seems to be on them often playing games. The front desk staff was very friendly and have directions printed on 4x6 cards to most locations. We were in the center of everything the location is fabulous. The only complaint my husband had was getting in and out of the hotel and on to Sand Lake Dr. People block the entrance. But other than that we were close to many restaurants and international drive. The outlets were very close as well. We would stay again in a heartbeat. It was a well priced and provided great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Vacation08
Reviews.Content: The Fairfield Inn & Suites turned out to be a great choice for a vacation stay. The staff was friendly and the accommodations clean. Breakfast was available every morning which was very convenient for getting out to some of the parks for the day. There was a fitness center on site and newspapers available. Everything we needed was there and it made things easy. The location was great. It was the perfect place for an Orlando stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to Universal Studios Orlando”
Reviews.Author: BellaRaina
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Fairfield Inn & Suites Orlando International Drive back in January. We drove up to Orlando from Miami to go to Universal Studios for the weekend to celebrate my birthday. We booked a vacation package through Universal Vacations and the Fairfield Inn was one of the hotel choices we were offered. Since I am a Marriott Rewards member and the hotel was so close to the park, the choice was easy. The room was very clean, as a Rewards member my preferences are high floors and extra pillows & towels and they did not disappoint. The bed was very comfortable and we had a great nights sleep, in the morning I almost did not want to leave the shower because that shower head was Heavenly! Before leaving for the park we went to the breakfast room, there were pancakes and cereals and microwaveable breakfast sandwiches, bagels, english muffins and fresh fruit along with OJ and other juices, yogurt, milk and coffee. The only complaint really was from my boyfriend and it was that the AC was a bit too cold, but after I told him to lower the temp he stopped complaining. All in all, I would definitely stay here if and when I am in the area again. The staff was very friendly and courteous and I really have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “100% spot on Excellent all the way!!!”
Reviews.Author: BallyclareBallyclare
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a very clean well located vfm hotel stop looking and book!! Hotel is 5 mins from the i ride stop,cut across grass towards oshucks bar and you are there.We did without ahire car and never missed it,17 dollars for 2 weeks unlimited travel on i ride per adult and free for kids. Taxi approx 8 dollars to Universal (parking for car is 14) Plenty of eateries within short distance. Hotel breakfast is a good start to day,deposit boxes are free and coffee on tap all the time. There is a laundrette which costs $1 for wash and $1 for dryer and machines are huge capacity. Pool is open 6am to 11pm Staff are excellent and anything asked for is done with no fuss,we asked for a fridge and when available was provided foc. All in all unless you are Rockerfeller this hotel will satisfy your needs,only downside is no bar or restaurant but ordering food to room or poolside from local eateries is perfectly ok,in fact if stuck staff will help you out. Great spot to stay.Rooms are plenty big for 2 adults and 2 or 3 kids.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good value, convenient place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelkitty28
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and enjoyed my stay as it was very quiet, and convenient to everything, yet out of the busy traffic area. The breakfast buffet (which was included was good, it had large sorted bagels, bread, muffins, fresh fruit, yogurts, and certeals as well as microwavable frozen foods to choose from. There is a nice outdoor patio to eat on or inside with ample seating. The front desk was very nice and helpful. The room was quiet, comfortable bed and pillows. Bathroom was a little small but to be expected in this category. The pool was nice and never crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: xchemox
Reviews.Content: This was my first holiday abroad with my boyfriend, and what a fantastic hotel Virgin Holidays suggested. All members of the Hotel were accommodating, and polite, the cleaners came in and tidied our room everyday, and even lined up all my teddies I had collected from the parks. The Receptionists, they were so friendly and helpful. The rooms were spotless, of a good size with plenty of storage. We was on the top floor, out of the way of most people, it was so quiet and we had a brilliant view of the pool and could see Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure so clear. The Hotel was in a fantastic area, 2 mins walk from International Drive. Which had many resturants, supermarkets, souvenir shops and other attractions to visit. The Hotel also had a big swimming pool and jacuzzi, hardly anyone used it, so we had the pool to ourselves on a few occasions. As well as the pools, the Hotel had a gym room, games room and computer room, with free internet usage. The free breakfast was fantastic! So much variety of food, from cereals, bagels, toast, muffins, doughnuts, scones. They had hot drinks and cold drinks, lots of fresh fruit, and the teas and coffees were avaliable allday everyday. Overall I would give this Hotel 10/10, I could not fault it. I would advise anyone to stay at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: norfolk11
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a wonderful experience in Orlando. There were 11 of us including my 2 grandchildren, who were there for the first time. I can't rate this hotel highly enough. The service was exceptional and nothing was too much trouble. They arranged taxis for us, finding the cheapest and most reliable. I was ill for two days and they phoned the room to make sure I was ok and if I wanted anything. As there was no bar in the hotel, they suggested we get beers and food in which was excellent on our return from the parks. The rooms were large and comfortable, cleaned every day on request ( they are an eco-friendly hotel ) The facilities are second to none. I was so impressed. A " must" hotel if we return to Orlando

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: floridafreaks1998
Reviews.Content: This has got to be the best hotel we have ever stayed in.we as a family have been coming to Florida since 1998 and stayed in many hotels on I-Drive and this is the cleanest,comfortable and nicest hotel.The staff are happy,friendly,polite and couldn`t do enough for you.We stayed for 21 nights and never had one complaint or any trouble at all during our stay.We are returning in 2012 and will definatly be coming back.The pool was always clean and tidy and the breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet oasis amid tourist chaos”
Reviews.Author: curlieque
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the May shuttle launch based on previous reviews. Cold breakfast buffet was extensive, just wish they'd had wheat bread, not just white. Also, the one day it was crowded (a school band had shown up), those of us who went outside to eat had to keep knocking to be let back into the breakfast area. Aside from these nuisances, highly recommended & great value! We ate off the tourist track, for those who are interested--all these places had good food & were recommended on Yelp: Nile Ethiopian Cuisine, 7040 International Drive (near hotel)--eat with your hands, the kids will love it Padrino's Cuban Bistro, 13586 Village Park Dr @ John Young Pkwy-- a bit far from the Fairfield hotel, but good food Anatolia Mediterranean Cuisine, 7600 Dr Phillips Blvd #108 (other side of I-4)-- expensive, but you've never had a kabob platter like this! Tabla Indian Bar & Grill, 5827 Caravan Ct--in a weird hotel/office area, all meats are Halel Ethos Vegan Kitchen, 1235 N Orange Ave--ate lunch in downtown after visiting the Leu Gardens Hanamizuki Japanese Restaurant, 8255 International Dr #136 (behind Ripley's Believe it or Not)--expensive, so we followed others' advice and had lunch here before going back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A good value for money hotel, with EXCELLENT staff.”
Reviews.Author: Clockyorange
Reviews.Content: Been to orlando several times, with this being our 1st time at this hotel. We stayed in this hotel for 3 weeks from middle of April 2010 to mid May 2010, having booked it through Virgin Holidays. Overall I would say this is a good value for money hotel. It is not a 5 star hotel (or even 4 star) so don't stay here if your expecting 4 or 5 star quality. Firstly ALL staff were excellent. e.g. on our first day we were heading out to Denny's for breakfast and stopped at reception to ask if we could have a fridge put in the room. After returning from breakfast (1hr later) they had already put it in the room!! we were astounded how quick they were, and this excellent service was repeated continously throughout the stay. 10/10 for service. I actually found the hotel to be very quiet for the whole 3 weeks. In fact the only time it seemed busy was at breakfast, and still there was no problem getting seated and fed (indeed the breakfasts were an excellent alternative from the numerous diners (they offer cereals, fruit, various pastries, juices, coffees, bagels etc.). It is a help your self service, and therefore whilst it's obviously not the ritz, it is still excellent value therefore I would rate 8/10. Rooms were adequate, providing us with everything we needed (fridge, tv, iron, hair dryer, good shower free wi fi), and the room was clean and tidy (the maids did an excellent job every day). The only MINOR issue I would say would be that there was a slight "smell" in the room, which whilst not being aweful, was noticeable every time I stepped into the room, however this was easily remedied by buying an air freshner from the local grocery store, as well as leaving the window open. Rooms were also a good enough standard, and all fixtures and fittings were in an acceptable condition (not brand new, but what do you expect in a hotel on international drive in orlando!!!!!). I would therefore rate the rooms 7/10. I would rate location 10/10 as it is is superbly located just of international drive. We found canada avenue to be a very quiet road, with MINIMAL traffic on, and it felt very safe (we never once saw or heard any trouble at all). Whilst we had a car, we walked to restaurants of an evening (at various times of day/night). TGI is literally 4 minute walk away (excellent), Chillis (excellent food and had bogof drinks) is 7 minute walk away, dennys is 11 minute walk away, bahama breeze is 25 minute walk away, and pointe orlando is 30 minte walk away . There must be another 50+ retaurants easily within 20 minute walk away, but the ones noted are where we enjoyed. We also enjoyed playing mini golf (20mins walk away) and go-karting (10 min walk away). Wet and wild is also 15-20 min walk away. Shuttel bus leaves at 8.30ish which takes you free to islands of adventure/universal and comes back around 6, we didnt use, but we saw people using it on a daily basis without any hassle. It also cost us $8 + $2 tip for a taxi to and from City Walk (MEARS TAXI!!!), again all times of day and night so felt very safe and secure. Hotel had a security guard and porter on when we went past at 12am and 2am and 5am, so always felt that it was a safe environment.. We had the use of a free security depopsit box at reception, there is a cash machine (max withdrawal per day is $200) and small shop to buy some groceries, and as much coffee as you can drink (24 hrs a day). Pool was amply sized with only a hadful of people using it. Finally Pirates dinner is literally right next door so 3 minutes away (although we went and will defintely NOT be going again as once you paid your admission, you then have to buy a "souvenier" mug to drink your first alcoholic drink from - COMPLETE joke!!! $14 for 1 drink). Overall I cannot really fault this hotel, both myself and my wife would quite happily stay here again, and would have no issues recommending it anybody else!! Yes we have stayed in better hotels, but for the price range for this is definetly amazing value for money. THIS IS A GREAT HOTEL!!! Enjoy your stay!!! we did

Reviews.Title: “Do Believe The Hype.....This Place is Greattttt!!”
Reviews.Author: MancCrew
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place is great...the staff...the cleanliness.....the other guests that stay there....the location....the free breakfast buffet....literally eveything Well Done Marriott Group and especially well done to the management and desk staff as well as the cleaners and security guys there ....They made our stay in Orlando a perfect one...were already trying to rebook the same place for next year :O)

Reviews.Title: “Staff is great but the hotel is no 5 out of 5, especially for an independent traveler”
Reviews.Author: Hiker30
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel for the price we paid ($77 per night), but I'm a little surprised that it ranks so highly on tripadvisor. I stay at a lot of Marriott properties (platinum member), and this Fairfield Inn is far from the best of that brand. First, I agree with the reviewers here that the staff are friendly and will help you quickly. I also think that the onsite amenities are good for families (game room with pool table and video games, hotel convenience market, outdoor pool). The breakfast area is gigantic by Fairfield Inn standards so seating wasn't a problem. I did have some trouble getting my desired room choice at check in, because this hotel is a favorite of groups coming to see the Orlando sights. There were several groups there on the night I checked in and various groups came and went over the three nights I stayed at the property. LOTS of kids, of all ages, and yes, they hang out in the hallways. The room I started with was on the first floor (only room available with two beds for that night). The next day I was moved to a higher floor and a quieter end of the hotel, but the room layout was identical. Both rooms were clean but the furnishings, carpet etc. were dated and looked a little worn. Tube tvs. The beds had latex foam mattresses and plenty of pillows, I slept well on nights 2 and 3 (kid noise on night 1). Overall not a bad place, but definitely geared more towards groups and families with kids, so independent travelers might feel overrun by the masses, and the rooms have a "motel" kind of feel. There are several restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. Parking, wifi, and breakfast were free.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel - first rate!”
Reviews.Author: pigletpink
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely first rate, outstanding hotel. Situated on Canada Avenue, about 3 mins walk from International Drive. Rooms are spacious, exceptionally clean and very well serviced. The reception staff are fantastic and their level of service is second to none. Nothing was too much trouble for them and they went out of their way to make sure that our stay was a good one. The lobby/eating area is large and includes an outdoor area. All are kept spotlessly clean and there are also 2 tv screens in the eating area. Breakfast is included and runs from 6.30 - 10.00 am. The range and choice for breakfast was excellent - fresh fruit, a wide variety of cereals, huge choice of pastries, muffins etc, pancakes, english muffins, bread, bagels, fresh juice, and also 'breakfast muffins' which can be heated in the microwave (they tasted great too!). The breakfast was kept fully stocked throughout the serving time and there was always plenty of seating. Tea, coffee and hot chocolate is provided FREE throughout the day too. There is a computer area, with 2 computers and free internet, as well as free wireless internet in the rooms. There's also a small shop and a games room which, although we didn't use it, looked well equipped. Also a small gym and also a laundry - $1 for wash and $1 for drying - excellent value! Pool area was well stocked with beds/chairs and also had a jacuzzi spa. ALL areas of the hotel were spotless throughout our stay and every member of staff was polite and helpful. Rooms were great - comfy beds, TV, free wireless, very clean and towels and toiletries changed every day without fail. Lots of car parking space outside too. The hotel is very secure and the area it's in - Canada Ave - is very safe. Lots of great restaurants nearby - would particularly recommend Chillis, roughly a 3 min walk away. All in all, a superb hotel - enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Flawless!!”
Reviews.Author: Trixibelle9
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel, 2nd year running we have stayed here, rooms spotless, breakfast great, pool clean and warm! We got stranded here due to the volcano and the staff could not do enough to try to help us, particularly Laura! If you are going to Orlando this is the place to stay, just off International Drive, central to everything, I highly recommend Fairfield Inns and Suites!

Reviews.Title: “bare bones but fine for doing the parks”
Reviews.Author: lotsafunfamily
Reviews.Content: This was super basic but just fine for our trips to Universal and Epcot. Our family of four was there only to sleep, and we ate breakfast in the morning -- juice, fruit, pastries, oatmeal included in price and then off we went for the whole day! No time to even use the pool, but it looked fine. Staff was all helpful and courteous. Only complaint is that there was barely a surface in the bathroom to accommodate your toiletry kit, towels, change of clothes. You have to be a very close family to endure NO privacy in this small room, but it was clean and quiet. Glad it was only two nights tho.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidayhunniee
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for two weeks in October 2009 with my parents and two younger brothers to celebrate my 18th birthday and absolutely loved it! the hotel is very clean and modern, the staff were really friendly and always wished you a good day as you left and were very informative. the pool is a great size and catches the sun really well, usually very quiet in the evening when people are out for dinner or watching fireworks etc. although the hotel is just a five minute walk from international drive, the road its actually situated on (canada avenue) is very safe and quiet. lots of mini supermarkets and tonsssss of restruants nearby. i would highly recommend chillis which is a three minute walk around the corner and do amazing ribs and also red lobster which is a bit further up international drive and does amazing seafood, also friendlys were you can get a main meal, drink and customised ice cream sundae for 10 dollars. the rooms were large,all five of us stayed in one room with 2 double beds and a roll out bed and were concerned about how much space we would have but this wasnt an issue at all, the bathroom was again very spacious. maids were very friendly and did a very good job. the free continental breakfast was also great with a lot of choice and it was constanly stocked so they never ran out of anything. I loved my two weeks in florida and am looking forward to returning as soon as possible, this hotel although descibed as basic had everything we were looking for as a place to rest in between visiting both the disney and universal parks which were 20 minutes max drives. this hotel is definitly a contender for when we return and i would recommend it to anyone, especially familaies with teenagers

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: franxc
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, staff is friendly, good amenities. I liked the size which is relatively small, easy to get in and out of, easy to park. I paid $106 AAA price which was a very good value for this time of year, since I had not pre booked. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, even better vaaction.”
Reviews.Author: ercdill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights from March 31st to April 4th, very little complaints. The hotel is conveniently located right off of International Drive, where you'll find many stores such as Walgreens, Ihop, Denny's, gift shops, several restaurants, and a whole lot more. You don't even have to drive there, it's literally a 5-10 minute walk if you need to get something quickly before you head out. The actual hotel was great. Free breakfast, free internet, heated pool, extremely relaxing hot tub, all made it a great place to stay. We stayed in a King Suite so there was plenty of room for just the two of us. There is also complementary coffee and tea in the lobby if you ever want some. The staff was very helpful and assisted us with anything we needed. The cleaning service was great as well. There was one day where we left our room really late after denying the initial cleaning run with the privacy notice on the front door, surprisingly we still came back to a clean room. The hotel also has a market where you can buy snacks and drinks and a free computer room to browse the internet if you don't happen to have a laptop. My only real problems with the hotel while we stayed were a early fire scare we had where the building had to be evacuated. Turns out it was nothing so everyone went back up to their rooms. There were also a few summer camps staying at the hotel so the free morning breakfast was very crowded. We decided to visit Universal Studios during our trip, but we weren't driving so we had to rely on cabs everyday. If you're not driving you definitely want to use the Yellow Cab Service. The ride to Universal from the hotel is about $7-$8. All other cab services were trying to charge us $12-$15. There was one in particular called CBC, where we called ahead of time and the dispatcher told us 5 minutes..we ended up waiting 45! Just stick with Yellow Cab service. :) Even with the fire scare and crowded breakfast service, everything was handled extremely professionally and efficiently. If you're looking for a great, clean, and CHEAP place to stay while your in Orlando, you'll definitely want to give Fairfield a call.

Reviews.Title: “Just come back from 10 days in Orlando...”
Reviews.Author: Francesca1980
Reviews.Content: Just come back from 10 days in Orlando staying at the Fairfield on International Drive. Great hotel, great location, very helpful staff. The hotel supplies a free daily return shuttle to Universal and can also arrange a shuttle transfer to Disney at a cost of about $36 return if you don't have a car and don't fancy a long bus journey. Breakfast is nothing fancy but has a good selection of cereals and toast snd fruit. It's also very handy to have tea and coffee and hot chocolate available all day and night. Location is ideal for I Drive if you are a mad Brit and like to walk like us! We ate in loads of restaurants, from the local TGI Fridays (good steaks) to the Chinese buffet (amazing snow crab legs if you like that kind of thing) and the Olive Garden which is fantastic and excellent value for money if you want a really special lunch or dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel. It's location just off...”
Reviews.Author: neilandmax
Reviews.Content: Loved the Hotel. It's location just off international drive made it perfect for Universal and was within walking distance of Wet n Wild. The pool and hot tub were always kept clean with a plentyfull supply of fresh towels. The morning breakfast was well planned and worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room, great value, funky smell.”
Reviews.Author: SlinkyMagee
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 9 nights in November. The only con to this hotel that was all the drawers smelled like they had been cleaned with a dirty sponge (they had that nasty moldy smell) and every time housekeeping cleaned, the room stunk of ammonia and we had to leave the window open. We actually switched rooms right when we got there because the first room's dresser drawers smelled moldy. The second room had the same problem, though, so we gave up and dealt with it. Luckily, our room had two queen beds so we slept in one and laid out our clothes on the other. Housekeeping must have thought we were nuts. We complained to the front desk about the odor, so hopefully they'll have changed their cleaning products. Besides the odor, the room was spotless and everything else was great. Everyone I spoke to at the front desk was extremely helpful and really nice. Our last day there, check-out was at 11am, but our plane didn't leave until 6pm. The front desk offered to hold our luggage free of charge so we could enjoy a little more time at the parks before we had to leave. Breakfast was good, a little bit better than standard continental. Plenty of healthy options like fruit along with a nice selection of cereals, oatmeal, danishes, toast, and muffins. There was a small convenience store located in the hotel, which came in very handy for drinks and whatnot. The pool was amazing. It was perfectly heated and spotless. The bed was very comfortable, the TV worked fine, the shower was nice and big with plenty of hot water and a very nice shower-head. The view from our room on the 5th floor was very nice. We overlooked a pond and the pool, and in the distance we could see the roller coasters and spotlights from Universal. There was tea, coffee, and hot chocolate constantly available, with plenty of coupons for nearby restaurant and attractions. CiCi's Pizza was definitely the cheapest place to eat. For two people, it was about $12 for all you can eat pizza, pasta, salad, and drinks. Sweet Tomatoes was nearly as cheap (but much better for you) and just a few blocks away, clocking in at about $14 for two people. When we just wanted to stay in after a long day at the parks, the girl at the front desk was able to recommend several restaurants that delivered to our room. As far as location goes, this hotel was perfect! We didn't rent a car, and I don't think we needed to at all. There are tons of restaurants and attractions within walking distance. It was about a 20 minute walk to Universal, and about a three minute walk across a vacant lot to International Drive. From there, we were able to buy I-Ride passes and take the trolley to Seaworld, Wet and Wild, the shopping outlets, Wonderworks, and all the mini-golf places in the area. The hotel provided a shuttle to Universal that we used a few times, but it was nice to know if we stayed later at a club, the cab ride back was only $6. Cab ride prices (call your own cab, the hotel one costs more)- to Universal: $6 to Orlando Airport (MCO): $35-40 to Disney: $35-40

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: charlienmolly
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from this hotel,march 2010. On arrival our room was too small for our party,between virgin and hotel staff this was rectified within 1 day, we got a connecting room with 2 bathrooms , rooms 412-414, it was huge and very accomodating for the 5 of us,2 adults,1 teenager and 2 kids. Staff on every level were exceptional, from the maids to the reception to the dining staff, nothing was ever a problem.Its extremely central for all the parks and restaurants. The pool is always warm and the hot tub is fabulous, very hot and relaxing....!! For the 1st time in all our years of holidaying the children who normally are ready for home did not want to leave.The staff are a credit to Marriott and we would recommend this hotel to everyone, even the free breakfast was excellent as was the 24hr free coffee, tea and chocolate.Chris on reception was especially helpful, many thanks to you all for an amazing holiday, hope to see you all again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation - great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: AlsorusUK
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel enough!! We stayed in February 2010 for 16 nights and it certainly lived up to all the reviews we'd read on Tripadvisor before we left home. The hotel is in a fantastic location - very close to the I4 so getting to the Disney Parks is a breeze, and it's even closer to Universal (around 15 minutes max). Within a couple of minutes you're right on International Drive with a multitude of places to eat, but even so, it's in such a quiet location. The staff on the desk were very friendly and accommodating. They were extremely helpful and nothing seemed to be too much trouble! You can hire out a safety deposit box from the front desk for the duration of your stay free of charge, which is a bonus. Our room (208) a suite, overlooked the car park and we had no outside noise whatsoever. The room was perfect - a good size with two TVs which kept the kids happy! The sofa bed did have the kids rolling together by morning, but they were so shattered they didn't mind! The room was cleaned to perfection every day, with towels replaced if needed. We asked for an extra blanket for the sofabed and within minutes someone was at the door with one for us. The facilities were great. We didn't check out the pool as the weather was a tad cold, so can't comment on that. There is a laundry with two washing machines $1 a go (4 quarters) - bargain! There are also four dryers which again cost $1. You can buy washing powder in the shop for $1 too. The shop is small but has all the essentials you need. There are complementary copies of USA Today and the Wall Street Journal available every morning in the lobby. There is a gym but we didn't try that out - walking round parks all day was all the exercise we needed. There are also two computers available - free of charge - there is a courtesy limit of 15 minutes use at a time, but you can extend this if no-one else is waiting. Breakfast was a real grab-and-go affair but perfect when you need to get up early and get off to the parks. There was fruit juice - usually orange and apple but sometimes cranberry plus fresh water and milk; a good selection of cereals including oatmeal; several bakery items for toasting such as bread, bagels, muffins and pancakes; breakfast sandwich type things which you heat in the microwave; danish pastries and muffins; fresh fruit. Along with that there is tea and coffee, hot chocolate and a selection of fruit/herbal teas which is available 24/7. There is no problem taking food up to your rooms and we even had a pizza delivered to our room by a local pizzeria recommended by the front desk. When you need a hotel with all the basics, then you honestly cannot find one better. We really cannot fault this hotel at all and will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “my familly vacation”
Reviews.Author: hott92778
Reviews.Content: loved it. Very connected to all disney attractions easy to get to all parks(universal, mgm, disney world), and for food everything within the hotel and the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for our buck!”
Reviews.Author: SouthFloridaPam
Reviews.Content: Four of us were traveling (a couple with a 15-year old and an 8-year old). Since we knew we would not spend much time in the hotel (going to theme parks), all we really needed was somewhere that was clean and comfortable. I would stay here again, no question, even if we were going to be spending more time at the hotel. The location was great, right of International Drive, surrounded by restaurants and entertainment. The rooms and all common areas were immaculate. The king suite was spacious, the bed was very comfortable, and the sofa bed was okay for the kids (the 15-year old found the sofa bed to be uncomfortable. . . would bring air mattress next time). The shower had great water pressure (important to me). The free continental breakfast had many options (breakfast sandwiches, pancakes, bagels, various pastries, cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit, etc.) and was very fresh and tasty. The staff we dealt with (reception and breakfast area) were very helpful. This hotel provided all we needed for a very reasonable rate (we paid $85/night AAA rate), plus there were no hidden costs....free breakfast, free internet, free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable value - would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: sandiek123
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from the UK for the 3 nights we were staying in Orlando. I had warned the family that it was likely to be a bit rough because it was so cheap, although TripAdvisor reviews were good. When we arrived we were very pleasantly surprised. The staff at Reception were very friendly and helpful and our Suite was large and comfortable. Sure, it wasn't plush and the view from the window was of a car park, but everything was spotless and well-maintained. There was free wireless throughout the hotel and 2 computers for guests' use, free of charge in the business centre. And breakfast was included! In many US hotels you will pay the cost of a room in this hotel on breakfast alone! My daughter loved helping herself from the buffet which was very well-stocked. Despite other reviewers' advice, personally I'd steer well clear of the Jimmy Dean sandwich! But cereal, breads, pastries, pancakes, yoghurts etc are all plentiful. They don't even mind if you take some bits away to eat later. There is no bar, which is a shame, but we stocked up on beer and wine at the 7/11 and they opened the bottle for us at Reception. The pool is good and clean and the hot tub is great for soaking away the aches and pains of pounding the parks. I was so impressed with what this hotel had to offer for the price that we booked to return for a couple of nights at the end of our trip. It would be extremely hard to find anywhere that matches it for value. The location is good too - easy access to everything. And the Fish Bones restaurant on the corner of Canada Avenue is pricey but excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: MN_Larry_M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real value and very close to Seaworld & Universal. The rooms were just as many others described. Clean, comfortable and in pretty good shape. WIFI internet access was fast and strong as well. We stayed here three days and would definitely book this hotel again. Continental breakfast always had alot of choices. Very friendly and accomodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding simplicity”
Reviews.Author: puccablu
Reviews.Content: Check in was fast and easy. Our suite room had a lovely view, and the room was very clean. No bad odors at all. And I am very sensitive to bad odors. It's true that the room looks outdated, but I wanted comfort and cleanliness and this place provided both. Plus everything in the room is functional and works well. Suites have a king bed and pull out couch. 2 TV's and stereo. Bathroom was very clean and everything worked. The pictures you see from other guests are a true reflection of the rooms. Again, very clean no major frills, but a lot of emphasis on clean, comfy, spacious rooms. Staff is very friendly and ready to serve and please you. Just to prove that, we arrived at the breakfast area ( free, by the way ) and the place was busy. My son could only hold a few items. Maria, who works in the breakfast area, brought him milk and some extra napkins. Service with a smile! You can tell genuine interest and care. Very impressive. I've been in some hotels that are "fancier" and no one has ever helped us in such a way. Kudos to Maria and the rest of the staff! The hotel is conveniently located near International Dr. so it's close to many great restaurants/ shops. We live in Fl. so we had our own car and traveling was easy. The front desk recommended a popular sport's bar and it was excellent. My family and I will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: Shirlshubby
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at this hotel as part of a cruise and stay holiday. Our suite was spotlessly clean on arrival and was kept that way throughout our stay. The bonus of a free breakfast was one of the reasons for our booking this hotel - eating out can become expensive. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Will have no hesitation staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jeevesliverpool
Reviews.Content: Rooms at the hotel are bright and spotless. We had a double room on the 5th floor for 2 adults and 2 children and it had more than enough space, and a bath/shower with separate wash basin. The room was cleaned daily to a high standard. Also free internet available. Hotel staff are friendly without being too pushy. Breakfast is an added bonus with plenty of fruit,cereal and other choices. The location of the hotel is ideal if you are not driving. International drive is a 2 minute walk to the I-ride which takes you direct to sea world(about 20 mins), and also takes you to the link bus stops for disney.(takes just over an hour to magic kingdom). There is a free shuttle from the hotel to Universal studios. The only minus point I can give the hotel is the taxi prices quoted for Disney, they quoted much higher than the local cabs around. Plenty of choice for eating out on Int Drive. Chillis and TGI Fridays both less than 5 minutes from hotel and good food. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, value for money hotel - would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: 2009leeds
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel based on the reviews on TripAdvisor. The hotel was perfect for what we wanted. The first room I was assigned unfortunately had a too strong a perfumed smell but I was changed immediately with no questions asked and by a very apolegtic front desk. The next room was perfect, clean and very roomy. I saw one review complaining about the free breakfast. Firstly it is free!! Generally hotels in this area are bed only, you have to pay huge amount for breakfast or go out trying to find a breakfast. The breakfast had plenty of choice, fruit juices, cereals, fruit, toast, bagels, pastries, tea and coffee, I mean what more do you want for a FREE breakfast?? This hotel doesn't have a bar but its only 5 mins walk to a TGI Fridays or Chilis on the main international drive. The big advantage of this hotel is that you can walk 5 mins to a bar and then walk back, both of you being able to drink, lovely! I cannot recommend this hotel enough as it was perfect for what we needed, When you go to Orlando you are at the parks all day, so when you come back to our hotel all you want is a clean, good sized room and friendly hotel staff - this is all at the Fairfield. A tip for dining, go further down international drive towards the convention centre and the Castle hotel. There is a small shopping plaza with shops and restaurants. We dined at the Oceanaire seafood restaurant at this plaza. Yes its expensive but sooo worth it, perfect for a romantic meal for two. I am not huge seafood fan but this food was divine - go to it for that one special night during your stay, you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pompomKent
Reviews.Content: stayed at the fairfield with our 2 grandaughters. breakfast very good well stocked at all times and clean staff very friendly and helpful good location even if you do not have a car have been visiting orlando since 1991 and this is one of the best hotels we have stayed we even got our room request.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service at a great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ms.Travels
Reviews.Content: I recently enjoyed a quick overnight stay while traveling through Orlando. Had a fairly late check in and enjoyed an upgrade to a nice little king bed suite with a comfortable living area. The bedroom was separated by a half wall sort of partition. Room had two large tvs, desk, coffee table,sofa and chair. Also coffee maker and microwave. The front desk were quite nice, offered to look up other hotels and locations for me while I was inquiring. They had a free couple of computers in their business center and a very good breakfast, mostly continental but with hot waffle and heat up breakfast sandwiches. It was quite nice and I would have liked to stay there again on my way back out but they had no availabitliy. NO hesitation sending folks there - i think I got a great rate ($80? at AAA rates, I think.) I wish I did so well when I came back through town :) have fun if you go

Reviews.Title: “Five stars, must return!”
Reviews.Author: tommypee1
Reviews.Content: It is no wonder that this hotel has so good reviews, it's just so great. Visited here for five days at January 2010 and wished that we would spent more time at Orlando. + great service + clean rooms + good location + basic breakfast + lot of parking space + cheap price from univacations.com - odd smell

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: rowlandx4
Reviews.Content: Just got back yesterday having spent two weeks at Fairfield Inn. I would stay here again, it was spotless, the free breakfast saved us loads and kept us full for a got part of the day. The staff were so helpful, and we felt very safe walking literally round the corner to International Drive. Sea World and Universal were five minutes drive away and The Premier Mall took under ten minutes to drive. Getting onto the I4 (which takes you to Disney etc) was very straight forward. I have looked at other hotels and really do think that the Fairfield offered good value, high standards of cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Great care!”
Reviews.Author: JulieS6
Reviews.Content: Clean and good customer care, great free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “what a welcome to Florida”
Reviews.Author: paulamoss
Reviews.Content: we used this hotel on the 1st leg of our twin centre stay in Florida,the 1st 8 days the hotel was used for sleeping,and every time we entered and left the hotel we were met with smiles and courtesy.On the final day we were due to pick up a car from Alamo that we had booked in the U.K...bad move as we wasn't informed about the driver needing a credit card just to veryfy who you are as if passport and driving licence wasnt enough.we were left high and dry this is where a receptionist called Laura and housekeeper supervisor called Jose came to the rescue,3 hrs (1 1/2) of which was there own time rang around trying to organise a car that we use for the last 6 days in Clearwater and then Avis allowed us to hire the car without a card.These people are absolutly brill and and WHEN we return we WILL be using this for the whole of the 14 days,have no doubt about booking this hotel,great location,great rooms,lovely staff.

Reviews.Title: “very clean hotel really friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: wigwamman
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights in jan room was spotless good continental breakfast(especially the jimmy dean sandwiches) nice pool and jacuzzi free internet ,games room with pool table and very friendly staff justone block of idrive near pirates dinner show .would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel - very good location , big rooms , friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ofer_cohen
Reviews.Content: near Universal Studio and Premium & Prime Outlets. try the "fish bones" restaurant (5 min from the hotel) - good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!! La-La-Love Front Desk Staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shaybustro
Reviews.Content: Can't say a thing wrong about Fairfield Inn.... Laura, Manuel, Chris, Stephanie.....heck ALL of the front desk staff are absolutely WONDERFUL! We went down to look for a house and we were directed to a very nice area to look by front desk staff and we found a wonderful new home!! If you need directions, phone number, an extra pillow...ANYTHING the staff will go above and beyond to make sure you get it. I LOVE FAIRFIELD INN AND RECOMMEND IT TO EVERYONE!!! =)

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at amazing hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: ash-smyth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 days after previously having an amazing stay in Sept 2008. On returning this hotel was as great as it was on our previos stay. Very clean hotel, really friendly and helpful staff and the breakfasts are great. Great location. Would def book again for this hotel, wouldn't hesitate to do so at all.

Reviews.Title: “2ND STAY AT THIS HOTEL, WE'VE ALREADY BOOKED A THIRD STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: gazza45
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from our 2nd stay at the Fairfield Inn & Suites. The hotel is first class. Very pleasant and attentive staff who cannot do enough for you. We were again made extremely welcome. We had two rooms; a suite and a standard room for our three teenage daughters. The inclusive breakfast buffet in the morning has a variety of cerials, pastries, bagels. The rooms were cleaned daily to a very high standard by Jasmin who had her work cut out in our daughters room!!! - looking forward to returning later this year. I think the staff make this hotel what it is - FIRST CLASS!!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: tiree
Reviews.Content: well we have been many times to orlando and stayed in several international drive properties and had a great time at all ..what surprised me was how quiet it was at the fairfeld..hard to believe you are just 10 mins stroll to the hustle and bustle of I drive itself..super staff ,super rooms,we stayed in one of the suites ...free internet ..super to keep up to date on facebook !! great free continental brekafast ..cheap laudrette..sister in law staying else where paid double to wash and dry ...all in all another great trip and yes i would certainly book again at the fairfield but then i would book any of the others we've stayed in too ..didnt use the pool so cant comment on that ..was a little too cool during our xmas stay...son used game room a couple of times to trounce dad at pool .hes 17 yrs and he seemed to have a great time at the hotel ..so try it ...and make up your own mind about this little piece of heaven on I drive ..

Reviews.Title: “Our 3rd visit - great location & still fantastic value!”
Reviews.Author: AliHammer
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at the Fairfield & we can't fault it. It's ideally situated as it is on a road that runs parallel to International Drive so you have all the facilities (shops & restaurants) on International Drive within walking distance but without the traffic - you can use Universal Boulevard to drive to the parks & attractions instead. The continental breakfast is superb - plenty to choose from (juice, pastries, fruit, yoghurt, toast, bagels, microwaveable hot breakfast muffins etc) so you can fill yourself up before a big day at the parks. And there is coffee/tea/hot chocolate to help yourself to all day every day in the dining area. The pool area is nice and there are fresh towels available at the poolside. The jacuzzi was VERY hot when we were there so be warned - you may not last too long in there on a hot day! We made use of the laundry facilities this time and were so glad we did - it only cost a few dollars to do all our washing & drying while we used the pool (washing powder etc is sold in the hotel shop) and we came back home with cases full of clean clothes. The staff were incredibly friendly and always spoke as we walked past the front desk. You could use the safety deposit boxes behind the front desk for no extra charge which was ideal for storing passports & money etc. I would recommend 'Chili's' restaurant just round the corner - it get's very busy so be prepared for a wait but it's worth it. There were two computers that you could use to access the internet (for free) and there was a small fitness room with 3 or 4 machines in it (step machine, bike, treadmill) but who goes to Florida to go in the gym? We stayed in one of the suites this time (it has a 'living room' area with an extra TV, a sofa, microwave & a fridge) but the standard rooms are perfectly adequate and I probably wouldn't bother upgrading next time. We've been to Florida several times & this is by far the best value hotel we've stayed at & will stop here again when we return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Holiday EVER”
Reviews.Author: mattandkel
Reviews.Content: The holiday was the best holiday we have ever had. We booked to stay in the fairfield inns in lake beuna vista but it was too far out of the way as we didnt have a car and we was transfered to the fairfield inns on international drive. When we arrived we was a little worried as it wasnt as "grand" looking as the previous one we stayed in, but we shouldnt of worried because it was the most fantastic of hotels!! we received a free breakfast every morning, the rooms were spanking clean and well looked after. The pool was always warm and the hot tub toasty!! The staff were extremely helpful (even gave us a box of chocolates as it was our honeymoon), The kids loved the games room (i do think they kept coning the staff into giving them free tokens lol) there was a laundry room that only cost a dollar a load. A shop to buy any essentials you had forgot or needed. and the location was absolutely fantasticly close to everything.....especially if you dont have a car!!) everyone made us feel so welcome, i am just looking to find a deal for next year as we are definately coming back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good room”
Reviews.Author: TexasTime99
Reviews.Content: Everything was as we wanted. Very close to Universal Orlando, right on the shuttle route. Breakfast was good, front desk was VERY helpful. Rooms were good sized, worked well for us, well furnished.

Reviews.Title: “great value for the price we paid!”
Reviews.Author: lorelaigilmore
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great for costing just $88.88 (all taxes and charges included) a night! The location is excellent, near Universal Studio and Premium & Prime Outlets. The room is a bit outdated (from the 70s?), but it's clean and comfortable. There are 2 TVs in our suite, not flat screens, but they work well enough. There's also a huge boom box in the living room which we didn't use. Our suite has a great view of the lake and swimming pool and Orlando beyond. We can see park rides from the room! Wish the lighting in the room is not so bright and white and clinical-like though. Internet is FREE! Breakfast is included. So far we are quite happy with our one-night stay. For the price we pay, this room is wonderful enough!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Nic&Bob
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel, it is well located to visit both Epcot & Universal. We had rented a car and easily visited both sites in 2 days. The hotel has a good breakfast included in the price of the room. We would definitely would go back to the Fairfield.

Reviews.Title: “We can see why it was Trip Advisor #1 last year.”
Reviews.Author: travisp11
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly. The bed was very comfy. I liked the fact that the hotel was able to arrange an excellent private car service for my wife and myself. The breakfast was excellent and a bottomless supply of Jimmy Dean b.fast sandwiches has always been a dream of mine and this hotel supplies that. The location is excellent but please make sure you have the street address with you if you have a drive or taxi arranged, there are several Fairfield Inn's in Orlando and if you are from a small town like we are you forget about those things. We didn't test the pool but there were tons of people out there while we were there. My only complaint was that we had returned early from Sea World as a storm came in and our room wasn't ready yet. In my opinion, those who spend the extra money on the suite should have the suite cleaned first. Okay, so that sounds elitist but I figured our room would be cleaned before 2 PM. I politely asked the front desk if they could get our room ready and they immediately got on it. Overall, I was pretty impressed and liked this room much better than our basic room that we had rented a few days before at Disney World.
