Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: benjones789
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 10 nights at the Fairfield on Canada Avenue and could not fault it one bit. From the point where they allowed us to check in 3 hours early it was a great choice of Hotel. We stayed in a standard room which was a fairly standard Orlando room, large and airy and faultlessly clean. The complimentary breakfast was great, featuring pastries, doughnuts, fresh fruit, toast and some breakfast sandwiches that could be microwaved, it's also worth noting that guests get a free newspaper as well. We used most of the facilites of the Hotel and all were great, the pool was lovely and warm, the shop small but carrying a good range of drinks and snacks and the free internet was a nice touch as well. At night it was very quiet due to it's location off I Drive and away from I4, but it is only a 10 minute walk to I Drive, go left out the Hotel and you come out at I Ride Trolley stop 15, go right and you come out at stop 12. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: frenchkiwi
Reviews.Content: Hi We booked this hotel in a two night package with a Seaworld visit. As usual, I chose this hotel due to its good rating on TA. We were NOT disappointed! Staff very friendly and helpful. Great location. Rooms large and comfortable. We noticed a musty smell in the hallways but NOT in our room. The pool is large and heated and the outdoor whirlpool is very hot and relaxing. There are some little extras which make the difference. There is a small store inside the hotel which is open all night. Also coffee in room, but also tea/coffee next to reception available all night. Towels are freely available next to the pool and don't need to be claimed or signed for at reception. Good fitness room near pool. This was a great hotel at a bargain rate. Would definitely go back there on next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Super breakfast, great staff”
Reviews.Author: TexasFoi
Reviews.Content: All the staff are super friendly. They have the best free breakfast I've ever seen. They also have 2 computers with a printer in the business center. I would definitely stay here again. There was a slight musty smell in my room, room 401. I think it is coming from the AC. I just turned the heater on and blasted it out.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant ... !!!”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshire121
Reviews.Content: we chose this hotel having read the good reviews on here and i have to say that we couldn't find fault at all ! The room was spot on, the staff we're brilliant (especially at unblocking the toilet), the breakfast was good, my teenage son thought the games room and internet room were fantastic and my wife thought sitting in the lobby with the other english guests having a swift drink was "awsome" !!! If you want a very well run and reasonably priced hotel in a quiet location near international drive then you need look no further

Reviews.Title: “Best Budget Hotel near I-Drive”
Reviews.Author: LincolnClan
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our two week holiday in Orlando (the second time we've been) this time we stayed at the Fairfield Inn. This is an excellent budget hotel with plenty to eat at breakfast (and if your quick bagels for lunch too!) we never found the breakfast area too busy and used it at various times. The hotel staff are the best and the front desk always greeted you with a smile and a welcome and couldn't be more helpful if needed. Louis from the breakfast area went out of his way to help my daughter which was really nice. We had a suite which served us well having a huge King size bed for us (very comfy) and a sofa bed for the kids which was just about big enough for them (aged 14 and 11). The location is great one block off International Drive so nice and quiet but using the short cut over a grassed area and a newly built small wooded bridge only took 5 minutes to get to I-Drive. There are plenty of good restaurants to eat in the area both by walking and using the I-Ride, we enjoyed Sweet Tomatoes at I-Ride stop 6 which was both cheap and had a huge salad bar hot pasta soups etc and made a great change from burgers! To sum up if you want a great holiday at a buget hotel The Fairfield is a must. Do not do the Quality or Holiday Inn which look very run down. One last point Manta at SeaWorld is a must the best coaster I've ever been on!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel shame about musty smell in room”
Reviews.Author: pineapple81
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying in this hotel back in september. Room was clean and presentable however we did have a problem with a musty smell not sure why bought air freshner from Walmart and opened window slightly which helped when we left it seemed much better. Family loved free internet access and pool was never buzy however in school hols I exspect this could be a problem. I'm - female with 2 children and felt quite secure walking back to hotel at night even though its in quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “Everything good, except the musty smell in room”
Reviews.Author: napes05
Reviews.Content: Clean with a good breakfast. The beds were even surprisingly comfortable. However, my room smelled very musty and made my clothing smell. Free wireless is a great amenity.

Reviews.Title: “Its a standard Fairfield type hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: drc225
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in Oct '09 over the weekend at the rate of $71 + tax basically just to kill time in-between two back to back conferences. I move to the expensive conference hotel on the Monday. Hotel is a standard Fairfield (btw: that is not a bad thing) so you know the quality will be reasonable. This hotel is a good example and a credit to the brand. No surprises - again good. Staff very friendly. Rooms were as expected and the free internet worked perfectly. Pool area is a little bleak but there are plenty of loungers. The gym is a bit disappointing. One bike, one x-trainer and one jogger all of which looked a bit past it. In the end I didn't use them. There is a games room for kids which is a bonus (if you are travelling with kids). Free breakfast the standard bagels, cereals, etc. The major bonus is that is it is possible to walk places. There are restaurants close by and lots of stuff in a 10-15 minute walk. From a driving perspective its very central as well. Location is excellent. It suited my purposes perfectly but I would be quite happy to bring my family there.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and very clean”
Reviews.Author: Vcruz
Reviews.Content: We all had a wonderful time, kids included. We were able to walk to seaworld and aquatica. Hotel was very clean and wonderful affordable breakfast at the restaurant in the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations â€“ best in area â€“ would recommend”
Reviews.Author: DLB-GOUROCK
Reviews.Content: We were more than impressed with this hotel. Had stayed once before at this end of I Drive and was disappointed. This holiday was booked by friends who travelled with us and I was a bit wary of what to expect. However I was very pleasantly surprised with the standard offered by the Fairfield Inn and Suites. Service from the front of house staff was excellent and very friendly, nothing was a trouble to them and they would spend time chatting with you making you feel very welcome. The housekeeping staff we had were particularly good and paid attention to detail. Bed linen was changed on request as were the bath towels. One maid in particular who we spoke with noticed my wife was having trouble with blisters on her heel from wearing new shoes. The next day upon returning to our room she had left out an assortment of plasters and a bottle of water for my wife, very thoughtful. It was the small touches of the fanned out the box of tissues left on our bed that made you know that you were being taken care of by professional staff. Access to the hotel was secure and you were comfortable about safety. The rooms themselves were clean and fresh and bright. The pool was small but never crowded, clean and warm water was inviting for the rest days. The hot tub was just that, 105F and you are recommended not to spend more that 15 minutes at a time in it an a clock was positioned conveniently for you to keep an eye on your time. Towels were provided free at the pool deck which enabled you to dry off before coming back into the lobby area. The dining area for breakfast was kept clean and coffee was available 24hrs. Breakfast ranged from toast, boiled eggs, pancakes / waffles syrup, yogurts and fresh fruit. A good selection but if having a longer stay might get a bit monotonous and a visit to a local Dennys etc will be a welcome change. Free parking and an ideal location made getting about by care easy. Bus service was available to and from the parks, however one family who we talked to ended up hiring a car locally as the journey took an hour because of stops at other hotels. Our journey by car took 10 min to Universal parking lot. If I were staying at the north end of I Drive I would not hesitate in going back to the Fairfiled. I think that the two star should be at least 3 or 3.5 My reason for not going to 4 is the lack of a bar / lounge or full restaurant. I can understand why there is not bar as it maintained a quite environment and there was no rowdiness, however a place to have a drink or two and chat with friends would have been nice as our normal day would be up early and quite busy and it would be normal for most nights to be back by 9pm to relax in our room and watch some local TV news of which there is plenty. Fairfield Inn and Suites, worth a look at as a great location for I Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: alih29
Reviews.Content: Great location, rooms and breakfast. Excellent for Universal and international drive. Just what we were looking for!

Reviews.Title: “Look No Futher - This Hotel Is The Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: sneero
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 2 week stay at the Fairfield Inn on I-Drive. We booked the hotel having read all the great reviews it received, so we had high expectations when we arrived - delightfully we were not dissapointed and it was even better than we imagined. The staff are so friendly and helpful and make you really feel at home throughout your stay. The rooms are excellent - 2 queen size beds which are really comfortable, a great shower, and of course a TV with a great selection of channels. We had taken our laptop along and were able to make use of the free Wi-fi!!!! Pool is excellent never overcrowded, breakfast was great, saves time meaning you can get to the parks early to beat the crowds. The hotel location is perfect just one street behind the hustle and bustle of I-Drive making it lovely and quiet in the evenings, but not too far to be able to walk to many restaurants/shops etc. We enjoyed having dinner at TGI fridays where we were able to get steak dinners for about $8 each, and the staff there were excellent!!! If you are getting a flex ticket, then the location is ideal, all the parks (except busch gardens on the flex plus) are within 15mins drive of the hotel and very easy to get to, there is also a wallmart near by which is amazing for souvenirs and snacks. If anyone is considering driving and thinking about hiring a Sat Nav, we actually found it worked out cheaper for us to purchase a map upgrade (Â£50) for our own unit instead of hiring one from the hire car company which cost a great deal more. We also took the Virgin platinum insurance on the car hire which gave us great peace of mind and made for a very quick hand over when we arrived. Ok so I will say no more except if you are thinking of booking this hotel - Do it, you wont be dissapointed. I will definately be back (once i have saved up)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - should be 5 star and not 2 star”
Reviews.Author: TracyB56
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, stayed for a 3 week vacatio with my husband and two children aged 8 and 14. Quiet location off I Drive but still close to the hustle and bustle of Orlando. The hotel provided a shuttle bus to Universal Studios and Busch Gardens. Nothing was ever too much trouble for the staff, during our stay my son Sam celebrated his 9th birthday. The hotel staff arranged a birthday cake for him on his special day. The hotels amenities ranged from a laundry and free internet access to a gym, pool and hot tub. Would definitely recommend to others and will return if we venture back to Orlando, Florida!!

Reviews.Title: “Service comfort and value all in one!”
Reviews.Author: chodwobbler
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 week stay at Fairfield inn and suites on Canada Avenue and it was definately the pick of the hotels available in the Virgin brochure in the I drive area, so much so, that we will try to return here when we organise our own package on our next visit. The reception staff are top notch (big up for Laura who organised our room for us, she is a real sweetie!) and a big bravo for Jose who replaced our mortally wounded air con unit! The air con units are a tad noisy, but you get used to it, especially as you really need them at night in Aug/Sept. The beds were really comfy, bedding was new and clean and changed as often as you wanted and the housekeeping maid was thorough an efficient. The pool isn't huge, but was never busy and it was always warm and in direct sunlight. (except at night of course) The free breakfast does get a bit tedious after 3 weeks, but hey, its free and we quite often went out early and stopped of at Golden Corral or Ihop by way of a change. As has been stated, the hotel is in a quiet location, close to I drive and with free transport to and from Universal, altough we did not utilise this as we had a hire car. All in all an excellent hotel, PLEASE remember that this is a 2 star hotel and my rating is given with regard to the service and standard received bearing this in mind, although I would rate it higher than 2 star after staying at the Royal Pacific Resort which is a 5 star. The room here may have been furnished to a higher standard, but was no bigger than our room at the Fairfield and the staff at RPR seemed like they were doing you a favour and that you were lucky to be there! Try the fairfield...and I reckon you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Ticked nearly all the right boxes”
Reviews.Author: Joegeez
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. We had a car and location wise the place is ideal. You're 10 minutes drive to Seaworld and less than 5 minutes from the I-4 (exit 74A) which gets you to Disneyworld in about 20 mins(exit 67 is best). The hotel is served by a free shuttle bus to universal which leaves at 08:20,9:20,10:20 each morning and returns at 4:10 and 7:20 each day. On thurs,fri,sat they do extra late buses for citywalk. My recommendations is to use the bus to get there and get a cab back(opposite where the bus drops you) from the rank. Cost us just $8 with tip to get back as the bus on the way back becomes a bit of a free for all (some people can't or don't queue). The pool was nearly empty for our 2 week stay and the deep end was just 5 feet so okay if you're not a good swimmer(like me). Also loads of free beds for sunbathing(if you get time !). Free breakfast is good with several cereals,fruit,danish,toast and jimmy dean muffins which i would not recommend unless you like soggy muffins. Free tea and coffee all day. Always tables available. The front desk changes up to $100 trav cheques a day and can supply a free box/safe for all your valuables on request which is held under the front desk. They are mega helpful and there wasn't a single time where i went to them for help be it directions or whatever that they didn't know the answer. There's a laundry on the ground floor if your towels etc get soaked with the rain showers..costs just 1 dollar for 30 minutes drying cycle.There's 2 pc's on the ground floor also with free internet access 24 hours a day.. Now the room..shower ,bed,cleanliness,TV,air con all excellent but the one thing that let it all down was the storage. For four of us. 2 adults and 2 teenagers for 2 weeks we had a open clothes rail about 3 feet long and 4 large drawers and one small bedside drawer. Because of this our room resembled a chinese laundry for the 2 weeks. I know it's 2 star but there was a desk and seat in the corner which could be taken out and replaced by a cupboard for clothes,this would be far more practical. So as we could have a drink we tried a few restaurants we could walk to in the area and the best by far was chilli's,Cici's pizza was good for the money..buffet pizza for 4 with drinks $28 !!! Ponderosa is good for the money too but is like eating in a canteen with no atmosphere. TGI's was okay,and the chinese buffet was okay too. International Drive is a bit tacky with loads of tourist shops which gave it a slight downmarket feel. A couple of nights we got some cans and bottles of wine and crisps and sat outside near the pool area and had a drink. I though they might stop us but nothing was said. Did that twice after epcot and magic kingdom where we got back just before midnight...i think that's it !! ooh..don't forget to tip the maid EVERY day. We left $3 or $4 a day..E-mail me if there's anything else you wanna know !!!...Joe

Reviews.Title: “IT WAS A SUPERB STAY”
Reviews.Author: Natrull
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best stays at a hotel that we have encountered. The staff was friendly. courteous and helpful, they gave that little extra. This is a well managed and maintained facility. It is in a good location a couple of minute walk to all the action on International Drive but far enough away to have some peace and quiet. there was a wide variety on the continental breakfast and was very well stocked. There was ample enough seating and it to was well maintained. The pool and Jacuzzi area was a nice size with plenty of lounge chairs and again well kept. There is really nothing negative to say about this place. We had a wonderful week in Orlando and the great staff at this fine hotel only enhanced it.

Reviews.Title: “brand new and gorgeous pool”
Reviews.Author: cheermom15
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an inexpensive, clean hotel near Discovery Cove and booked this hotel sight and unseen. Last year we stayed at the Holiday Inn on Int'l Drive and hated it. We didn't have high expectations. This hotel was awesome. It was brand new, immaculate, well decorated and had a very friendly staff. It had a gorgeous pool that connected to their partner hotel and had a great snack bar. The rooms and bathroom were immaculate and very comfortable. The location is great, very close to Sea World, Discovery Cove and not too far from the Disney parks. We look foward to staying there on our future Orlando vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Sharpay10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of July while visiting some attractions (Seaworld and The Holyland Experience) and do some shopping outside WDW. The hotel is very clean and located on a quiet street avoiding the busy I-Drive area. If you have a car, getting to I-Drive will be a very short drive. If you are walking as we were, it's about a 5-10 minute walk to I-Drive. The area has many hotels and restaurants and feels very safe to walk in. The walk was much longer than I anticipated and was rather annoying towards the end of our stay. Check in at this hotel was very fast and simple. We had a King Suite for our stay for $109US/night. The room was a very nice size. Bed and sofa/living area were separated by a partial wall/closet. Also had 2 tvs, a fridge and microwave all of which were in good working order. Bathroom was clean and adequate. The free breakfast served each morning was delicious and always well stocked. Arrive early for best seating. We did not use the pool but it also seemed clean and not overly busy. We used the guest laundry as well and the washers and dryers worked very well. There are only 2 washers and 4 dryers. The only concern I have with this hotel is that they encourage you at check in to notify the front desk if you need a taxi which they will arrange for you. We did this the first day we arrived and ended up paying $40US for a return trip to Walmart on Turkey Lake Rd (about 10 mins away). The taxi service they use obviously has some sort of contract with the hotel. For the remainder of our stay we called Mears Yellow Cab and got much better service and rates. Overall, for the rate, this hotel was good value and provided a pleasant stay in the I-Drive area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: SiM0Nkey
Reviews.Content: During our visit the staff were very helpful and friendly. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, perfect for what we wanted. We found it very easy to travel back and forth from the universal parks using the daily universal shuttles. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in a clean, friendly hotel located only a couple of minutes from international drive. Some parts of international drive seemed to be quite noisy at night, but the Fairfield location is nice and quiet. Great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “basic, but good value for money, good sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: Loving_Holidays
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is one block back from International Drive, it is still a great location and quiet too. The rooms are a good size, with two TV's one in the lounge area and one in the bedroom area. Breakfast is included in the rate and gives a great variety of food from egg/bacon muffins, to pancakes to porridge etc so a great way to start your day, and helps keep costs down, because lets face it you can sped alot of money whilst in Orlando !!. The hotel was centrally located, you can turn left out of Canada Avenue onto Sand Lake and within 10 minutes you are at The Florida Mall. The staff are helpful and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: evol2004
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with my wife and two children. It is well located near Universal Studios, WAtwrparks and International Drive. The rooms are spacious, well maintained and clean. You can find great 4 day and 7 day packages at Universal's web page. The only thing we didn't like was the included breakfast which is very simple (pastries, cereal, waffles and microwable sandwiches). Overall it's a very good option.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CHOPS11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Fairfield Inn for 1 week. The room was clean and quiet. The staff were friendly and more than helpfull. Breakfast was included and was basic but you could eat as much as you wanted. Close by to plenty of restaurants and attractions and they supply free transportation to the theme parks. Is also handy to the I ride bus which takes you up and down International Drive every 30 minutes. The pool is great for relaxing after a busy morning at the parks and they supply towels. Would come back again and recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great value”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveller50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one week, 2nd week of holiday after 1st week in Disney hotel. Superb rooms - one bed in bedroom area, 2nd double is fold down settee. Daughter loved it as second tv in this area so she could watch disney whilst we watched the olympics! Is on road parallel to I-Drive, so quiet but quick to walk to main road. Choosing a hotel with free breakfast is a good idea if you are staying on i-drive, so no need to think about where to go for breakfast and no extra cost - saves a bit of money. Pool was nice too. Very close to wet'n'wild - walkable. I-drive buses mean you can get around but we often found them full or not often enough. Often ended up walking a long way. We liked the southern end of i-drive around the pointe shopping centre - next time we'll try to find somewhere near there to stay. But overall a great stay. Loads of restaurants near here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Orlando Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WanderersCheshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights towards the end of June at the beginning of our US trip. The hotel was in a quiet location and was reasonably close to the airport and the parks. We had a king room which was a good size and clean. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice and although the dining area is relatively small, we always found an empty table. The front desk staff were excellent; friendly and always ready to offer help. The pool area was nice and quiet, with pool towels provided. Internet access was a bonus. Fish Bones, which is a restaurant within easy walking, was recommended and was very good. We didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel as we wanted to pack in as much as possible in our two days in Orlando, but it did provide a perfect base and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice central location”
Reviews.Author: saintsfanengland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in February for 14 nights - we were slightly disappointed with our room, when we booked we chose the suite as having two teenage daughters thought it would be nice to have separate rooms (which is what we thought) NO it was one open plan room with one king-size bed and a pull out sofa bed which was not very nice, and certainly not big enough for two teenagers!!! On the whole we were happy enough as the location of the hotel was perfect for us, very close to our favourite restaurants out there i.e chilli's, TGI's and only a short stroll to the English bar George & Dragon. 10 mins drive to Universal & about 20 mins to Disney. The breakfast which was included was very nice. The hotel staff were very friendly, pool was ok but a bit too cold for my liking. Pool towels were provided..

Reviews.Title: “good 2 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: wulber90
Reviews.Content: i would just like to agree with the last reviewer.everything was nice and clean and the continental breakfast was good.the .small pool was clean with towels provided and it was never too busy.free internet aswell.the laundry was good value as we paid double the price in a hotel in daytona.you could use the microwave in the restaurant area if you didn't have one in your room and there was always tea,coffee and hot chocolate in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good functional hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sam2957
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights in June 2009. The location is excellent, just 2 min drive from Wet and Wild, 10 mins to Universal, 20 mins to Disney/Seaworld and just off International Drive. The hotel itself is fairly functional. Its clean, rooms are very large, we had a suite so it had a small living area and large bathroom. Its not a hotel with personality as its the same as a hundred other motel/hotel inn type places on international drive, but if you want a nice clean hotel, good rooms and great location - this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but remember it's a two-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel159549
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the prior reviews. This is a nice, clean Marriott hotel. Keep in mind that it is rated a two-star hotel. However, it's a clean two-star hotel with ample (free) parking, courteous front-desk staff, and a decent continental breakfast that can be very busy with all of the people. The hotel is in a convenient location, with several restaurants less than 2 minutes by car (and some that are close enough to walk). We stayed because the price was right and TripAdvisor users had said good things. This hotel (upon this writing of a review) is 4 out of 392 hotels in Orlando. It's because it's a clean, quiet, conveniently located hotel (it's a quick drive to Disney and Universal Studios). It's not because it's 5 star service or because the property is perfect. I would say the downsides were the two (small) elevators and the slightly dated rooms (compared to the nice Marriott chains). The upsides were the good location, attached arcade (with Ms Pacman), clean rooms, ample (free) parking, and excellent price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! We keep going back again and again!!”
Reviews.Author: Mark_O_Sue_R
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel that we stay in whenever we visit Orlando. The staff make the place and are always friendly and helpful. Nothing is ever any trouble and requests for extra towels, fridge, replacement TV remote were all met within minutes. All areas of the hotel both inside and out are kept clean and tidy. The rooms are spacious and have good powerful showers with plenty of hot water. The free breakfast each morning is self service and you can help yourself to as much as you like! The heated pool and jacuzzi are a nice way to end the day after a day riding Roller-coasters. We chose not to hire a car but getting around is no trouble. There is free transport to the Universal Parks on a Shuttle Bus that depart the hotel a number of times during the morning. To get to Seaworld we used the number 8 Lynx bus from I-Drive just five minutes walk away. The cheapest way we found was to buy a week pass from the Official Visitor Centre down the road. It cost us about $16 for a week or you could pay $2 dollar per trip. We used the Lynx number 42 to get from I-Drive to the Airport, the huge Florida Mall and the Premium Outlets at both ends of I-Drive. I have stayed at a few different Hotels in the I-Drive area but this is by far the best value for money. I would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “a great stay at a brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: jem8472
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks while in Orlando on our honeymoon. It is in a great location just off I-drive. You can walk from the hotel to I-drive via a shortcut in 5 mins. The hotel is very well kept, all the outside and inside of the hotel is very clean & tidy The room was nice, we had one on the 5th floor. It was a standard room which had two double beds, a TV, desk with chair, 4 big draws, bathroom with a lovely powerful shower. There is also hanging space in the room with about 6 hangers, but room for plenty more. The room is a good size with plenty of space for us. The air con was lovely as we had some very hot weather. At night we had the air con off as it did make some noise but the room did not get hot during the night. We also got free wifi in the room which was a great help as we had a small laptop with us. The free breakfast was very nice. Fruit juice, cereal, danish pasterys, toast, yoghurts. When we usually went to breakfast it was not that busy but if we went at about 9am it was a lot busier but never had a problem finding somewhere to sit. Everything is restocked quickly so hardly anything runs out. The hotel also has a laundry room which we used a couple of times. The hotel shop (open 24hrs) sells washing powder and the washers and dryers take 4 quarters for a load. There is also a pool, exercise room and a couple of computers to use. Make sure you have a look at the business center as they have lots of coupons for lots of different attractions and restaurants around Orlando. The pool is nice and the jacuzzi was very enjoyable. The staff were great, they were all very friendly and always asked about what parks we had been to or restaurants we had visited. They really helped make our stay enjoyable. With this hotel you also get a free shuttle service to universal city walk everyday. We had a really great stay here and I would love to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Clean & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: campbells094
Reviews.Content: I moved here after having a bad experience at another hotel and was very impressed. The rooms were very clean and the staff gave an exellent service. I do not have one complaint and would recommend anyone to stay here

Reviews.Title: “An amazing bargain”
Reviews.Author: stumack71
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night having flown into Orlando before embarking on a tour of southern states and I have to say this amazing bargain was a real opener. The staffally friendly and helpful - special mention to the hispanic male concierge - and the rooms, which cost just Â£29 for a double room, were huge, clean and comfy. Compared to some of the more expensive venues I went on to stay, this hotel showed them up and set the mark they could only aspire to in terms of the standards it set for the knock down price. The price includes parking a breakfast and whilst the Jimmy Dean sandwiches were not to my taste, there were a whole range of other things to chose from. Could not have expected any more for such a low price - in fact my expectations were way way exceeded. A great hotel at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and great location.”
Reviews.Author: AirForceCouple
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a King suite here for 6 nights having read the good reviews. We were pleased to find that the good reviews were well deserved. The room was a little old fashioned (fat tube TV etc) but was exceptionally clean and was kept that way daily. The bed was very comfortable (firmer than the average bed). The location was great - an easy drive to Disney and the airport. Just off Intenational -Drive but down a quiet side road. Plenty of parking. Breakfast area was very busy but we brought food up to our room to eat. Staff were very good especially the female receptionist who was always friendly and helpful. The hotel was very good value - I would stay there again and would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fab place to stay - Fair price”
Reviews.Author: Nigel67
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay very convienient & good value, staff very pleasant & willing to help, continental breakfast with good selection. Good clean bright rooms & heated swiminning pool- would highly reccomend

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: laddie1963
Reviews.Content: 10 of us stayed here for two weeks over easter. We had a suite for 2 adults and 2 children which had one double bed and one sofa bed. Suite had two TV's, fridge and microwave. Next time we go though would probably ask for a room which has 2 double beds but ask for a fridge to be put in there which were available. Rooms were kept very clean daily, bed linen changed every 3 days. Hotel was very busy but on our rest days from the parks we were virtually the only people by the pool. Breakfast was ok, cakes, fruit, cereal, yoghurt, sausage biscuits. Location was very convenient for I-drive and all its attractions. TGI Fridays and Chili's within 5 minute walk, both very good, especially Chili's with the buy one get one free drink offers all day!! We chose this location as we did not hire a car, used I-trolley for shopping and taxi's for the parks. The taxi company the hotel uses are more expensive than the yellow cabs. Last but not least the staff were excellent, always friendly with a smile and a chat. Very informative. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: dreamyIreland
Reviews.Content: Absolutely lovely place to stay on our first trip to 'Mickey Mouse Land'. Close to everything. Staff so helpfull. Just a short walk from the noisey International Drive and TGI's at end of road. Even have internet and printer facility for hotel guests to check up on your emails, for those of us that don't have 'laptops'. Pool was lovely and plenty of towels. Lots of room to park your car Airconditioning worked perfectly. Beds so comfortable..... Breakfast can get a bit hectic about 9:30am, but doesn't everywhere? Already planning our next trip back, so sad to be home

Reviews.Title: “Still very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: LakeDistrictEngland
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights here in early April with our eleven year son. It is a year since we last visited from the UK and the hotel is just as good as it was then. Our room was a suite with a King and sofabed (which we find is larger than the room with two double beds and has two TVs and a good-sized fridge). The room was cleaned every day and the pool warm. I also noted the base of the pool was very smooth which is ideal for kids and prevents scrapes and graizes. Breakfasts were very acceptable, but BUSY!...of course it was Spring Break in the States and Easter Hols for the Brits so no surprises there. We ate outside on the patio a couple of times but we took it in our stride. The desk staff were always friendly and we made use of the free safety deposit-box. One night we walked half-a-block to Chilli's Restaurant which we enjoyed and would recommend for lively American/Tex-Mex food. There's a small fairground with rides behind and our son really enjoyed the petrol Go-Karts for hire. Yes there are fancier hotels which cost more, but for the price ($109 plus tax) we think this is hard to beat. If we visit Orlando again in the next couple of years we would certainly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: si1972
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. Room was good, nice comfy bed. Breakfast was included and hot drinks available 24/7. Would stay again if were in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brewer74
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay two nights instead of one. The staff person in reservations was very helpful, and we upgraded to a suite to be able to arrive a day earlier than planned. The room was great. It was very clean. Also, we were able to get a roll away bed. We had a king bed that slept great, and a pull out sofa bed. Also, there was a TV in the King bed area, and a partition separating the bedroom area from the living room area. There was another TV in the living room area. It was great to have two TVs, since we had teenagers. They were able to have their own TV. Also, it was a close drive to Sea World, and many restaurants were nearby. The hotel was quite. We slept great, and enjoyed the pool and hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “very helpful staff and a good all round stay.”
Reviews.Author: call4
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a two week holiday, which we thoroughly enjoyed. The hotel staff cant do enough for you. The hotel is very clean and tidy and includes a free breakfast. We asked for a fridge for our room and we had one put there.When we were going out the staff were very happy to give us info on getting around and how to do it cheaply. we would definetley recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out for Sofabed Issues--Potential Mold-Rust”
Reviews.Author: wowsam
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a five day visit to Orlando and overall the hotel experience was fine, or so I thought. It is certainly a two star hotel similar to hamton inn's, comfort inns, etc. I can't comment on the pool or exercise studio since I did not get to use. The staff was very friendly and professional....even housekeeping staff seemed to have a smiles on their faces....nice. Breakfast was fine.....nothing hot except if you make your own oatmeal with packets or microwave a prepared packaged sausage/egg or sausage/ham biscuit. The latter item ran out every day prior to 9:30 am. There were plenty of pastries and muffins, typically orange juice and cranberry or apple juice, hard boiled eggs and cereal. There were a lot of folks there and I give Fairfield the credit for handling the large volume of folks. One of our five days, our room was not made up but that was because we got such a late start....probably after noon. There is internet in our room....we had a king suite....with two tv's and a sofabed....our kids are 3, 5 and 11 and each night one kid slept with Mom and Dad and the other two in the sofabed. We can only manage in this way for probably a couple more years. Now here is the kicker and the bit of bad news. On our final breakfast just before checking out, my wife thinks out loud about whether or not she should complain about the "black mold". I asked her what she meant and she felt the room smelled damp and musty....I did not notice. I went back to the room to check it out and snapped some photos of the sofabed and have no idea whether the spots on the underside of the mattress are mold spots or not. It is interesting to note that the spots largely occur where shiny metal touches the bottom of the mattress, particularly over the springs and over the spot in the middle where two cross rods add support. My thought is that perhaps the springs and rods have a higher chance of condensing room humidity vapor, in which case the black marks may be mold or rust stains.....not sure? In any case, on checkout, I showed a photo to the front desk staffer and told her about what we found. She apologized and said she would have the room checked out. Anyway, check out the attached pictures.....I really don't know what the heck they are? In short, I was not unhappy but the sofabed issues made me question to a certain extent the status of this hotel as #1.....at the writing of this review, nobody has contacted me from the hotel to inform me what the conclusion of "looking into" the nature of the black spots.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel - Nothing More, Nothing Less”
Reviews.Author: margarita2
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the trip advisor reviews, and to be honest I was disappointed at the rating it has been given. As others have said there is nothing wrong with this hotel, but equally it is not outstanding in any way. Just average. We stayed in a King Suite Room and paid $110 + tax per night. The room was very clean, but extremely old fashioned, I believe that this isn't a very old hotel, but somehow they managed to make the rooms look like they were designed in the 70's. Its strange that someone else noticed that the dry lined walls moved!. My husband lent on the wall and the whole thing moved in and out! . It was very busy being high season and the breakfast area was a frenzy. Too many people in such a small space, although many tables to sit at, we could never find one easily and when we did find one it was filthy and covered with everybody elses leftovers. Some people just don't clear up after themselves, but putting their trash in the bins provided. Hectic, so we skipped breakfast. There are 24 hour coffee / Tea facilities which is nice. If in the area again I would try somewhere else. Although I have to say in fairness to the hotel, the staff that we encountered were 1st class, very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Not #1”
Reviews.Author: supermanhicks
Reviews.Content: It just wasn't up to the usual Marriott level. The hotel was clean and the pool was great but the walls were razor thin. I could actually lightly push on the "drywall" and make the wall go in, the wall studs were just really really far apart. The TVs were not flat screen, something I would expect. The hotel just seemed a little older on the interior than the exterior. It was an OK place, but I don't think it was worth approximately $100 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Theme Park hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvtodance
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel close to Universal that was comfortable, clean, quiet, safe and even within walking distance and this Marriot was just right. We stayed on a Friday and Saturday night. We had a ground floor room and heard not a peep from our neighbors at night. The room although sparsely decorated was clean as a whistle. The beds were comfortable, not plush. We had 4 pillows on each double bed! The shower head was huge with multi-settngs, the water hot and the bathroom had plentiful soft thick towels.The air conditioning was cold and not overly noisey. We could've chosen a king suite which included a fridge and microwave but decided to pay $20 less since we planned to spend every minute at Universal and City Walk. The room was made up each day. We did eat breakfast at the hotel. The coffee was brewed just right(we drank the dark roast) and always available in the lobby. The breakfast was the usual fare ie hardboiled eggs, bagels, muffins, danish, cereals, even premade waffles and pancakes(the kids in the hotel went for these), yogurt and fresh fruit too, and all was well stocked. We had free in room wireless internet. The hotel also had a separate room on the ground floor with 2 computers available for public access, and often in use, we noticed. The pool and jacuzzi were heated and open from 6am til 11pm. We hoped to use the jacuzzi in the evening but unfortunately a lot of other people had the same plan. The security guard locked up on schedule. The hotel is very close to Wet and Wild and my husband clocked it a mile from the Universal entrance, and yet very quiet. We took a route to Universal using the short back road on Carrier street which intersects Universal Blvd, so its practically impossible to get lost and the area seems very safe. The hotel provides a free shuttle to Universal but it runs only at specific times, so be sure to ask for these. The area surrounding the hotel has great restaurants..see trip advisor restaurant reviews. We noticed that Seasons 52 is minutes away as well as Cafe TuTu(artsy with entertainment), and Texas de Brasil. If you have money to spend, try making a reservation at Texas de Brasil...it has an amazing salad bar and they freshly carve meats at your table..an all you can eat place..not cheap($45/pp), but memorable. We noticed a line outside of the Pirates Dinner Theatre when we were on our way out for the evening and wish we had time planned to try it too...it would be a leisurely short walk from the hotel. On the morning of our departure we noticed that the hotel also has a game room area with pool table and arcade games. It would've been fun to play a game of pool if we had had more time. The hotel also has a covered patio area with tables and seating, and we sat out late one evening talking and enjoyed the night air. The staff at the hotel were very pleasant and efficient and seemed to really enjoy their jobs. This is not a 4 star hotel because if lacks in material embellishments, but it rates 4 star in all other respects.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Fairfield”
Reviews.Author: PAPAGENE4JACK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and could not have made a better choice. I see why this hotel get's good reviews. The staff was great and very helpful at all times. It's was my wife's birthday and we made reservations at FishBones Restaurant on the staff's recommendation and it was a great choice. The hotel even gave us complimentary cocktails which I though was thoughtful. The hotel was very quiet considering we were there during spring break. The rooms are very clean and the maid service was outstanding. They have a full breakfast and as always it was very good. I really felt very comfortable there and would definitely go back. You won't find a better hotel for the price in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Confortable”
Reviews.Author: bb_re
Reviews.Content: This was our second hotel for our 2 week Honeymoon in Orlando, we stayed here for our visits to Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure. The hotel is GREAT! Like my title says, totally confortable, it has everything, buses that take you to the Universal Parks, breakfast (buffet), free internet, etc! The room was spacey enough for both of us. And the service at the front desk deserved and A+! Its really quiet outside and in. Totally Recommendable. :D

Reviews.Title: “Fantastc value for money!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lilleth_fairy
Reviews.Content: I was slightly wary of this hotel before my holiday as lots of people had vote it so good, yet others couldn't understand why it was so highly recommended. I can now see why it is such a favourite. It is in a perfect location, situated just slightly back from International Drive so no noise and heavy traffic. As it is in the middle of International Drive it is a great location for both the more upscale end and the cheap and cheerful!! We also found that Sand Lake road that the hotel is off is fab because one way you get straight onto the motorway to Disney & the other way takes you to the Florida Mall. When we arrived at the hotel we were told that they did not have any notice of our booking. This immediately worried us but they sorted it in a matter of minutes (Virgin had confirmed our booking with them as being for May not March!!!) We had a lovely spacious room on the 4th floor whch was plenty big enough for two of us with two double beds, a comfy chair, desk and chair, t.v, drawers & hanger space. The bathroom was a fair size and was nice as the basin was in a separate vanity area so two people could get ready at the same time. The only thing I didn't really like was the fact that although there is a covering on the windows and net curtains so you can't see in the actual curtains were only there for display & did not meet in the middle. I am a heavy sleeper so it didn't bother me but some people may find this disturbing. The facilities at the hotel were also brilliant. We were able to store all our valuables (phone, passport, money etc) in the storage boxes at the front desk. I was a bit unsure at first about not having a safe in my room, but it worked out really well. We just asked at the desk for our stuff as we were going out for the day so we knew to take what we needed. The staff were all really helpful, and as you have the only key to the safe & they ask for your signature to open it I felt everything was secure. We used the business suite for the internet most days just to check up on stuff. You get 15 mins per session which we found plently long enough. Sometimes it was busy but we just went back when we felt it would be quieter. We also used the pool area once - plenty of loungers, clean towels (we used our own as we didn't relise these were avaiable) & the pool itself ws lovely and clean & warm. We also bought a few bits in the hotel shop when we couldn't be bothered to walk to international drve (it's not that far we were being lazy!!) which we found wasn't too badly priced. We also used the free shuttle to Universal which was great (especially as on a Thurs-Sat night it comes back late from City Walk) we didn't have to worry about parking and could also get our bearings of the area whilst on the bus. Coming back it was running a little bit late but we had no other plans so that was fine. The breakfast was great for a freebie. Plenty of choice. I mainly stuck to cinamon buns or bagels, but there were plently of cereals, pastries, etc to keep you going. Although the breakfast area is relatively small there were always tables available with some people choosing to sit in the pool area to eat. I was very impressed by the cleanliness of the hotel, the rooms were immaculately clean even when we'd dumped our shopping bags everywhere the cleaned round them so it didn't look like a bomb hit the place!!!! We had fresh towels most days & you can leave a sign on the bed telling the maids when you'd like your linen changing!!! I would definitely recommend this hotel to others & would most certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “What a great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdh2311
Reviews.Content: We were moved here from Quality Inn Plaza mid holiday and wished we had chosen this hotel from the start. The place was clean felt secure the pool was never busy the continental breakfasts make a difference to your pocket if your on a budget. Its quiet location is very close to international drive and in easy access of all theme parks, malls etc. will be staying again in 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit, Will stay Again...Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunshine_agent
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to the Fairfield Inn, and I remember why I went back. The hotel is great, not 5 Diamond perfect, but a wonderful hotel. I work in the travel industry and have booked travelers here, and never once have been told that it was a unsatisfactory. The breakfast choices are great, a variety for everyone, if you cant find something there to grab for breakfast, then I am not sure what you will do. I-Drive can be congested, but the accessibility to the area attractions cant be beat. Will I stay here again...OF COURSE, Will I book this hotel for others...NO DOUBT!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tony056
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights whilst visiting DisneyWorld and Kennedy Space Centre. Located in Marriot Village with surrounding restaurants. Good sized room, comfortable bed, free wireless internet, free continental breakfast and free transfers to DisneyWorld. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Surprised it's #1 ..”
Reviews.Author: Jenn7037
Reviews.Content: I travel to Orlando every year for business & personal vacations, and have stayed at all kinds of properties, including several Disney resorts. Here's how I would breakdown this property: Location- International Drive can get pretty congested with traffic but the location is very convienent to the all the parks, shopping and dinning. I always have a rental car so I can't comment on the park shuttles from this property although I did see several guests returning & leaving on shuttles through out the day. Rooms- Hotels in Orlando are used & abused since they are booked nearly year round. I imagine it's difficult to keep any property looking brand new. These rooms were clean but could use some updating in the decor. Overall room size was generous with a sitting area and desk. Bathroom was tiny and showed some wear & tear. Staff & Other Stuff- Free breakfast is great and such a money saver - especially in a town where everything is so over priced. Staff was really helpful and gracious with all my business requests. Free Wi-fi (that actually works) is always important to a business traveler. The property grounds aren't especially scenic or resorty but there is a pool on site. Overall, you can do a lot worse in Orlando. It's a good value - especially when contrasted to the Disney properties which are insanely over priced. Would I stay there again - maybe. Will it be tops on my list for the next trip to Orlando - probably not. And that's becuase there are some newer Marriott properties on International / Universal Drive that offer similiar ammenities for close to the same rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Beth02
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the Fairfield Inn, International Drive. This was an excellent hotel for this hotel category. The hotel was very nice - good staff, good location, clean rooms, comfortable beds, great breakfast, nice pool area, free internet, free parking, free business center, close to Universal Studios and restaurants - excellent value for the price. We used the shuttle to go to Universal Studios, Islands of Adventure and City Walk. But you can easily walk there in 30 minutes which we did twice. The breakfast included yogurt, egg and sausage sandwiches, hard boiled eggs, pancakes or waffles, muffins, donuts, toast, bagels, cereal, real (good quality) orange juice, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, and apples, bananas, and/or oranges. Very good selection and you can dine inside or out - nice covered patio by the pool. We enjoyed hanging out at the pool - very quiet while we were there. The business center was very convenient for checking flights and printing boarding passes. All in all, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “No wonder its the #1 hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wecanbeheroesjust41d
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in Fairfield in mid February and couldn't fault it. The hotel was busy and full some nights and its no wonder and yet you never felt over run as everything in the hotel is well managed. Our suite was well laid out and it was plenty big enough for 2 adults and 2 teenagers - We used the couch and had a roll away bed in the room - and they were very comfortable and no extra charge. The Room was clean and even had a small microwave and fridge and 2 televisions and had plenty of storage space for luggage and all the shopping ! The free breakfast is a bonus and very convenient and sets you up for the day, they have free coffee available all day also in the lobby. Breakfast is buffet style with Tea, Coffee juices, porridge, and a good selection of rolls, muffins, breads for toast, fruit, yogurts, danishes and cereals, We never used the pool as we spent a lot of our time in nearby Wet and Wild ( 3 mins drive 15 mins walk) but it was a decent size, very clean and plenty of sun beds. The location is very good for Universal, Islands of Adventure, City Walk and Wet and Wild as they are so close and the free shuttle buses (3 in morning and 3 back in afternoon/evening are well recommended - because its $12 to park in Universal and $10 in Wet and Wild. A taxi only cost us $8 back early one afternoon. There are a great selection of restaurants and shops nearby on i Drive and the Prime Shopping outlets are about 3 miles away, Florida Mall about 4 miles away down Sand Lake Rd and Premium outlets 9 miles away so location could not be better. We didn't do Disney this time but there are shuttles there from the hotel too but its further than Universal. Hotel staff ,as previousy reported by TA guests, are very customer service orientated and nothing is a problem, Laura on reception was particluarily good !! We used the Orlando Magic Card, downloaded from the internet ,and got a great discount off the room rate. Keep the card to get the coupon books in the shopping malls and some discounts off attractions. See the Orlando visitors website. Shopping is good, though I noticed that you have to do a bit of homework to maximse bargains, (10% if you spend $100 in Tommy, $25 off when you spend $125 in Polo in Premium outlets. etc) Many shops had "buy one, get one half price", so dont rush in and buy straight away do some planning there is plenty of good value to be had. Thisd was a very enjoyable holiday for us and when visit Orlando again would have no hesiatation is staying here

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Orlando without doubt”
Reviews.Author: aygoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during last couple of weeks and franky expected a lot from the #1 hotel. Firstly I couldn't put my finger on how good it was then started to discover the deep down cleanliness , the free internet pcs , the shower head , the excellent free breakfast , the quietness of the location considering closeness to IDrive, the firm but comfy beds , the cheerful and helpful staff , the all day free coffee/tea/hot chocolate, free newspapers, no noisy on-site bar, etc etc . It was all these things and more adding up that made the stay a pleasure. And all for Â£25 per night from VirginAtlantic ! We've been to Orlando several times and seem to have stayed in them all but this is undoubtedly the best hotel ever . Can't wait to return (hope I get a great price again!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BSouliere
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night after a day in Universal. Good location with places to eat minutes away. Nice modern room a bit on the small side but extremely clean. Hotel was full and never heard any noise. A pretty good free breakfast (any hotel that wants to give me free Lucky Charms for breakfast is A-OK with me). The pool was nice and the jacuzzi was great to soak my aching feet. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel. It is a nice basic, very clean hotel at a great price...!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndrewandSue
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairfield Inn & Suites from 25th Jan 2009 for 2 wks to celebrate our Wedding Anniversary and Birthdays. We upgraded to a suite which was lovely and spacious. The hotel is spotless and the staff very polite and friendly. The free breakfast was very good and offered plenty of choice, the pool was lovely and warm. The hotel location is great and within walking distance of international Drive but ideal because it is in a quiet location. Unfortunately the weather was very mixed when we were there we had some lovely warm weather but some days were very cold! Other than weather our only negatives about this hotel are no pay per view movies and it would have been nice if hotel had acknowledged our Wedding Anniversary & Birthdays they had been informed by Virgin Holidays but didn't do anything which was a bit disappointing. We have been to Florida several times before and not sure really if this hotel is the no.1. hotel in Orlando but it is nice, clean and good value for money with a great free breakfast but personally we have stayed in better hotels ie; Crowne Plaza & Walt Disney World but they were more expensive. Overall for value for money we would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value...Save w/Magic Card”
Reviews.Author: t-forres
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on it's #1 ranking from trip advisor. I'm not sure it deserves #1, but knowing ahead of time that it's not a 5-star rating, I would still recommend this hotel as a good value. Friendly check-in, nice powerful shower head, comfortable pillow-top feeling bed. Good location w/easy access to the highway, quiet back street, walking distance to many resturants, the breakfast was perfect to get us started before we headed off to the attractions (milk, juices, cerals, pasteries, yogurt, jimmey-dean sandwich to pop in micro-wave). The staff was friendly and did a good job of keeping a clean atmosphere. *FYI Saving Tips...-Make your hotel reservation and mention that you have the "Orlando Magic Card", it's free to download, Example-Suite peak season $90, off-peak season $86. http://www.orlandoinfo.com/magicard/ -Buy your park tickets at Wal-Mart (about a mile away) Example-Sea World $65 adult, $57 child. Blizzard Beach water park $37 adult, $31 child. Wal-Mart address-[--]. -Looking for Disney stuff...Orlando Wal-Mart has a large section of Disney licensed items to choose, some of the exact same items that we saw in the Disney shops for about 1/2 price. *FYI...If you go to Animal Kingdom make sure you do the safari ride, watch the nemo musical show (and I'm not normally into musicals), would not recommend the dinosaur ride for youngsters under 5 (dark, loud, scary ride). **Anyway...I travel a good bit and have stayed at many levels of hotels from the Wynn in Vegas, to the very basic Motel 11. There are way more exciting properties in Orlando, however this hotel worked just fine for our Disney week family of three vacation.

Reviews.Title: “For the frugal, practical vacationer.”
Reviews.Author: Maedog
Reviews.Content: Me & the husband wanted to get away from the northeast winter and hit Universal Studios. He booked this hotel through Universal Studios. The hotel was great: it was no frills, but clean, and the staff was always very friendly with answers to our questions. The breakfast is also no-frills, but the cereal, bagels, and fruit offerings were enough to get us through the morning. The little coffee stand actually offers decent coffee, too. The hotel is in walking distance to many fast food chain restaurants (Some non-chain places as well. Alas, they didn't do too well on the trip advisor reviews so we stayed away). Also, a few Wal-Green pharmacies within a mile to stock up on bottled water and snacks. This hotel offers free shuttle service to Universal and we had absolutely no problems. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and unbelievable value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kittylitter_1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December and cannot fault it. The free breakfast was great, room was lovely, clean and spacious and I cannot fault the staff, they were so helpful and pleasant. Planning on going back there in September but unfortunately can only get a week here! Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ColinH71
Reviews.Content: After a week at a Walt Disney World resort, we were looking for a nice, economical place to stay in Orlando, close to the airport for our return trip home. The Fairfield Inn by Marriott, Orlando was perfect. The rooms were exactly what we were looking for; clean and provided the basic amenities for our brief stay. Contrary to the travellers from DC, we used the pool twice during the stay, once in the late morning when the sun was shining down a comfortable 72F and again the evening before we left. The pool was kept bath-water warm and was an excellent way to wind down at the end of a day, in preparation for our flights the next day. I habitually pick Marriott brand hotels over others because of the consistent quality and amenities they provide, no matter where you are travelling. The Fairfield Inn Orlando was no exception. It helps to start the day off with something to eat at the hotel breakfast area, instead of getting to a restaurant, ordering, eating, paying, it's almost noon and half a day wasted. The breakfast area was large and had plenty of tables. The variety of hot and cold breakfast items is good and there were healthier options available to the regular sugary pastries and cereals. The next morning, it was a quick 15 minute trip to the airport. You are also not far from anything in the Orlando area. We would certainly book another stay at the Fairfield Inn Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Orlando attractions, but remember its not a 5-Star”
Reviews.Author: DaJoos
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4-night stay at the Fairfield Inn & Suites and had a very nice time. The pros - As written about previously the hotel is in a quiet location but very near the action - a good balance. The weather was too cool to tempt me into the pool (high 60's, low 70's - cooler at night) but it looked large and well maintained. The breakfast area is large with a good selection of items - no food is prepared for you but toasters and microwaves get the job done. The staff is friendly and accomodating, and the servers working the breakfast lounge kept it clean and well-stocked - quite the feat considering the crowd a couple mornings. The room was moderately sized and clean. Parking was ample and free. The cons - I guess that in spite of the other reviewers mentioning the same thing I'm going to the placement of this hotel as #1 in Orlando (with seemingly millions of competitors!) got my wife and I's hopes up a bit too high - not the hotel's fault assuredly. The lobby is sort of a pass through to the elevator banks and really needs some updating (not dirty, but needs some style). The hallways are kind of dank (is that a word?) and narrow, and the rooms are average and actually well priced for what you get - again the #1 rating had me picturing a beautiful suite. The A/C comes from a large window unit that does the job but which has to noisily cycle on and off to do it - no central A/C. The bathroom consists of a toilet and shower in a small room that is separate from the sink - good for having multiple people be able to get ready at the same time, but each area seems small when cut in half, so to speak. Bottom line - I'd definately consider staying here again, and the hotel is very well priced. Just temper your expectations of a #1 hotel and you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic choice”
Reviews.Author: JenCrawley
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weeks over the new year and had a fantastic time. . Although not a 5* hotel, the service we received during our stay couldn't have been regarded as anything less. This deserves its #1 rating as its location is very convenient not only for International Drive but also for driving purposes, beng so near the I4 meant shopping, Kennedy Space Centre, etc, were very easy to access. The bonus of shuttle buses was also great. The staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful either, even the slightest problem was immediately rectified. All in all we had a very relaxing and fun break.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Staff”
Reviews.Author: budefraser
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Fairfield Inn, Canada Avenue and we cannot praise the hotel enough. The staff were brilliant, cheerful and always happy to help. The hotel is efficiently run and very convenient to all parks and malls. Will certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Yates-J
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 16 nights commencing 8th December. Hotel was chosen following extensive research on trip advisor and we were very pleased with our choice. Hotel extremely clean, great location within walking distance of restaurants, shops, but away from any traffic noise. I Ride Trolley stop also nearby and shuttle provided free of charge by the hotel to Universal parks and seaworld, wet and wild and Aquatica always on time. Breakfast very good, no wait ever experienced to get a table although we did eat before 8.00am. Swimming pool always very clean and a lovely temperature. Rooms large, very clean and well equipped. All staff including cleaners, hotel and pool maintenance staff, breakfast and reception staff were superb. I have stayed at more than 50 hotels worldwide and Fairfield Inn and Suite's staff are certainly the best. I am usually quite hard to please however this hotel deserves their No 1 rating on Trip Advisor. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: Franki_77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November and after the great reviews on here we were a little disappointed. There are plenty of positives to the place, breakfast was great and plenty of choice, as non drivers we found the location fantastic for getting around with shuttles to universal and seaworld and a 5 minute walk to I-drive, Hotel was clean and all areas appeared well maintained and the rooms were fine for the 3 of us, However the negative side, on arrival we were booked into a second floor room, this turned out to be directly above an outside ventilator system which made a dreadful noise all night and around 6.30am the bins were rolled around under the window, we got no sleep at all and we requested a move and were given one straight away, however we were placed on a floor inbetween groups of teenagers who ran around till after 2am, we had to ring downstairs 3 times about this before we heard security come and speak with them, we also came home late one evening to find a cockroach scuttling around the floor, we did manage to catch it albeit in the early hours of the morning and the next day the hotel had the room thoroughly cleaned and just as another positive the hotel staff were great in dealing with our issues and very friendly. Although we did check out early as we didnt want to take a chance I do think that some of the problems that we faced were slightly unlucky rather than major hotel faults. If looking for a budget end hotel with breakfast then this fits the bill with a great location however I do not think it warrents its number one slot in this chart.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: GirlMouse
Reviews.Content: Now, this is an ok hotel but I really have to wonder what in heaven's name is this hotel doing as the Tripadvisor #1 in Orlando hotels? I'll give you first the positive. The location is very good: on a quiet neighbourhood with a short distance to any mall and to the parks. Also, the breakfast was really good, lot of items to choose from and not crowded in the breakfast room. Free parking was also nice and easy. Service was also good (save as to the pool thing explaned below). Then the negatives/averages. The room was at most average. The air-conditioning was oldfashioned and super noisy (not possible to sleep if it is on) and it did not really work too good, at least with hot air. The windows were thin and it was a cold week in Orlando, so not very nice that the heating did not work properly. There should at least be more blankets in the rooms if the heating does not work! Then one huge huge issue, which could be an asset for the hotel but during our stay it definitely was not: the pool! They have an ok pool with a nice whirlpool. But: the second AND the third day of our stay, the whole pool area is closed!! And due to cleaning they said, as if, how can it take whole two days to clean one small pool area?? That was really bad service to the customers, I have to say. I was so irritated because you really do need the pool relaxation after those long days at the parks. They should really understand that MOST of their customers for sure come to Orlando to do the parks and some serious shopping, and you are tired after all that - so if I have booked a hotel with a pool, I expect to have the pool working at least two days out of three! They did say that we could use the pool of some close-by hotel, but leaving to another hotel to just use the pool would really frustrate the purpose of a relaxing pool experience, wouldn't it? But like said, an ok hotel, even could be nice if the pool and the air-conditioning machine would be working, but still no Tripadvisor #1. Ps. I took the advice from some people here on Tripadvisor, and did not take the hotel shuttle but drove the car to Universal. That a a good choise I think, very fast but of course it cost USD 15 to park at Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sue13Cwmbran
Reviews.Content: Eleven of us stayed at Fairfield in a mixed group of adults, teenagers and very young children. The staff were fantastic nothing was too much trouble even if it was the children asking. My granddaughter mentioned to the receptionist that the pool was cold and they immediately turned the temperature up. Location was spot on, room service was excellent and we all had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: yasmin25
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night at the end of our holiday before flying home. We chose this hotel from the reviews on trip advisor and we were not disappointed. The hotel is excellent value for money. It is not luxurious but clean, adequate and comfortable with a nice pool area. One of our children was unwell and the hotel staff could not do enough to help us. They gave us a complimentary drink with electrolytes from the shop to help her restore her fluids. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would definitely consider staying for longer on a return visit. The bedrooms are spacious and clean. There was a drinks machine on our floor and an ice machine. You could help yourself to tea/coffee from Reception and there was a little shop selling a few basic food items etc. We walked to TGI Friday's which was just down the road and picked up some take out.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: graham047
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 10 nights at this lovely hotel. We had a suite on the 5th floor which has a very comfortable lounge ares and plenty of storage. The room was maintained really well throughout our stay. The bed is huge and extremely comfortable. The breakfast was included in the rate and was plentyful and varied. The reception staff were always willing to help with advice and information, and the free shuttle to Universal was a real bonus. We cannot rate this hotel highly enough. Thanks to all the staff

Reviews.Title: “uncomfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: Doreen17
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because of its location near Universal and the good reviews it received on trip advisors. We were booked from 11/8 to 11/15. As soon as we both got in bed the first night we knew we were going to be unhappy. The beds are very soft with no support. I felt like I was sleeping on a big piece of foam. Both of our backs were hurting for most of the next day. We knew if we didn't change hotels our vacation would be ruined. We spoke to the women at the check-in counter and explained our problem. She was very understanding and did not hold us to our reservation. She didn't even charge us for a second night even though it was way past check-out time. Everything else about the hotel was just as good as all the reviewers said. If you don't have any back problems and like soft mattresses than this hotel would be fine. We ended up at a hotel in Kissimee (see my other review for Comfort Inn and Suites)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: SantanaDavid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Fairfield Inn & Suites in Orlando for two nights at the start of our tour of the USA. We chose this hotel after reading the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor and we werenâ€™t disappointed. We were very pleased with the quality of the hotel which is located very near to Universal Studios. Reception and checking in was friendly and efficient and our room was very clean, well appointed and comfortable. The hotel has a very nice outdoor swimming pool with sunbeds around it although the water was rather cool! It surprises me that with the Florida sunshine, hotel owners do not simply insert an array of solar panels in the return water flow to the pool which would heat up the pool water at no cost. Anyway, we braved it as it was! The Continental Breakfast served every morning is excellent with a good choice of items available in a pleasant breakfast room and there is also a little self service shop area with various items on sale such as drinks and confectionery. One pays at reception. There are several restaurants within walking distance including TGI Fridayâ€™s where we ate on our first night there. We took advantage of the free daily shuttle bus to Universal Studios and back and there are several timings available. All in all, we were very pleased with our first two nights at The Fairfield Inn and would certainly return there on our next visit to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday of our lives”
Reviews.Author: Kellyfamily_8
Reviews.Content: It's no wonder this hotel is number 1 as everything about it is great, it's spotless clean and above all its the staff that really make the difference. They make you feel so welcome and nothing is too much trouble. The location of the hotel is great also your not too far from anything, with a free shuttle to Universal, Sea World and wet and wild, Disney is also on 20 mins drive and the hotel have a special rate with the shuttle company which works out pretty good value. After holidaying in Orlando i'd find it hard to go anywhere else so i'll definately be back and the first thing i'll be doing is booking this hotel again. I traveled with my wife and 7 month old daughter and must say that Orlando is definately the most friendly place that i've ever been.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly good value”
Reviews.Author: A1Globetrotter
Reviews.Content: I can highly recommend this property. It's not the Ritz but it does offer excellent value for money. The property is very clean and well run with good security and excellent facilities. The staff are VERY friendly and helpful. The inclusive continental breakfast offers a wide range of choice and is more that enough to keep the family going until lunch. As a Universal partner free transfers to the two Univeral theme parks in Orlando are provided. The hotel also provides free security lockers for quests - a good place to keep your passports, credit cards when not in use and of course your return airline tickets!

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality Fairfield”
Reviews.Author: nic0e
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly new property near the International Drive area of Orlando. It is close by to Universal Studios. I stayed for business for two nights. The hotel was clean and the bed was quite comfortable. It's pretty much what you would expect from a Fairfield, keeping in mind that this is Marriott's budget chain brand. Don't expect luxury in any way but a clean, comfortable place to stay. I felt the breakfast options were quite limited and chose to go elsewhere on my 2nd day. I was not able to try the pool or other recreation amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place !!! Fab Hotel, the best!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kay&Allan
