Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks from 18th October and found this hotel to be great. The staff we're so happy to help and friendly, nothing was too much trouble. The room was quite big and VERY comfortable! It was cleaned every day, spotless!! Bed was very comfy too. This hotel is in a great position just off I drive. Breakfast was fab too, always enough to eat!! I could'nt recommend this hotel higher to anyone, it was just perfect!!!!!! Would def stay there again (will stay there again when go back!!)

Reviews.Title: “Please heat up the pool!”
Reviews.Author: Dublinmama
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our toddler for a couple of nights en route to key west. The rooms were a good size, the beds were comfortable and it was kept well. There was a decent choice for breakfast and somewhere to sit down and eat it. the staff were very helpful but I would have some criticism. There is a desk in the lobby with brochures for the different attratactions. However, the person manning the desk on the first morning tried to get me to go to some 90 minute presentation on timeshares. I don't think it is an appropriate way to try and market this by chatting up guests on the premise of offering advice on attractions. The only other criticism i would have is that the pool is freezing and not suitable for little ones to spend a lot of time in. All in all it is good value, centrally located and hassle free. One other note of caution! The television set is down on top of a cabinet in easy reach of toddlers who can spend many hours of fun switching it on and off. However, my concern is that it is all too easy to pull it down on top of themselves. Perhaps the hotel could locate it somewhere else for you.

Reviews.Title: “Simplicity at its best with service second to none!”
Reviews.Author: Ginap2883
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for 14 nights at the end of Sept and beginning of October. We could not fault the effeciency of the front of house staff. They were extremely helpful, friendly and nothing was too much trouble. This is a Marriott budget hotel, and this must not be forgotten by those expecting pure luxury, however, this hotel offers everything for those visiting the theme parks of Orlando. It includes a continental breakfast, has a nice clean swimming pool, and very hot jacuzzi, a launderette and free internet access, and a small exercise room. We stayed in a King Suite and the beds were so comfortable that on my return, I bought a new mattress which hopefully will be very similar! The hotel is clean, airy and spacious and we loved it! Very close to international drive abundant with restaurants, but if I had one request it would be to introduce a restaurant of its own. This is a request not a criticism. Thanks to the staff at the Fairfield Inn and Suites, and when we return to Orlando this hotel will be our choice again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: rabnala
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Fairfield recently for four nights in total in the week commencing 13 Sep 2008 and the hotel lived up to its good reputation. Handy location (5 mins walk to International Drive). We had a mini suite which was a good size and had a separate seating area with a TV & Hi-Fi. The suite was clean and bright, had ample storage space and, importantly, a comfortable bed. It had a mini-fridge (ideal for a late night beer as the hotel doesnâ€™t have a bar), microwave and coffee maker. The hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful. The complimentary continental breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice. I got a discount on our (already good) room rate when checking in by flashing my Orlando Magic Card (a tip which I got from a previous poster for this hotel). Download one, itâ€™s worth it. I used the free internet & pcs in the business area which was good for checking email etc. Smallish gym with bikes, cross trainers & running machines etc (which I didnâ€™t use as I was on holiday!) and a decent sized pool. Used the laundry which was very useful before we travelled onto our second week in New York. While I donâ€™t think I will be back in the Orlando area for a while, if that changed, I would definitely use the Fairfield again. Itâ€™s not a 5 star luxury hotel (it doesnâ€™t claim to be) but for the money, if you need a safe, clean, comfortable hotel near Int Drive, you would be hard pushed to do better than the Fairfield.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel with great service!”
Reviews.Author: fishcakesDudley
Reviews.Content: our family stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks in august. the rooms were a really good size we definately didn't feel like we were on top of each other, with the beds being more comfortable than ny home bed! the only downside was we had a double room and not a suite so we didn't have a fridge, we remedied this by buying a $1.60 chest from walmart and topped it up with the free ice! they were lovely and clean with maid service daily, we even had to tell the maid not to change the hand soap after just one use! the staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. the breakfast was lovely, ranging from cereals to toast and waffles with fresh fruit we were a bit cheeky and bought some foil from walmart and took pastries from breakfast to have at the parks later in the day! the pool area was lovely and clean with towels provided . we will definately be staying at this hotel again in 2010!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: GosportEngland
Reviews.Content: Staff were excellent! Rooms were clean and and comfortable. Breakfast was slightly limited on few mornings. In very handy location for universal and seaworld and waterparks. Only 5 minute walk from international drive. Pool clean and hardly busy most of the time. Would definately recommend to friends and family and would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value,Great Location, Great Accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: SunChaser75
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed in this hotel for 10 nights, whilst travelling to Florida with friends. It was an all round good choice for price, location, service, facilities and standard. There was free breakfast included along with our room, which was a King Suite. This comprises of a lounge seating area with tv and stereo, sofa, seat and coffee table. The double mirrored wardrobe acted as a 'divide' from the bedroom to the lounge area. A desk/dressing table and further spacious drawers with yet another tv to the bed side of the room. The bed was king size and comfy! There was internet access down in the lobby for free and free printing services - great if you need to print off info of the local area to digest in your room or if you are booking those leg roomy seats on the plane back home!! I would say the location is a bonus, as it is just off International Drive - about a 3 minute walk. Its all on the flat so no problems if you have mobility issues. The pool and spa were always immaculate and pool towels were provided, which is a great bonus to save room in the suitcase! There was hairdrying facilities, soaps, shampoos etc everyday - another space saving bonus! (A famous brand name too, not just the crappy cheap stuff!!). Breakfast was simple, but enough to start your day off well. Continental style buffet, which was stocked regularly and hot fresh coffee was always available. There was the option to purchase park / attraction tickets at Reception, but we found it cheaper to go to one of the designated booths about 1mile away. We would definitely go back to this hotel, if we were going to Orlando. Great value, Great location and Great accommodation!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine as a place to crash after visiting the parks”
Reviews.Author: Samsiebabes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine as a place to stay while visiting the theme parks etc. however the rooms are relatively small and both the room and corridor had a rather unfavourable smell which was quite unpleasant! The pool area is small and pretty much a small rectangle in the middle of the carpet. The breakfast did have quite a lot of choice and was well maintained. There was also a laundry room and a games room which were nice touches. There is free internet access on computers near the lobby and free wireless internet access throughout the hotel which again was good. The buses to the parks go relatively early and come back quite late - so if your using them be prepared for a long day! However a taxi to Universal and Seaworld is only around $11. We had friends staying at the Wyndham across the street and this had much nicer rooms and an infintitely better pool area however they didn't have the breakfast for a similar price. Good restaurants on international drive are Uno and Kobe - the Japanese Steak house where they cook in front of you! Overall with this hotel you get what you pay for. I personally would stay at the Wyndham if i visited again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: JanH775
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in villas and hotels in Orlando previously with the family, this was the first time my husband and I had visited Orlando alone. We stayed at this hotel on two occasions over the 10 days we were in Florida, and found everything to be what we expect of a Marriott. We needed a bed for the night, and found the room clean and comfortable. The reception staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The Fairfield is at the cheaper end of the Marriott chain...the breakfast was free and "filled a corner" but if we wanted something to set us up for a day in the parks we went to Ponderosa on International Drive and paid $3.99 for a huge selection. International Drive is a short walk from the hotel, so I would imagine within half an hour walk there would be enough to suit everyone, souvenir shopping and eating-wise without needing the car, and within a few minutes drive there are outlets and shopping malls. This hotel is in the heart of International Drive, and if we come to Orlando again we won't have any hesitation in staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: leegielump
Reviews.Content: After reading all the great reviews of this hotel, we decided to book it for 12 nights at the end of August and I'm glad we did. On our arrival the staff were welcoming and helpful. Our room was clean, modern and spacious and the bed, well, just fantastic, I wanted to have shipped it back home The rooms are cleaned daily and everything was spotless. Following our stay last year in the Holiday inn, (which I would definately not reccomend,) this hotel was a real treat. The only thing that was missing was probably a bar but the breakfast was a real bonus. So I say give it a go, it may not be 5 star but it's comfortable and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great, comfortable and quiet hotel!”
Reviews.Author: keentraveller120
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here at the end of August 2008 for 4 nights. It is a lovely hotel - clean, comfortable, quiet and friendly! We had a standard room and payed $100 dollars per night before we got there, but I'm sure walk in rate it probably would have been cheaper, but it was a fair price for the hotel. Located a few minutes walk of International Drive it meant you were close enough to everything without having to epxerience all the noise of it! It was a 10/15 minute drive to all the main attractions - SeaWorld, Universal etc. About a 15 min walk away was the best resturant we found - Charley's Steakhouse! Not that cheap but great for a brilliant romantic meal! We didn't use the pool but it looked nice enough. Breakfast was a deluxe continental breakfast, which included cereal, sweet and savoury pastries, muffins, yoghurts, juices, tea, coffee and hot chocolate. Great to keep you filled up before a busy day! All in all it was a great base for a great holiday!!!! Reccommend 100%!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Freddy05
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 days and really loved this hotel. The rooms were clean and spacious. We did have a problem with damp from the air conditioning, however we advised reception and an engineer came straight away and fixed the problem. The pool was lovely and very warm. It was never busy and free pool towels were provided. The free continental breakfast was a nice touch and enough to keep us going until lunchtime. We found this hotel convenient to all the parks and walkable to International Drive. It felt very safe and we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amckinnon
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a stay at the Fairfield Inn, International Drive in Orlando and all I can say it was really excellent!! The location is great,staff brilliant and the rooms comfy and clean. The hotel itself is kept to a really high standard. The staff are so helpful and always very friendly. The hotel is one street off International Drive and you can walk easliy to the main strip. Near TGI and Chillis restaurants. 5 min walk. You get a free breakfast which is fruit,cereal,toast,bagels,waffles,pastries...etc A good start to the day. Would return in a minute. Excellent stay thanks to tripadvisor - we checked reviews for this hotel before we booked.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is overrated”
Reviews.Author: theTruthSpeaks
Reviews.Content: This hotel is overrated. We paid $99 per night for 2 nights. Let's get right to it. I think the reviews are either fake or written by people with lower expectations. Things we didn't like about the hotel: 1. No free shuttle bus from and to the airport, we spent $200 on taxi fairs alone. The Fairfield at the airport has free shuttle. 2. The room was muggy and smelly, yuk! 3. Old decor, stained carpet. 4. We asked the service counter to get us a cab. They ended up getting us a town and country car that cost us $50 to go to Epcot Center. 5. Far from everything. 6. Free breakfast was just OK. Mostly pastries, good coffee, but NO fresh bacon or eggs. Only prepackaged biscuit sandwich What we liked: 1. Free shuttle to Universal Studio. 2. Clean pool. 3. Free WiFi

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: kxk
Reviews.Content: I thought it would be safe to go with this hotel, since it's rated #1, a big mistake. The room just had a bad smell, room 321. The room was stuffy. On the brighter side,most of the towel and sheets were clean. Breakfast was very simple, and was included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not great”
Reviews.Author: Eriksens
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews on this site and booked it... it was not fantastic. It worked but I'm glad we only booked 2 nights. The location was ok. The reception neutral. The room was not very nice and the airconditioning was very loud. The pool was actually very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Our top "go-to" budget hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Marriott_Devotee
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here 3 times and it has never disappointed. Fantastic location (presuming one doesn't need to be right next to WDWorld) as it is convenient to highways, Universal, Intl Drive, Convention Center(s) and not THAT far away from Disney. . You definitely get more than you pay for with the rooms, breakfast, internet and overall service. Clean, nicely maintained, with lots of nice features (for free) that usually come with more expensive properties. . Breakfast is good -- not adequate. Staff is well trained and has a good attitude. NOT a great pool, but it's ok. . This is a budget property - Marriott style (which means it exceeds minimal standards by a LOT) - where you get WAY MORE than what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “The Fairfield was excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Paulrocks
Reviews.Content: Just come back home from a two week holiday in this hotel and i must say that this hotel is excellent.The staff are brill and helped out at any time of the day.A simple but good breakfast included in the price and free hot drinks any time. The hotel has very clean. Room was one of the best I have stayed in.The beds are great. Hotel also has a nice swimming pool.My family and I loved this hotel and would highly recommend it. Well done and Thanks to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EnglandCls
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairfield Inn from 20th-27th June, and absolutely loved it! The location was perfect - about 7 mins walk to I drive and the I ride trolley stop, with plenty of excellent restaurants (particularly Chilis - was fab)! We had a suite which was huge, there were two of us and it was great. Having a separate seating area was good, although it wasn't used much as we were too busy at the parks. The room was always clean, and the cleaning staff were very friendly. The breakfast was really good, a perfect start to the day (we moved to a Disney hotel for the last 9 days of our stay, and missed the ease of having breakfast included). The transport to Universal, Seaworld etc was good and generally on time. A tip - make sure you plan the night before the times of shuttles, as there are only 2 or 3 in the morning. Coming back from the parks worked well with the shuttles, but we did get taxis a few times - it never cost more than $10 from Universal including tip, so was not expensive, and was a bit more convenient. We did not have a car for this trip, and never felt that we were missing out - the hotels location is very convenient, and we really liked the free shuttles and easy walk to the I ride shuttle. I think it worked as we were two adults, but I would suggest a car if you have children, just for convenience and to avoid unnecessary waiting. Overall, I loved this hotel and will definately stay here again on my next trip to Orlando. It was in such a good location, the staff were very friendly and it was such a bargain (we paid about Â£21/$42 a night) - it was clean and comfortable and perfect for a theme park holiday.

Reviews.Title: “twice as nice”
Reviews.Author: sannf
Reviews.Content: having stayed at the fairfield last year we decided to return and this was the best decision we made. the hotel is still as fantastic as we remember. the staff not only remembered us but made our stay brilliant i can't sing their praises enough. the rooms are not only spacious but are cleaned everyday. the location is excellent for getting to all the attractions, and international drive is minutes away by foot, so you have the easy access but in a quite location. the complementary breakfast is really good toast,cereal,muffuns,pancakes paistries etc. would heartly recommend and we will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hinckley
Reviews.Content: My Family and i stayied at the Fairfied Inn & Suites for 14nights from July 10th 2008. I cannot prase this hotel enough, all of the staff at this hotel were so freindly from the reception to the gardeners they always asked how we were, and where we were going that day on the way out of the hotel or they asked how the day had been on our return. The room was the usual US type 2 double beds (which were memory foam) and very comfortable TV with plenty of channels if needed, soaps, shampoo, conditioner, coffee machine desk with internet conection, iron and board hair drier. the room was very clean and the maids came every day to keep it that way. The breakfast in the morning had Bread, English Muffins, bagals, pasteries, yougarts, chocolate muffins, Jimmy Deans Bacon Egg & Cheese Biscuit, cerials, Juices, coffee, tea, hot chocolate ect. The pool area was very clean with plenty of towels and the hot tub water was lovely and hot (just what you need after a long day in the theme parks) the pool is open from 6am -11pm. there is a games room, small gift shop on the ground floor and vending machines on every floor all with an ice machine next to them ( all drinks in the machine were $1.25 which is very cheep) The hotel is in walking distance from TGI Fridays, Fish Bones, Perkins and the attractions on I Drive, the Pirates dinner adventure is also a short walk. We all loved the hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone. Thank you Fairfeild.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant ,,”
Reviews.Author: bonded1967
Reviews.Content: myself ,my wife and two sons stayed here for 2 weeks in july,it is a fantastic place to stay ,,the staff were fantastic and friendly ,the rooms are cleaned every day ,nothing is a bother ,we upgraded our room to an elite suit at a quater of the price that the travel agent wanted,it is one block behind i-drive and is in easy reach to the parks ,they supply a bus to universal and disney is only a taxi ride away,the pool is a lot bigger than the photos show and the breakfasts are nice and light and plentyful,,if it could be improved ,i would have preferred a bar but that was easily sorted ,just come out the main entrance and look to your right ,you will notice a place called the "dowdy pavillion" in the bowling alley it is very cheap ,food and drinks for the kids and very friendly ,,across the small stone fyord and your a Oshucks bar ,nice food friendly atmosphere and child friendly,, your also close to tgi fridays and the pirates adventure..i really miss this place and will deffo be back ,orlando can be very hot and humid in july ,but ,hey ,you dont go for the rain,,as i said before "EXCELLENT"

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Resepiraterna
Reviews.Content: Stayd for 3 nights. Booked through universal vacation with stay and theme park tickets. Great hotel, Clean and friendly. Great breakfast. Would most certain stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: tomkinson851
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying here for 2 weeks, with my husband and 2 girls, aged 11 and 16. The hotel is immaculate! I booked this hotel after reading the reviews and was not disappointed. I had a mild issue on arrival, but the staff were so obliging, it was sorted out straight away. The staff were all very friendly and helful, especially Laura on front desk. My only disappointment, was there was no pool side snack bar. I felt this made it feel abit anti~social, But hey, we were so busy during the day that we only spent a couple of days by the pool. If you like your food, you must try chill's just up the road. Execellent food, as is TGI. Avoid wild jacks, food not so good there. I had bad meat there and when i told them, they were not bothered, so i'd give that one a miss. Also the pirates show, if you don't like hospital food, DON'T do this!! Show itself ok, although i left halfway through as service was not up to my liking and the waitress was rude!! But overall, if you are not bothered about socialising with other guests in the hotel, a first class!! Would definatley go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: JRics01
Reviews.Content: My buddy and I stayed in Orlando for 3 nights while visiting Universal Orlando. The room was clean, beds were EXTREMELY comfortable, and breakfast was great. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Attempted the free shuttle the first day, supposed to arrive at 8:20 AM. The shuttle arrived at 8:45AM, then after 4 hotel stops we got to Universal at almost 10:00AM. The longest part is that the driver has to go into each lobby and check in... I wouldnt call it "free" if you have to pay 75 minutes to get to Universal, which is about 3 blocks away. The return trip was just as bad- could have walked back in a quicker amount of time. Needless to say, we drove the next day, and got there in 5 minutes. Pool area is GREAT- plenty of towels. I would defiantely reccomend this hotel to anyone traveling to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “No frills no trills; Good, Clean and Convenient.”
Reviews.Author: airruiz
Reviews.Content: After reading itâ€™s ranking and all the reviews; I had to find out why, this hotel is the number 1 ranked hotel in Orlando. I was very intrigued how this hotel out ranked all these mega resorts with all the bells and whistles. So first opportunity being from Miami I took it. I went on line, straight to the Marriott web sight and booked a suite for $99. I booked this room for 3 nights. At first I thought this is not a big entrance. Than I thought to my self this is not a big hotel. Once I got in the room, I was like this is not the biggest suite Iâ€™ve been in. I kept thinking to my self why is this number one. Than little by little it all sank in. First the location, it is perfect right off international drive, same street as the big McDonalds. You could get to any park easily and quickly, as well as all the attractions on international. Than the hotel, small but clean well maintained, with great service. Finally the room, clean moderately spacious separated seating area with its own TV and fridge and microwave, as well as a small desk or eating table. So while this is not the most luxurious hotel, the biggest hotel, the resort on a park hotel; it is vary much the most convenient. This hotel separates itâ€™s self from the rest, by doing very simple but very effective things. One great service, on Friday I went out to eat at Le Coq Au Vin, another well deserved number 1. While passing the lobby I asked for directions and they went online and printed me out directions. They made that little extra effort that made a difference to me. Two they maintain the property clean and friendly. Finally the rooms clean with the right amenities. This is a hotel that has it right. You donâ€™t have to be a multi million dollar resort with mega pools and 1000 floors to be the most desired property. All you have to do is give your best with service maintained and give the most at the most competitive pricing. All though it hotel has no extra, it is an excellent value there for thats my rating. PS good food Spots Pizza: Real New York Pizza on OBT Dinner: Le Coq Au Vin Brunch: Dexterâ€™s of Thorton Park.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant! Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Em2587
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I both stayed in this hotel for our 21st trip to Orlando and we could not be more satisfied with the place. We chose this because it was great value, right round the corner from international drive and because of it's great reviews and it did not disappoint! The Breakfast was spot on, there were pastries, muffins, juice, hot beverages, bagels, toast, cereal, yoghurts, hot sandwiches, fruit - all you would expect from a continental breakfast and more! There are also hot beverages available free of charge 24/7. The staff were outstanding, they were always happy to help. Whilst I was abroad I had to forward some documents to work but the printer ran out of ink (this is the computer and printer that are free to use and come in very useful, there is also free wireless for those with laptops!) so i informed reception and they let me use their printer and they even faxed over 30 sheets to the UK free of charge! I was very impressed with how amazing the service was. If a taxi is needed then they will order this for you once you've given them the necessary information. As we were in Orlando we didn't spend much free time in the hotel so didn't use the pool but what we saw of it was fine, there was a reasonably sized gym and a jacuzzi! International Drive is about 10 mins away but if you cut across the field directly opposite the hotel it cuts your time in half (you will come out by O'Shucks pub on International Drive). The Bus service from the hotel to the parks was a brilliant thing to have, although they do not go to Disney but this was not a problem for us as we stayed in Disney for 6 nights before arriving at this hotel as we are not old enough to rent a car! However, even if you miss the complimentary bus service, the I-Ride is only round the corner and that will take you to seaworld, aquatica, universal etc. Be sure to pick up the masses of coupon books round the corner from reception, they will save you some money. There is also a little shop in the lobby area for snacks and drinks and small souveneirs etc and next door to it there is a games room with different arcade machines! The rooms were reasonably sized, for just two of us there was plenty of room. The Air-Conditioning can be a bit noisy but you get use to it and I'd rather have it there and noisy than not there at all!! The beds were really comfy and there is plenty of room to store your clothes. I hope this review has helped and if there is anything I have missed that you want to know about please feel free to message me and i'd be more than happy to help!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Fairfield Inn!”
Reviews.Author: SarahSoutheastUSA
Reviews.Content: A very nice Fairfield Inn. This was a business trip in June 2008. Even though school was out and there were many children enjoying the hotel with its pool and game room while vacationing with parents, we were not bothered or annoyed. It is a great hotel for business and pleasure travelers and is an excellent value for your money. The hotel was quiet in the business center and we really appreciated the Wi-Fi and free internet access in the guest rooms. The comp breakfast is so much fresher and more like home than what the competition serves.The beds are fabulous and the rooms are quiet. Keep up the good work, Fairfield Inn Orlando International Drive!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: BaileyTravelBug
Reviews.Content: We're just back from four nights at the Fairfield Inn near International Drive in Orlando. Overall, it was a good stay. Check in was quick, and there was a problem with our room in that the AC didn't work. They sent someone quickly and we did have to change rooms, which was also quick. I was pleased with the response. The rooms were a little dated in my opinion (blond wood and hunter green carpet), but the rooms were clean and in good condition which is what really counts. We had a king suite for the two of us and it was perfect for us. For a rate of $105, it was a good deal. On the last night of our stay, a bus full of school kids checked in but they were (fortunately) not on our floor. We used the Universal shuttle on 2 days and it went well. Be sure to check the departure schedule posted on the signs at Universal. One group on our return shuttle ended up on the way to the wrong Fairfield Inn. We usually grabbed breakfast on the way out. The breakfast area was usually busy, but not too bad. A good selection of fruit, breads, pastries, yogurt, cereals, etc. The hotel is in a safe area, within walking distance to the Pirate Show, an amusement center, I-Drive, Chili's, and TGI Fridays. It is not walking distance to Universal, but the shuttle works fine if you don't mind a few stops. If returning to this area, we would most likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Night's Sleep! Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: pensare33
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night while on our way to Sarasota. Check - in was very fast. We had a room on the fourth floor. The room was clean and appeared to be well maintained. I must say the bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept on. The mattress was very similar to a Tempur-pedic. The halls were quiet at night and I slept great! The breakfast buffet in the morning was excellent. Great variety, very clean, and well stocked. I would defintely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: GermanyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I had selected this hotel because it was ranked #1 in Orlando. Overall experience was OK, but calling this the most desirable hotel in Orlando is certainly stretching things. Service is very friendly and efficient. The rooms are quite old but clean and comfortable. Breakfast selection is OK and the breakfast area is reasonably sized unless it is occupied by a large group of British hooligans (our first morning) or teenage school orchestras (our second morning) who otherwise specialize in running along the hallways, screaming their lungs out. Location is convenient particularly to Universal, though walking isn't really an option.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with fautless staff”
Reviews.Author: manda1970
Reviews.Content: Fairfield is in an excellent location - you are near to everything with a choice of driving routes to avoid the traffic. Its quiet there too. Very close to both TGI Fridays and Chillis - both easily within walking distance. The staff are the friendliest, most helpful people I think I have met. Nothing was too much trouble and never a frown! My sister in law rang the hotel whilst we were on holiday and they agreed to go to Publix and get us an anniversary cake and balloon - when we got in from the park there was the cake, balloon and a card from my sister in law and husband. They also booked a dinner reservation for us for our anniversary meal (at our request). We had the twin double room with the rollaway bed - which is a permament camp bed style, very comfortable. Hotel under going refurb, but never interfered with our enjoyment of the place. There is a small shop. They have vending machines (ideal place to get rid of your change!) on every floor plus ice machines too. There is a small gym, nice pool area with hot tub and loads of clean towels. Breakfast is all you can eat, sometimes it got a little busy, and they didnt have everything available on every day, but considering the price of the hotel the choice and quality are very good. 24 hour tea and coffee was often used! PC in the lobby was really useful for emailing home and checking my credit card balance! There was a printer too if you needed it. Used the complimentary deposit box to keep valuables in. We held the key. The rooms very very clean, I was impressed with the standard for the star rating it has. Bathroom was spotless. I liked the half height bath - the shower was wonderful, but the half bath was great for our youngest daughter. Plenty of towels - always spotlessly clean! Hairdryer provided was adequate, and the iron and board came in handy as did the laundry room, which was cheap too - saved us buying clothes we didnt really need. No complaints and nothing but praise for this hotel, we would love to go back, but have decided that 5 of us in one room is just too much so we will be looking for a 2 bed suite in future. Thats the only reason we wouldnt go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: mmd13233
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairfield Inn over Memorial Day weekend. We boooked using the Orlando Magic Card and received a very nice discount on a King Suite. Check in was quick. Maybe took 3 minutes! The breakfast had plenty of items to choose from. Bagels, pastries, muffins, yogurt, fresh fruit, oatmeal, waffles, breakfast sandwiches, cereal, milk, juices etc. Everything was well stocked and workers were constantly refilling items and wiping tables. The breakfast area was very crowded and tables were full so we had to eat on the lanai. It was covered and had fans blowing so it wasn't a problem. The room was clean and it was nice having two TVs so the children could watch what they wanted and we could watch what we wanted. Microwave and fridge in room was very handy for storing and reheating leftovers from restaurants. There was a group of teens and a boy scout troop staying at the hotel and we never heard them while in our room. The only negative was that the pool is heated and it got overheated (it was as hot as the spa) so I asked the front desk if we could go down the street to the Residence Inn and use that pool and they said "no problem" and we were off. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFun3
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be very clean and quiet, and the hotel staff was always helpful and friendly. The only thing I didn't like was that the curtains that would have blocked out all of the light didn't cover much of the window. That's my only complaint. The shuttle service was great and the breakfast buffet was more than adequate with plenty of choices and it being constantly replenished.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: loopysilvette
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through the Universal website for a great price and reviewed it over and over again on this site, and the reviews were not wrong. The best hotel for service, cleanliness and general atmosphere I have ever stayed in. We even took a shortcut through a small grass field and we were on International drive within two minutes!! So location was perfect! Rooms were great, we had a standard room with two double beds and plenty of storage space. Beds were so comfortable! Breakfast always had plenty of food and a good choice. The front desk staff are top dollar, so friendly with good tips and advice all the time. Swimming pool was small but always warm and the jaccuzi was lovely, open late too so great for relaxing after a long day at the parks!! Shuttle was great, the last stop before universal and sea world/aquatica so you would arrive within minutes! The hotel lobby is being re-decorated at the minute but with no disruption to guests and I just know it will be beautiful when finished. I will be, without a doubt, staying at this hotel on future holidays to Orlando. This hotel has everything to offer at a great price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: cabbagepk
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice hotel. We usually stay somewhere else on International dr, but they were full, so we tried this. Everything worked, the staff was very friendly and didn't hesitate to help. The continental breakfast had a nice assortment and was being watched over to make sure items were refilled. We definitely will stay here again. It is close to Universal and Sea world. The pool and hot tub were refreshing and there is a 'snack store'.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: awilliams11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week through a Virgin fly drive holiday and couldn't have had a better location. You have all the convenience of International Drive, but none of the noise! In fact, you can avoid driving along much of I Drive by using Universal Blvd instead, and avoid traffic jams - its a great way to get to Universal Studios and Sea World for example. We had a suite, which was great - spacious, very clean with quality towels and bedlinen. There was also a fridge, microwave and coffee/tea maker. Breakfast was good, with a lot of choice, but could get very crowded. It was good to have tea/coffee/chocolate available at all times. Also, a computer with internet access was available for guests to use free of charge in the lobby. I liked the pool area, as the sunbeds are free, towels are provided, and I enjoyed a swim. If we return to Orlando, we wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: girlsinnyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at this hotel while visiting Sea World. Most impressed with the customer service at the front desk, I don't think check in took more than 2 minutes. The rooms were clean and just as described. Breakfast was good but crowded at times. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: daylate
Reviews.Content: Us and another couple stayed here for two nights while visiting Disney World. What a Great Place to stay. We were close to all attractions. The building was in nice shape the rooms were very clean and the front desk was helpful and freindly. There is a pool and contineal breakfast. This is a large hotel with alot of rooms. We booked on line and felt we had a great place for the price and it was less that other lodging in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: shatoo07661
Reviews.Content: My family and I would like to thank everyone who wrote reviews for this hotel. We read the reviews and decided to give this place a shot and it was everything we expected it to be. The room and bathroom were very clean. The bed and pillows were very comfortable so we had five nights of good rest. Hotel was very quiet yet close to every thing! We enjoyed dining at the wide array of restaurants in the area. I would recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly and would Recommend to all”
Reviews.Author: ellerbys1
Reviews.Content: I would just like to confirm the comments from previous reviewers. We (2 Adults 2 kids (12, 7) stayed at this hotel for twenty nights from the 29th March, during this time the hotel was always clean and the staff friendly and able to help with all our requests. During our stay we had a number of school parties staying for a few days as their bands play at Universal as part of parades, but I can say that there was no extra noise and the teenagers where always polite and not rowdy. Breakfast had a good variety of foods from Cereal to Muffins and even a microwavable bacon/egg /cheese sandwich. Hot Drinks are avaliable at all times of day. The swimming pool was good with towels avaliable all day, we even took these to the water parks with us and then just put them in the dirty bin on our return. We had a standard room with a rollaway bed although this made things a ittle tight at night it was better for us as our children are a boy and girl, but stands up during daytime taking up little space. New soap, shampoo and conditioners where left every day (Pantene) so no need to take own. I ride trolley has many stops near hotel on International drive, we did not use shuttle buses as we had own car most of holiday but used trolley to go to Seaworld to save on parking charges, we had no or little wait at either end of day. I would recommend this hotel to all travellers as it was a haven away from the parks, but close enough to be able to enjoy a full day at Universal/Seaworld or Disney. Drive to Disney was incredibly easy from this location took us about 15 min to reach all Disney Parks

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: superdnm
Reviews.Content: I registered on Trip Advisor so I can tell everyone what a great experience I had in this hotel. The rooms were very clean and spacious. The staff was friendly and went above and beyond their duties. The lead man at the front desk, Jose took it upon himself to help us with an issue we had with a pizza delivery company. This type of service shows caring and compassion for their guests. Beds are comfortable and the pillows were nice and fluffy!!!! :) Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at a clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: GaFamilyFun_4
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 (2 kids ages 11 and 5) just returned from the Fairfield hotel. I had read the positive reviews regarding this place, but was still pleasantly surprised at how clean it actually was. We arrived at around 1 pm and had no problems checking in. The bathroom was immaculate and the sheets were changed daily. I didn't see one stain on the carpet! My only complaint is that there is a daily $10 charge for a refrigerator. We just filled our cooler with ice every evening before bed. There is a small pool in the back of the hotel, but by the time we returned from the parks in the evening, it was too chilly for us. We did cave once and allowed the girls to take a dip. I was cold and I didn't even get in the water! Universal and other parks are practically around the corner. There is also free shuttle service which we only utilized during the last day of our stay. Probably would not have used it again since we sat in traffic for about 20 minutes on the way back to the hotel which was normally about at 7 minute ride. At least we saved $11 in parking fees that day. All staff members were very pleasant. We would definately stay there again and probably will same time next year!

Reviews.Title: “Nice overall stay”
Reviews.Author: Einsteinlips
Reviews.Content: I used TripAdvisor to decide on this hotel and it wasn't a disappointment. Everything was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. The free breakfast was more than I expected with many choices and a large eating area. I wished the regular suite had a door to the king area, but it didn't. That wasn't that bad, but just saying. The only thing I would recommend against is the shuttle. It took 30 min to go to and from Universal, and it's only 3 miles away. Just drive yourself and spring for the parking. It's $11.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic second visit to the Fairfield Inn”
Reviews.Author: Muttley67
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for the second time during Thanksgiving 2007 and found the service to be just a good as the first time. Staff are polite, friendly and always happy to assist. The accommodation was clean and had all of the facilities you would require, except a bar. Continental breakfast was more than adequate, however if you want a full breakfast there are plenty of "all you can eat" buffets in the area for very little money. The hotel desk can organise Park tickets and day trips to most other attractions, such as Kennedy Space Centre, Gatorland etc We did not use the hotel's complementary shuttle service to Universal and Seaworld, instead opting to use the I-Ride to get up and down International Drive to the Outlet Malls, Seaworld etc and the local Lynx bus services departing from outside Fish Bones Restaurant that takes you to Universal in your own time for $1.50. The hotel also advertise a return transfer to Disney (I think it was $30 per person), although you can again get the Lynx local bus from outside Seaworld for $1.50. Also highly recommended is Chilis restaurant which is within 5mins walk. Excellent food at reasonable prices - far betterthan the appalling service we received at TGI fridays and Pizza hut in the same vacinity.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and great price !”
Reviews.Author: LucyFamily
Reviews.Content: We reserved the Fairfield inn for spring break via the Universal vacations website. We had a very good price wich include the hotel and Universal tickets. The hotel was very clean, friendly and very quiet, even during the Spring break. We had a standard room wich was well appointed and big enough for the 3 of us. The beds were not the most comfortable but it was ok. We liked the free wireless Internet connection in our room. The breakfast was good, but no waffle like some other hotels. After 7:30, the breakfast area was very crowed and it was hard to access food without bumping in each other. The location was ideal and the highway I-4 was very easy to access. It was a short drive to Universal and Seaworld (ask for the coupon book at the front desk. Free upgrade parking and other discounts). We even went to Busch Gardens in Tampa, wich is 1h15 from the hotel via the I-4. We would stay again at the Fairfield Inn Internation Drive for the location, the tranquility and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, Nice Facilties, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AlexMarc77
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel thru Unviersal Vacations as part of package deal for hotel and park tickets and is one of the best deals I've ever had.... The hotel is minutes away from Universal and you can walk to the shops and restaraunts along International Drive. Parking was very easy and the hotel is well maintained and quiet. Our room was the standard one which we had for three nights and we were even able to check in earlier than planned. Breakfast in the morning was good and the staff was very friendly with tips and directions of thing to do. I would diffently stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excwllent value for money”
Reviews.Author: ladtholiday
Reviews.Content: our family of 4 (children 16 and 11) stayed in this hotel for a 3 week holiday. on arrival the reception staff were very friendly and helpful and we were given a welcome pack containing some mini toiletries and special offer coupons for restuarants and attractions in the area. our room was very nice with 2 large very comfortable double beds. we had no problems with our maid service as i had read in some reports b4 we went. we took advantage of the free safety deposit box in the reception area so you knew all our important documents, tickets and money etc was safe. we enjoyed the free breakfast every morning. it was always well stocked with fresh fruit, cereals, breads and lovely coffee and fruit juices, just what you need to get started in the morning. we always managed to get a table although it is much busier over the weekends. we had hired a car but the did have shuttle bus services from the hotel to all the major theme parks and it was only a 2 minute walk to international drive which was great if you fancied going out in the night without having to take the car. i would definately recommend this hotel to people of all ages.my only complaint (if you could call it a complaint) is that the pool is at the back of the hotel and is in the shade all day so you cant really lie in the sun if you want a relaxing day. on the other hand you are only a 10 minute walk from wet and wild.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: SFA10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two weeks while visiting the Orlando theme parks. The hotel is situated on a quiet side-street off International Drive. It's within 5 or 10 minutes walk of a large number of restaurants, shops and I-Trolley stops for access to the rest of International Drive and Seaworld. Free shuttle buses also run from the hotel to the Universal parks. Disney is about a 20 to 30 minute drive. We stayed in a suite room, which was very spacious, well-equipped and comfortable. The maids did an excellent job - our room was cleaned daily and was always spotlessly clean. One minor downside of the room was that the king-sized bed had a foam mattress, so was not the most comfortable hotel bed we've slept in! The hotel also offers a free continental buffet breakfast with a very large selection of items to choose from. We could have chosen a different combination of items for breakfast on every morning of our two week stay! Although breakfast runs until 10am, we found that it was best to head down before 7:30 to avoid the crowds. The hotel also has a pool, reasonably-stocked shop, slightly-dated games room and cheap laundry facilities ($2.50 in total for detergent, one wash and dry). We read reviews about the friendliness and helpfulness of the hotel staff before our stay - and they are very true!! All of the staff could not do more to help, and made us feel very welcome even when they were busy. We would highly recommend this hotel for visits to the Orlando area. It is significantly better than many other more-expensive hotels we've stayed in around the world!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: sj0hns0n
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel to stay for a few nights while seeing Universal Studios. I had researched TripAdvisor and the reviews did not let me down. The standard room with two queens was very clean and spacious. Comfortable beds, not the highest quality hotel bed I've experienced, but above adequate. The staff were all VERY friendly and helped out with any questions we had. They also let us store our luggage for half a day after we checked out, free of charge. The staff really were wonderful. I was wary of what the 'continental' breakfast would be - but I was pleasantly surprised. Eggs, toast, bagels, muffins, cereal, juice, milk, yogurt, pastries, and fresh fruit. The hotel pool was quite large - larger than expected. As this hotel is the last stop en route to Universal the free shuttle takes only 10 minutes door to door. I-Drive is a short walk and has plenty of restaurants, familiar chains (McDonalds, Chilis, TGI Fridays if that is what you like) but I also found some wonderful and interesting places to eat (try the Hanamizuki Japanese restaurant next to Goodings supermarket).

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: 21-Taylor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 4 nights earlier this month, and could not get a good night's sleep any night. We had long and busy days, so you would think after that we would easily fall asleep. However, we just could not get comfortable in the bed. Other than the uncomfortable bed, the staff at the hotel were all very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet had plenty of food, but did not offer the same variety that we are accustomed to at Fairfield Hotels (no waffles or oatmeal).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Soon2BEmptyNester
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple were in Orlando for a trade show. We were originally booked at the Quality Inn Plaza, but I changed due to the poor reviews it got on this site. We definitely picked a winner! (My husband ran into a friend who was staying the the Q.I. Plaza and said it was a dump.) ALL the staff at the Fairfield were so friendly and helpful, the place was super clean, AND it was very quiet. There were lots of people there, businessmen, families, etc.. but you didn't hear any noise in your room. The beds were extremely comfortable too. Nice pool and breakfast area . Good assortment of food items to choose from and prices of soft drinks in vending machines were only $1.25! We just had a standard room, no refrigerator or microwave or anything, but that was OK as we didn't need them. This hotel is not right on International Drive, it is a block west, and to get to I-drive on a sidewalk, you have to walk about 3 blocks, or you can go straight across a vacant lot and cross a ditch on a pile of concrete rocks and wire. We did not visit any of the parks and got around everywhere we wanted to go on the I-Trolley. The hotel even gave us free trolley passes, so it didn't cost us anything for transportation to get up and down I drive and to the convention center. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, I love Fairfield!”
Reviews.Author: Kschuma5
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Fairfield. The first was Fairfield Inn & Suites Orlando Lake Buena Vista in the Marriott Village. Anyways, we arrived early and our room was ready. We had the option to go on the first floor or a different level. With my prior experience last year being the furthest away from the lobby, we chose the ground floor. Our room was as pictured and described, very clean and very quiet. The breakfast in the morning was until 10 am, which with my experiance is later then usual. For breakfast there were 4 different coffees, many popular kid and healthy cereals, bagels, coffee cakes, fruit, toast, name brand yogurts and jimmy dean bacon egg and cheese biscuits. The Hotel also had a nice fun arcade, and a store that had pepsi products, medicine, slim fast, bathroom products and nic-naks. We didn't go in the pool, but we went to check it out. It is fairly large and looked very clean. It has a nice deck where you can spend all day on relaxing in the sun or in the shade. The only thing that my boyfriend didn't like is that it didn't get freezing cold. We weren't going to call down at midnight for help, so it was uncomfortable for him- not for me though. It was literally 5 minutes away from Universal, there is a lot of restaurants near by and pirate dinner behind the hotel. Very nice location!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: OntarioBusy_Mom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairfield in Orlando over Christmas, and we were very pleased with our hotel room. We had a king suite, as we have 3 children. It was a bit cramped, but much better than a regular room, and we didn't spend a great deal of time there anyway. The kids liked it that there were 2 T.V.'s in the room so they could watch what they wanted. Everything was clean, lots of towels, shampoo, etc., which is sometimes a problem when there are 5 of us! The pool was great as well. Breakfast was good - make your own - good variety of food. We would definitely go back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Liked it a lot!”
Reviews.Author: RTP_7
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed staying here. Had king room suite with a large seating area. Location was great for Universal, other theme parks, restaurants, and nightlife. Pool was nice and staff was excellent. All in all, well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: RIEL01
Reviews.Content: As always, this Marriott is great. Good breakfast, big clean room, good service, the best heathed pool!!!!! We we're here because we went to Disney for new years eve. And we always come back to Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at The Fairfield Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Abby411
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from a little trip to Orlando, I booked the whole trip on the Universal Studios website, very easy and conveniant, paid one price for tickets, room and round trip ground transportation. The Fairfield was more than I expected for the price, the staff was so helpful and friendly they asssisted us from everything from giving us free trolley passes and calling us a taxi, to letting us use there rec room even after we had checked out while we waited for our driver to pick us up. The room was a nice size and the beds and pillows were so comfy! also nice and clean.They had a nice selection from there contential breakfast and I will definitly be returning there again when we go back next time. I highly recommend this hotel its great service for a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Freindly staff,clean and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: HeathersDad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great ! From check in to check out the desk staff treated us like freinds, they always made a point to say hello or have a great day and made a special point to chat to my 7 year old daughter and make her feel like a special guest . We had a suite which was clean with a fridge, microwave and pull out bed for my daughter which was sittuated just around the corner from the comfy king size bed which grants you some privacy which you dont get in most hotel rooms. We used the pool and spa most afternoons after returning from a day out and it was mostly deserted with plenty of towels and was very clean.We also used the games room which was 50 cents for most games in there which on the whole were well maintained. The laundry room in the hotel is so cheap for those small holiday washes, $1 a wash $1 to dry and the powder is available in the small hotel shop and at 50 cents a packet is also good value. Breakfast is a buffet and is in with the price with a good choice and wasnt too busy between 8 and 9 which is the time we used it most days. There is no other food available in the hotel but you can order food in and your only a 5 min walk from I drive where choice is a plenty.There is no bar in the hotel if you would like a quiet drink of an evening but the fridge keeps beer cold at the end of the day and Im sure the hotels close by wouldnt mind you having a drink there. If we go to Orlando and stay in a hotel this will be my first choice,its great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!! Great value too.”
Reviews.Author: BlueJayAlum
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. We had a suite - they're not huge but very comfortable for a couple or small family. Very CLEAN, very FRIENDLY and helpful staff! Great location. We booked this thru the Sea World website & loved it - would stay again. Great continental breakfast, child-friendly & great location to the parks & everything you could want on Int'l Drive. The photos on this site are not up to date - the rooms & beds are really much better than pictured. New, updated beds w/ down pillows & European linens - nice touch. You cannot beat the value here, this place has it all for a GREAT PRICE! :-) If you look this up on the Marriott website you will see acurate photos of the suites & rooms. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Arild
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairfield for 4 nights in early november, and it was great. Loved the spacious room, great bathroom and delicious breakfast. The front desk staff was also very polite and helpful. The hotel was spot on for our needs, and at $99 / night it is hard to beat in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, clean place to stay near Sea World and Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Downfall
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter for a little getaway. The hotel had an interesting mix of guests - tourists both domestic and international and business people. The rooms were very clean with updated European-style cotton bedding you would find in an upscale hotel (and I did see similar bedding at the Rosen Shingle Creek in Orlando recently). Not as good bedding, but a good imitation. Our air conditioner was malfunctioning. We called the front desk and within a few minutes several maintenance people came to our room and began dismantling our air conditioner and replacing it with a new one. We rented a car for our stay. We found the parking easy and convenient. The hotel is a nice size, and the location is fairly quiet, but within an easy drive of all amenities and attractions. We did not try the shuttle service to Sea World and Universal Studion, but it was an option. Disney World shuttles were available for a fee. Smoking was not allowed in the hotel, or on the patio outside, but some guests did smoke outside. It made it very unpleasant to sit outside and be downwind of cigarette smoke. The pool and the hot tub were very nice. The continental breakfast was very extensive and included hard-boiled eggs, yogurt, breakfast sandwiches, pastry, fresh fruit, coffee, juices, bagels, toast, cereal, etc. Breakfast was usually very busy, but still it worked well, and the attendants were quick to replace any items that ran out. The front desk staff were very courteous and helpful. They even provided printed index cards with directions to popular destinations. Our room was near an outside door, so we did have a brief period of noise from other guests walking through the hall one night. Other than that, we felt safe and comfortable in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsthfc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel, and it was just as most reviews have said, a really nice, clean hotel to stay in. Very convenient location. Staff very friendly and nothing is too much trouble. A bonus getting such a nice breakfast, never had trouble getting a table, although some times are busier than others. Didnt use the pool, but noticed some kids were still in it 9.30 at night!! Would def. recommend this hotel,and use it again. Only drawback was no safe in room, but did have deposit boxes in reception. We had a suite even tho' there was just the two of us, and it was really lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Suite”
Reviews.Author: StarfishandSeashells
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a Florida residents Halloween Horror Nights package. We are a family of five and stayed in a king suite. It was a nice sized room with two big televisions, a big boom box, a microwave, and a fridge. There was Pantene shampoo and conditioner, but no lotion or other extras. The bathroom was large and the sink was outside the bathroom, which is helpful to us. The linens on the king bed were extra nice - a down comforter, nice sheets, and good pillows. My main complaint were the linens for the pull-out sofa bed. The blanket, which was folded up in a plastic bag with the sheets, had many hairs on it. EWWWWW! I could understand one or maybe two, but this blanket had not been laundered in a while!!! We called and requested another one, but they had no more and only brought us extra sheets. There was a large area for the free breakfast, but way too many people. We decided to go to the IHOP instead.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: beetlegal
Reviews.Content: Booked our holiday through Virgin and chose the Fairfield Inn after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. The hotel is located just off International Drive in a very quiet location. The hotel is clean and modern. We stayed in a standard room which was spacious, clean and modern. The breakfast was really good and we only ate breakfast elsewhere on 1 day of our holiday. The pool was clean and very quiet (just beware of the whirlpool it's roasting). The laundry facilities were good. The vending machines were cheap (drinks the same price as you would pay at Walmart). Ideally located for Universal and Seaworld and only a short drive to Disney World. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel staff were great,couldnt do enough to help.”
Reviews.Author: pmac593
Reviews.Content: Well i was doing what your now and i cant rate this hotel highly enough everything was great,staff breakfast clean and tidy rooms and comfy beds...always a plus after miles walking round parks.The only down side for me was the pool at weekends i was on 5th floor and it was still noisy but never lasted pasted 11.30 ish..They have food courts on site choice of 4 but price wise you may as well walk 30 secs across car park and use golden corral..for 2 adults 2 kids eat everything..and it was good it was $40 about Â£20 quid and it was worth every penny.Tried on site food but very expensive..but did a great full pound beef burger it was huge..lo,im back again next year and im not even looking at other hotels this is the one for everyone...unless ur not driving then universal is sort it out urself ..but disney we got free bus there and back.a++..

Reviews.Title: “robbed!”
Reviews.Author: natashalito
Reviews.Content: memorial weekend was a busy week in orlando and it was one of the only places to stay. The next morning while I was at breakfast in the lobby of the hotel. I came up to my room where my brand new notebook pc was left and found it had disappeared from my room. My two children, my husband and I were very nervous about who could have entered our room. When the reports were made to the local police and management of the hotel, the hotel had no sympathy nor answers. The box on our door for the records of who was in and out of the room was conveniently broken and no records of who had access. The video camera recording was of no help either and it was not researched. MY children , husband and I were escorted out by the management as I warned other guests to watch there things and lock them up. I was treated as if I was the criminal and treated very rudley for such a traumatic incident my family and I had to indure. Thankfully, the crime was not worse then that and my family is safe!

Reviews.Title: “excellent (for the third time)”
Reviews.Author: LancashireTeacher
Reviews.Content: Have just returned after staying for the third time at this hotel. I am fussy, but could not fault this place. The staff are polite, knowledgeable and helpful. The rooms and corridors are spotless. The beds are spacious and comfortable. The pool is clean; there are plenty of loungers and clean towels. The breakfast is basic continental but plentiful . Shampoo/conditioner in rooms is good quality (pantene). Location is midway down International Drive so it is easy to get around whether you have a car or not. TGI Fridays right opposite and Chilli's, Sizzler etc very close by. Laundry room available for only a dollar each to wash and dry. Even the vending machines for soft drinks and snacks were very reasonable. A bottle of Pepsi from the machine cost me less than it did in the local drug store. Absolutely excellent value for money overall. Only suggestion for improvement is the need for free internet access: Although there is a computer for public use, you do have to pay and it is not cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: bones17
Reviews.Content: We booked this thru Universal Vacations for a quick weekend away and were pleasantly surprised how efficient everything was. The hotel was clean and comfortable and you can't beat having inside corridors; nice and quiet. The hotel staff was very friendly, answered all our questions and even took time to chat when they were not busy. The included breakfast had just about anything you would require to get you started, including fruit, cereal and sausage and egg sandwiches. Free shuttles to Universal Park left at 8:20, 8:45, 10:00, 10:25 and 11:25 a.m. and returned at 4:55, 6:40 and 8:00 p.m. when the park closed. I understand that the number of runs and frequency depend on the time of year. The only reason that I do not rate the hotel excellent is because they charge to use the computer located in the lobby; this is a big minus when your attempting to print boarding passes before you get to the airport. Fairfield is part of the Marriott chain and even though I am an Marriot Rewards member I would have still had to pay to use the computer. I believe that reward members should have the privilege of free use of the computer. On a weekend trip I don't bring my own computer. I liked the hotel and staff, but I will not stay there again because if I'm flying Southwest Airlines I need to print my boarding passes 24 hours in advance or get stuck at the end of the line and if you like air sickness try flying in the rear of a plane.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location!!”
Reviews.Author: travelx4
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! We stayed here for four nights in July during our vacation to Universal Studios. The hotel was very clean and the front desk was friendly. The breakfast every morning was very nice. Our teenagers loved the pool every afternoon after the hot mornings in the park. We didn't use the shuttle service to the park. We drove there everyday and it took less that 10 minutes. It is about 15-20 minutes from DisneyWorld. I would stay here on our next trip to Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but terrible shuttle bus”
Reviews.Author: Smith626
Reviews.Content: My family and I just stayed at the Fairfield from June 21-21th 2007. We really loved the hotel ! I mean it was kept very clean, and everything was always restocked in your room. One of the things that I was impressed with was that the little shampoos that they leave in your room weren't some cheap no name brand, but was Pantene ! And let me tell you the beds are sooooo comfortable, infact my husband is still talking about them!! The staff was very friendly and as for the pool, it was very nice and was never very crowded. The breakfast was alright for being free and everything. There's alot of sugary items, but they also have toast, English muffins, oatmeal, yogurt, cereal,and even jimmy dean breakfast sandwiches. But out of all the things that I did like there was one thing that I thought could have been better, and that would be the shuttle bus that the hotel offers. Yea, they offer a shuttle, but that shuttle is also shared with a few other hotels in the area. It has like two departures in the morning and like two returns in the evening, but the thing with sharing the shuttle with the others is that it's first comes, first serves and by the time it gets to the Fairfield theres only a few seats left and people are trying to push their way to the front of the line so they can get the remaining seats. After the first day or two my family learned that it was much easier to take a taxi to the parks. It only cost between 5-7 dollars to get to the parks since they are so close to the hotel, plus you don't have to deal with the drama of the shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: madennis
Reviews.Content: The location is good and a good spread for breakfast.One big down point is the walls are so thin on weekends in may when the school kids stay it is very noisey. Also we found rooms near the lifts were very noisey with a pesky bing when it arrived on you're floor

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: americanv8
Reviews.Content: I've been visiting Florida pretty much every year since 1992 so i've stayed in the lions share of Orlando hotels, the Fairfield is hands down the best hotel i've stayed in. Its so clean, tidy & exceedingly friendly. The staff absolutely go out of their way to make you feel welcome, they always greet you as you come through the front doors & even the housekeeping are pleasant (which is very much against the norm). A special mention must go to Patrick on reception who is such an incredibly friendly guy. Its worth paying the extra for a suite which gives ample room, 2 TVs, a huge bed, sofa, fridge & microwave. We always goto Florida with a set amount of money to spend per day to cover breakfast & lunch then the credit card gets hammered for the evening meals, well thanks to the Fairfield our $ went that bit further, free breakfast every morning! It does get busy around 8 till 9 but we always found a table & everything is well stocked (If something runs out just ask the staff members and they'll get you it no problem). Cereals, Danish's, Muffins, Bagels, Bread, Tea, Coffee, Juice, Milk, basically the works. In the past its been Ponderosa buffet every day but not this time, the hotel breakfast was more than adequate which meant the credit card barely got used for meals. The onsite laundry was excellent & very cheap compared to other hotels, the laundry soap from the shop was only 50cents a box too which is outstanding! The onsite shop also had plastic cutlery available for zero charge just incase you brought your own food back to eat. It's also in a really handy location, 5 min walk to TGI Fridays, 30 second drive to Sandlake road, 2 mins and you're onto the I4 in either direction, much easier to get to off Universal Blvd & Carrier drive if you come off the I4, you dont get stuck in I Drive traffic! Overall best value, best customer service, best rooms, i really cant see us staying in any other hotel ever again in Orlando - i've found my holiday home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Clean and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jmargetts
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mid April starting Easter weekend and found the hotel to be absolutely wonderful. The staff at the front desk were all friendly and helpful especially one of the ladies who made a fuss of our 6 year old. We had a Kingsuite which was well worth having as you get a fridge and microwave. The room was lovely, it overlooked the swimming pool and the only thing I'd say is if you don't like hearing the screams and shouts of youths until it closes at 11pm then ask for a room on the opposite side. This didn't really affect us as most nights we didn't get back until 10 so didn't have to hear the noise for long. The provided breakfast was good, sometimes it got a bit crowded around 8am but when we went down earlier there was plenty of room. That said even when crowded we still got a table and the staff made sure everything was replenished well before it ran out. Various selection of sweet pastries, croissants, bagels, Bread and a toaster, lots of different cereals, yogurts,cold hard boiled eggs, Jim Dean egg & bacon biscuits that you self microwave, Tea, Coffee and fruit juices and when we stayed Banana's and oranges. Location wise its great for Universal/Wet n Wild - 5min drive and getting to the Disney Parks only took 15 mins. Overall a fantastic holiday and definately a hotel we'd consider going back to.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Awarely
Reviews.Content: The Fairfield Inn International Drive is a fine choice for families, business trips, or vacationers in general. It is half way between Disney and the airport. Room included an ironing board and iron, clock radio, hairdryer, coffee maker with supplies, and good cable tv. I did not try the pool. The self-serve breakfast was great, with frozen breakfast sandwiches to microwave, rolls and pastries, fruit, cereal, coffee, etc. The only down side is that the building lacks any view to speak of since it is tucked away on a commercial roadway with other hotels. However, the beauty of central Florida is only a short drive away. Very satisfied. Coming from the airport, you might miss the turn for the Fairfield so look for the Residence Inn by Marriott and turn there, and you will see the very small sign for Canada Drive on the right. The Fairfield is only 1/5 mile down the road on the right.

Reviews.Title: “Fairfield Inn & Suites Orlando International Drive, IS A MUST!!!”
Reviews.Author: ALWAYS_JULES
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is by far the best hotel we have stayed at in Orlando and this was our 6th visit to the sunshine state. The Fairfield Inn is an immaculately clean hotel with the most helpful and friendly staff. We stayed in a suite which was very good value for money and well worth the upgrade. The bed was extremely comfortable and is super kingsize (uk sizing) My 10 year old son found the sofa bed very comfortable too. The maid cleaned our room very well every day, after a busy day at the parks we always returned to a spotlessly clean room and bathroom. The hotel is in the perfect location just off of the International Drive down a very quite road. There are plenty of places to eat at. We found TGI Fridays very good and only a 2 minutes walk from the hotel, and Sizzlers is also very good value for money with wonderful food and a fantastic salad/starters bare which is all you can eat. You really do need to go there, especially if you enjoy a good steak! We found this one the cheapest places to eat as well as the perfect steaks. I would avoid booking the Pirates dinner show which is also a 2 minute walk from Fairfield Inn. Its a total waste of money, the actual show itself is ok, but the food was awful and not worth the money. I would recommend the Fairfield Inn to my family and friends and we will most definatly be returning there. We had a fantastic holdiay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: mum2em1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks from 9.4.07 - 23.4.07. We booked through Virgin holidays. This hotel exceeded our expectations on all levels. Firstly the hotels location was great 1 block from I-drive 2 mins walk from restaurants and also on a very quiet road. The staff were great very friendly only problem we encountered with staff was the very pushy lady from Marriott vacations who hovers in the lobby & wanted us to attend a 90 min presentation on time share. It was only after being very firm with her that she left us alone. The rooms were great we had a king suite so our daughter could sleep on the sofa bed. Lovely bathroom and spotlessly clean the maid worked really hard. The daily continental breakfast was great although very busy every morning. This was good for getting to the parks early. The pool was clean and had pelnty of sun beds and if the clean towels run out just let the desk know and they were replaced straight away. For evening meals would recommend TGI at end of road, Wild Jacks on I-Drive,Ponderossa,Chillis. If you want a bit more expensive meal Fishbones is good but beware of extremely large portions!! Avoid Salt Island on I-Drive very very expensive and food no better than anywhere else, also the only place where we had bad service and were expected to leave 20% tip! 5 mins to universal,wet & wild. 15 mins to all disney. Loved the hotel loved USA!! We will definately stay here again fantastic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nptinsman
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service from check-in to check-out. Room was very clean. Location was very quite, but central. Easy to get to Disney and other locations. Good selection of restaurants nearby. Would be my first choice for my next visit to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Cleaniest Hotel”
Reviews.Author: R0chelleG
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with this hotel because it was VERY CLEAN and that's extremely important to us. The staff was also friendly and helpful. If we were going back to the Orlando area,this hotel would be our choice. We went to the Boston Lobster Feast on International Drive. We paid $34.95 per person and the lobster was rubbery and hard. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Families. One Problem, Though.”
Reviews.Author: dlostyle77
