Reviews.Content: This is a great place to bring a family for a trip to Universal. They have a free shuttle to Universal, if you don't mind leaving at one of four set times in the morning, and coming back at one of three set times in the afternoon. The complimentary breakfast is decent enough, typical continental stuff. The room was in perfect condition. No complaints there. The only problem I had was with one of the housekeeping women. First, she is in the middle of the hallway blocking traffic, yapping loudly with her fellow worker about how "I can't stand these b****** that work here." On top of that, she makes an insensitive remark toward me right in front of my son. She did this two days in a row, mind you. The first day, I laughed it off. I have a sense of humor. The second day, however, I informed the front desk of her remarks. I believe it was dealt with swiftly because as I was eating my breakfast, I heard her say, "I'm going right now." I don't know what they did, but I believe she was reprimanded. Other than that one employee, the staff was fine, smiling and greeting us upon entering and exiting. I would definitely return if the price is still reasonable. The adventurous types can even walk to Universal. Wet N Wild is even closer. Restaurants in walking distance. Can't ask for much more. (Except maybe a Disney shuttle as well!)

Reviews.Title: “The Best - Clean, Close & Comfie”
Reviews.Author: dlt1
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Fairfield Inn & Suites International Cove. We stayed there March 9-12 for the last 3 nights of a two-week trip to Florida and it was the best (and cheapest) of the 5 hotels we stayed at (including a huge resort hotel in Orlando at 3x the price). It was VERY CLEAN, within easy (and safe) walking distance to the restaurants on International Drive, and had a very comfortable, FAMILY-ORIENTED atmosphere. Plus, it offered an EXCELLENT complimentary BREAKFAST with everything from juice/coffee/tea, cereal, fruit, yoghurt, boiled eggs, bagels and assorted pastries. The king-sized BED was one of the MOST COMFORTABLE I've ever slept in and the room was large, bright and very quiet. We heard a young baby crying for a few moments in the room next door one morning, but that was all despite the fact that there were numerous children and teenagers in the hotel. We did not use all of the services offered -- e.g., outdoor pool, on-site concierge for tickets to SeaWorld, etc. -- but were impressed with the facilities as well as the friendliness and efficiency of the staff from the front desk to the room cleaners. You cannot go wrong choosing this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great time and location”
Reviews.Author: shannonws
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel from trip advisor and did a lot of comparing of hotels. This hotel was great. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel was very clean. We were traveling with 2 children and they loved the breakfast and the heated pool. The area was very safe and close to a lot of neat shopping and restaurants. Very close to Wet n Wild, Universal. Only 10-15 minutes from Disney World. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: bjstirling
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairfield when we flew into Orlando for a visit to Florida. We only stayed a few days but it was everything we expected. It has a great location, away from the noise of I-4 and International Dr. Still, it's close to either and easy to get to from the airport. The hotel was clean and quiet for our visit. The pool was quite warm (the kids found it kind of hot) and not crowded. Staff were wonderful whenever we had cause to interact with them. We've stayed at several other hotels in the Int'l Dr area and when I'm back in the area again the Fairfield will be my first call.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TallyTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Fairfield was a wonderful surprise! Nice, clean room and bathroom, very comfortable beds, great continental breakfast and kind and helpful staff! We stayed in late January for a $89 rate, at least $20 less than Holiday Inn and the likes. It's right off International Drive so it's near everything but is nice and quiet. Loved it, and will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fifth visit and still just as good”
Reviews.Author: Essexgirl2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel when it was only a few months old and we have been back 5 times(all the way from the UK) It is still just like a new hotel! The standards are very high.Each year we have found that an improvement has been made (ie;new drapes,new mattresses etc.) The staff are friendly and courteous. Many of the staff,icluding breakfast and maid service have been there from the start which shows that they run a "happy ship". The breakfast is a very good continental style with plenty of choice.They have good coffee.The rooms are large,light and airy.The pool and hot tub are very clean. This is now a totallly NON SMOKING environment, even outside! It is just off of I Drive so you can walk anywhere to eat. We cannot fault this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: lureynolds
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights during December. This is a nice, very clean, no frills hotel. We reserved a suite which was a perfect size for a family of 4. While there is no door separating the two rooms, you do get a couch and chair, two TVs and a table. It was nice to have a "Living Room" to relax in versus sitting on the bed watching TV at night. The hotel is extremely convenient to Universal, Islands of Adventure and Sea World. It was not terribly far from Disney either. A good choice if you are doing all the parks. The breakfast was suprisingly good and included the usual bagels, muffins etc., but also boiled eggs and jimmy dean sausage biscuits, which was nice. There are many restaurants that are very convienient to the hotel and several, such as TGI Fridays, within walking distance. There is a great game room which my kids enjoyed in the evening. They also had a place where you could purchase chips, icecream, etc. Didn't really see the pool area as it was too cold when we were there. All in all, if you are looking for a clean, safe family hotel for a good price I would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: jimrad121
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter, 10, and I arrived Thanksgiving day and stay until Wed., Nov. 29. We had a suite which included a king bed and a queen sofa bed. The master bed was mostly separated from the the sitting room by a wall closet. The room was perfect for us . It included 2 televsion sets, a stereo system with remote, a microwave and refrigerator. Continental breakfast is included with standard fare. It was pretty appetizing. The pool area, was well kept and given that it was Thanksgiving week, but a bit chilly, strangely deserted! When we arrived, we were told the pool was heated , but a dunk of a foot in said differently! Water was freezing cold! Spa was a comfy 105! Whether it was broken or someone didn't turn the heater on, by Sunday the pool felt like it was in the 90's! So, we, especially being from Hamburg, NY, soaked up some sun, mostly by ourselves. We ventured to Universal one day (10 minutes away), Disney (20 minutes) and Seaworld(15 minutes), so this is very convenient to the theme parks. It is also less than a block from International Dr. and a block and a half from an I-4 interchange. We saw mostly business travelers, but there is no reason a family can't enjoy the clean, convenient setting.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Seaworld Packages”
Reviews.Author: momtravelswith3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first night in Orlando. We chose this hotel as we wanted to visit Seaworld and they offered a package with tickets and free shuttle service. This created a good value considering 1 day passes alone are $50/pp. The front desk agent was very kind and checked us in quickly. I had called ahead as we were arriving very late and wanted to be sure our room would not be given away, at this time I requested a roll-away be put into our room. The cot was there and ready when we got to the room. The shuttle service is only 1/day which I think would be better to have 2 departures and 2 returns for those who choose not to spend the full day at SeaWorld. We did not use the shuttle as we slept in due to late arrival. The breakfast was really good, with muffuns, danishes, bagels, yogurt, juices and microwavable egg biscuits. We did have some problems with our passes at Seworld, they were declined as 'barcode not found' this caused us to hold up the line and was a little upsetting. We were able to enter the park however after some discussion. I have emailed this concern to Marriott and they said they will pass the concern onto the hotel. The hotel stored luggage for the day for other members in our party and were very accomodating to any special requests. I would stay here again if there was a package special, but there are so many hotels to choose from in the I-Drive area that I would consider elsewhere if I found a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, solid lodging choice...”
Reviews.Author: RueStPeter718
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night before checking in on Disney property. I try to base my 'bubble' ratings upon expectations when booking a property vs. actual experience. It's not the Ritz, but for the going rates, you really can't beat the amenities and service. Our room was ready upon arrival, and our floor/level request met. The room seemed VERY clean compared with so many in Orlando. Our only complaint might be the carpet in the corridors themselves needed to be replaced. But this is Orlando, and they no doubt take a beating. I'd much prefer the carpet in my ROOM be nice..and it was! Breakfast was plenty and well stocked. OJ ran out as I was pouring, and the fellas working were right on it. Breakfast was early, but that didn't bother us--we're early risers. I also suspect this might help keep some of the crowds down. We grabbed ours and headed back to the room. The game room is pretty nice for a lodging of this rating/size! Also liked the idea of the 'terrace' seating between the pool and breakfast area. The workout room...well, it's nice they even offer one. There were towels supplied and a TV, and I believe a water fountain (believe it or not, I was in a "4 Diamond" lodging in Vegas this summer with a gorgeous workout facitlity--but with NO water fountain...???). The equipment at the Fairfield consisted of 5 or 6 cardio machines. For me personally, I KNOW I'm gonna get my cardio in when I'm in Orlando. But again, it's a nice gesture. I put the room on the 'wrong' card (Marriott is running a point special with another). Front desk staff was quick to switch it out for me. Bill was under my door early the next morning, and CORRECT. Disney still ties your bill to your door handle on the day of departure, which I find simply GOOFY (every pun intended) in this day and age of ID theft/concerns. Hotel is in a good/quiet, if somewhat removed, location. A right onto Sand Lake, and then a few minutes east to Universal or west to Disney. A note form a native Floridian (now transplanted to the bitter cold): I personally tend to skip any restaurant with a 'running digital ticker' on their sign. To me, it just screams 'tourist trap'. Such is Fish Bones, on the corner as you turn into the hotel. If you have a car, come out to Sand Lake and make a right. Go under I4 and keep traveling north for appx a mile or two (I believe it is in the 7300 block). On your left will be a place: BONE FISH. Not to be missed, full of locals; the food is wonderful, the atmosphere hip, and the prices beyond fair (about half of Fish Bones). Let me clarify: the food may be great at Fish Bones; I don't know. What I DO know is that the food IS fabulous at Bone Fish, and the prices ARE half that of Fish Bones. Some other nice dinner ideas: Vito's on I-Drive for steak, Cafe Tu Tu Tangos, I-Drive, for tapas (and cool atmosphere!), and The Flying Fish on Disney's Boardwalk. Bottom line, if you're in need of solid, clean, and reasonable lodgings, that are just a tad above basic, check out the Fairfield International. You really can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: kimir123
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 2 teenage sons and myself stayed here for a full week in July. We had a standard room which was pretty big. No matter what time of the day we left, we always came back to a clean room, with the beds made up and fresh towels. The breakfast was nice. Juice, rolls, muffins, fruit and some bacon and sausage biscuits to microwave. The front staff was so friendly!!! We took full advantage of the shuttle to Universal everday. My only complant was that when we used the pool at night, the pool towels were gone and we either had to use towels from our room or ask someone from the front desk if there were anymore towels. If you are looking to stay in Orlando, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at fairfield”
Reviews.Author: winnett01
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for 7 nights in a standard room, it was clean and tidy upon arrival and was kept this way the whole time we were there thanks to the polite cleaning staff. we never had any problems at all, the reception staff were polite and friendly and very helpfull. the location was perfect for us as it was just a couple of minutes walk from i-drive and the free shuttle to universal and seaworld was always on time. the free daily breakfast helped to save us a few dollars and set us up for hitting the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: JoJo114
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the fairfield Suites International Cove in July 2006. The hotel was quite, clean and within walking distance to resturants and shops. Nice big pool and hot tub area. Excellent breakfast buffet - one hot entree each day along with cereal, breads, juices, fruit etc. The only downside to this hotel was the excersie room - old equipment. Shuttle to Universal, Sea World etc.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Main Drag”
Reviews.Author: HornFan
Reviews.Content: Finding this hotel was a bit hard. We were glad it was off the main drag of International Blvd for that street is overcrowded at night with tourist. This is a upgraded Fairfield Inn where it had a large dining area, game room, and large pool. An manned information desk was present to help guide tourist to various destinations. We stayed in a suite so it had two TVs, small fridge and couch. A Pirate dinner show is located next to this hotel. Free breakfast is available. It was definitely a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended stay at the Fairfield Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overnight stay, I was impressed with my stay at the Fairfield Inn , hotel in a great location although Canada Ave. easy to miss on I- drive. Staff are courteous and very attentive during our stay. First impression of room was great , standard room was simple, attractive and larger than expected.Room had no stale odors,very clean with enough towels and linens. Bed and pillows was extremely comfortable, one of the best night sleep I've had in a hotel or anywhere else. Will definately stay at this hotel on my next trip to O-town!

Reviews.Title: “Goof Choice”
Reviews.Author: Carolynrose
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at the Fairfield Inn in Orlando, FL on Canada Ave. My room was a King Suite which had 2 televisions and a separate sitting area. The room was large, it looked recently refubished and the bed was firm and comfortable. Although the accommodations were plain, the bathroom, sitting room and bedroom were very clean. There was ample parking which was close to the reception area and elevators. The breakfast was very healthy which included yogurt, cereal, fruit, juice, bagels, and muffins. Canada Ave. is located 1 block south of International Drive. Its difficult to make a left turn off of Sand Lake Road. due to the traffic. The hotel is also accessible from Universal Dr. and Carrier St. Coming from the airport, you can bypass the freeway and Interantional Drive by taking McCoy Rd.(off of 528) to Sand Lake Road to Canada Ave. If driving you also pass the Florida Mall in route. This hotel is located close to the Universal Studios, several Walgreens, the Outlet Malls, and several fast food and nicer restaruants. On Sand Lake there is a Popeyes and a Chic-a-fil. There is also a Ruth Chris and a Roys. The Highway 4 is accessible from Sand Lake Road and leads West to the Disney theme parks and East to the Millenia Mall (4 exits). I was in Orlando for business and the Convention Center is located within 10 minutes by car on International Drive. The room rates are very affordable and the location is ideal. I would stay at this hotel again on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl034
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Fairfield Inn in a king extended suite from May 7- 14, 2006. We found this to be an excellent choice. The front desk staff was always professional and friendly. The housekeeping staff did a very good job of keeping everything clean. The hotel was occupied by a lot of professionals and tended to be quiet. Loved the pool area for relaxing. Always lots of fresh towels and area kept very clean. The continental breakfast in the morning was very adequate. Would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ghc43
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights while we visited Universal Studios and Adventure Island. My only complaint would be that it is a little hard to find (i.e. easy to miss). When you're travelling East on West Sand Lake Rd. from I-4, you cross International Dr., then Canada Dr. is somewhat hidden on your left, across traffic. Watch very carefully for the sign identifying the hotels that are on Canada Dr. We drove right past it and had to U-turn at Universal Blvd. Our room was very clean and the staff was extremely friendly. We took the shuttle bus to Universal both days and that worked out well. Thanks to Iris at the service desk! The breakfast was fine, just a little crowded around the food bar. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The best experience we've had in Orlando - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, friendly staff, clean and recently rennovated rooms. Great breakfast - which varies from day to day, but during our stay includes fresh pastries, sausage, eggs, porridge etc, all cooked to a high standard. Free vending tea and coffee all night and day (which is great if you are a Brit like us and need a hot tea after a hard day at the parks :-). The pool is big and clean, and the hot outside spa refreshing. All the staff seemed to respect the hotel guests, and the front desk team couldn't do enough to help. It's no surprise to us that this hotel seems to attract lots of business travellers. The only downside is that the property is set back just off I-Drive, so you've got a 5 minute walk to get to and from the I-bus and so on. But this is a price worth paying for the quality of the Fairfield Inn. And one nice touch; on our final day, while we were waiting to be taken to the airport, the reception staff offered us complimentary drinks and snacks - what a nice gesture :-) Well done Marriot - compared to some of the properties we've stayed in in Orlando, you should be extremely proud.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler1974
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! The beds rocked never slept on a hotel bed that was that comfortable before and I even had a feather pillow. The room was very clean and the staff was really nice. The pool was kind of loud there must be an A/C unit back there. The continental breakfast was a little crowded but was a nice spread. It was nicely located not directly on I drive but kind of in the middle and close to everything. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “all we needed”
Reviews.Author: johnnieb
Reviews.Content: clean, well located, nice pool and spa area, room was a basic two double beds "standard room", clean and comfortable, free high speed internet access, decent basic hotel breakfast, Had friends staying across the street at Quality Suites, and thought our basic room was far superior.

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Inn & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 7495 Canada Avenue, Orlando, FL 32819 (Formerly Fairfield Inn & Suites Orlando International Drive)
